loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras De Chuatzam Group

texts.es:
Anabella es una mujer de 24 años de edad es casada con una linda familia de un hijo de tres años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Anabella (la primera del lado derecho) es una mujer que se esfuerza día con día para ofrecerle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida, ella trabaja como ama de casa desde hace 4 años en los alrededores de su comunidad. Le gusta esta actividad pues le permite cuidar mejor de su familia.
La casa de Anabella se encuentra en malas condiciones por lo que es necesario remodelarlo para mejorar la vivienda, aunque se ha esmerado mucho para hacer posible esta remodelación no  ha logrado, por esa razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales como arena, cemento y cal. Su mayor anhelo es  mejorar su casa para que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en: Anabella is a 24-year old woman. She is married with a lovely family and a 3-year old son. This family lives in a community of Sololá. Anabella (the first to the right) is a woman who strives everyday to offer her family better living conditions. She has worked as a housekeeper for 4 years in the outskirts of her community. She likes this job because it allows her to take better care of her family. Anabella's house is in a bad state and it is necessary to remodel it to improve the home. Although she has gone to a lot of effort to make this remodel possible, she has not pulled it off. For that reason she is asking for a loan to buy materials such as sand, cement and plaster. Her biggest wish is to improve her house so that her family lives better.

loans.use: to buy materials such as sand, cement and plaster to remodel her house.

loans.name: Santos Nestor

texts.es:
Santos, está  viviendo solo con su esposa, sus hijos ya viven en otros lugares, ha adoptado el cultivo de granos básicos como una fuente de ingresos y también como una alternativa para tener mejor alimentación para su famililla, trabaja desde muy temprano cada día, él aprendió el oficio de sus padres y tiene toda una vida dedicándose a esta actividad, su mayor ventaja es que trabaja en terrenos propios.
Santos está solicitando un crédito por la necesidad de realizar las actividades agrícolas de esta temporada, comprara abono, insecticidas y herbicidas para que el cultivo de granos básicos le dé una cosecha más abundante, espera poder atender a más personas en su negocio y así generar más ingreso.
Sus aspiraciones son cultivar más granos para poder subsistir junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos lives only with his wife, as his children now live in other places. He has adopted the basic grain crops as a source of income and also as an alternative to give his family better food. He starts work very early in the morning. He learned this job from his parents and has done this work all of his life. His big advantage is that he works on his own land.

Santos is asking for a loan because of the need to do the agricultural jobs this season. He will buy fertilizer, insecticides, and herbicides so that the basic grain crops give him a more abundant harvest. He hopes to be able to serve more people in his business and thus get more income. His aspirations are to grow more grains to be able to survive with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and herbicides so that the basic grain crops give him a more abundant harvest.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a Kiva borrower, and describes himself as being determined. He has 2 children. He operates a retail business where he sells sewing items. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of sewing items for sell. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sewing items.

loans.name: Maurilio

texts.es:
Maurilio con 35 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico,junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente al cultivo de café, de variedad Catimor, las cuáles se encuentran en buen estado, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 08 años. Adicionalmente se desempeña como peón agrícola. El destino del crédito será para invertir en la compra de abonos y en el mantenimiento de su finca de café. De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Maurillo es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Maurilio is 35 years old and lives in his own rustic home, with his spouse and their two children in the Pucara district, Jaen province, Cajamarca area, in Peru. He has very good personal and business references from the residents in the area. The people of this town work mainly in agriculture, trade and cattle farming.

He works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee of the Catimor variety, currently in good condition - he has 8 years' experience in the business. He also works as an agricultural day laborer. 

The purpose of the loan is to invest in the purchase of fertilizer and the upkeep of his coffee farm. This way he will be able to achieve suitable means to improve his quality of life. 

Maurillo is a recurrent member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to invest in fertilizer and the upkeep of his coffee farm.

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.es:
Salvadora, continua teniendo resultados positivos en su negocio al utilizar créditos que se le otorgan en Padecomsm, manifiesta que las ventas han mejorado, pues actualmente su negocio está mucho más surtido, las circunstancias económicas y familiares se mantienen iguales.
Requiere de un nuevo financiamiento para reactivar su negocio, comprara güisquiles, plátanos, bananos, cebollas, uvas, papayas, apio, rábanos, etc., tendrá un mejor inventario de productos frescos para atender diariamente las demandas de sus clientes, espera que las ventas se mantengan.
texts.en:
Salvadora continues having positive results in her business from using the loans that were given to her through Padecomsm. She adds that the sales have improved and currently her business is much more supplied. The economic and family circumstances are the same.

She needs a new loan to reactivate her business. She will buy güisquiles (chayote), bananas, plantains, onions, grapes, papayas, celery, radishes, etc. She will have a better inventory of fresh products to serve her customers every day. She hopes that her sales continue.

loans.use: to buy güisquiles (chayote), bananas, plantains, onions, grapes, papayas, celery, radishes, etc. She will have a better inventory of fresh products to serve her customers every day.

loans.name: Frelex Humberto

texts.es: Frelex, tiene 44 años de edad, está soltero, tiene un hijo con quien vive en un sector del municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Frelex realizaba trabajos asalariados y con el fin de estar más tiempo con su hijo decidió establecer el negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica como ser arroz, azúcar, frijoles, maíz, productos de aseo, lácteos, harina, huevos, café, pan, churros, refrescos etc. este negocio lo tiene hace 5 años, el cual le genera ingresos para ayudar a su hijo y su familia. El préstamo que ha decidido obtener es por 25,000 lempiras para surtir más su negocio con productos como refrescos, granos básicos, productos de higiene, lácteos, verduras, golosinas y abarrotes, con el fin de ampliar su inventario y hacer crecer más el negocio. Su plan es obtener mejores ganancias para seguir ayudando a la familia.
texts.en: Frelex is 44-years old. He is single and has one son whom he lives with in an area of the town of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Frelex used to do salaried jobs, and in order to spend more time with his son, he decided to set up a grocery store business where he sells basic family need products such as rice, sugar, beans, corn, toiletries, dairy products, flour, eggs, coffee, bread, churros, soft drinks, etc. He has had this business for 5 years, which gets him an income to help his son and his family. The loan that he has decided to get is for 25,000 Lempiras to supply his business more with products such as soft drinks, basic grains, hygienic products, dairy products, vegetables, candy and groceries in order to increase his inventory and make his business grow. His plan is to get better earnings to keep helping the family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, basic grains, hygienic products, dairy products, vegetables, candy and groceries to supply his business.

loans.name: Fiaz

texts.en: It was hard for Fiaz  to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. Fiaz  is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother to five children. Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. Now, she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. Fiaz  has gained great confidence in the business as she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina con 46 años de edad, vive sola, en casa alquilada de material rústico,en el distrito de Querocotillo,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú, en una zona rural.Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general como leche,azúcar,arroz,etc, así mismo a la venta de ropa,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 05 años.El destino del crédito será para invertir en compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería. De esta manera le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.

Marina es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ella firma sola.
texts.en:
Marina is 46-years old. She lives alone in a rented house made of rustic material in the district of Querocotillo, Cutervo province and department of Cajamarca, Peru, in a rural area. She has very good personal and work references from the people who live in the area. The people who live in this place mainly work in agriculture, business and livestock.

She works selling general grocery products such as milk, sugar, rice, etc., as well as selling clothing. She has been doing this work for more than 5 years. The destiny of the loan will be used to buy a larger quantity of merchandise. This way she will get a better income and thus be able to improve her quality of life. For this work, there is no better competition in the area, so she can get better prices.

Marina is a recurrent member of Edpyme Alternativa. She is applying alone.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of merchandise.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman and has been blessed with three children who all currently attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are water and school fees.
She wants to start a farming business and sell her products from their home to the local residents. The major challenge she predicts she would face would be rain seasonally.
With the loan of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase seeds and cultivate her land. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to get capital for starting her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and cultivate her land.

loans.name: Beautiful Life Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nượt is 52 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 6 years. Nượt lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover this job is unstable.
The main hardship that Nượt faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.
In 2013, Nượt joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Nượt has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profits, Nượt hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to travel for vacation within the country.
(The child in the photo is a member's granddaughter, she agreed to use this photo on the Kiva website)

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Raquel Elizabeth

texts.es:
Raquel, desarrolla actividades avícolas, mismas que se han convertido en su fuente de subsistencia familiar, ella es muy feliz a lado de su familia integrada por su esposo e hijos, trabaja día con día por mantener funcionando su negocio, sus padres le enseñaron el oficio y por el momento no representa dificultades.
El financiamiento le ayudara a Raquel para comprar 200 pollos, concentrado y vitaminas para alimentarlos y mantenerlos saludables, con ello incrementara su inventario y tendrá la oportunidad de atender a más clientes y generar más ingresos.
Su visión es tener resultados positivos a corto plazo e incrementar sus utilidades.
texts.en: Raquel develops poultry jobs, which have converted into her source of family sustenance. She is very happy by her family made of her husband and children. She works every day to keep her business running. Her parents taught her the job and at the moment there are not any difficulties. The loan will help Raquel to buy 200 chickens, and food and vitamins to feed them and keep them healthy. With this she will increase her inventory and will have the opportunity to serve more customers and get more income. Her vision is to have positive results short term and increase her usefulness.

loans.use: to buy 200 chickens, and food and vitamins to feed them and keep them healthy.

loans.name: Marlon Jeovanny

texts.es:
Marlon, está disfrutando de los resultados positivos que el crédito anterior le dio al utilizarlo en su negocio, pues pudo ampliar los corrales donde tiene el ganado y así mantener su negocio con vida, su grupo familiar se mantiene y desarrolla sus actividades con normalidad.
Para fortalecer aún más su negocio solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar madera y hacer otras reparaciones importantes de los corrales en los que tiene sus animales, se siente motivado por continuar trabajando para subsistir con su familia.
texts.en:
Marlon is enjoying the positive results in his business provided by the previous loan. He was able to expand the pens where he keeps livestock and so keep his business alive, support his family and continue business as usual.

To reinforce his business further he is requesting a new loan to buy wood and to make important repairs to the pens where he keeps his animals. 

He feels motivated to continue working to provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy wood and make important repairs to the pens where he keeps his animals

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz  is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a business of tailoring in her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Shahnaz  is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw materials, she is facing difficulty in meeting the daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested for a loan of PKR 35,000. With the requested loan, she wants  to purchase stitching materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to sew more dresses on time.  She hopes this will increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to sew up more dresses on time.

loans.name: Rosa Anagil

texts.es:
Rosa, por los buenos resultados que tiene al utilizar créditos en su negocio, nuevamente se acerca a Padecomsm para solicitar otro préstamo para utilizarlo en la compra de materiales de costura como: telas, broches, hilos, etc., para fabricar faldas, vestidos y camisas, de esta manera su negocio se mantendrá funcionando.
Con el aporte del crédito anterior pudo entregar a tiempo los pedidos que sus clientes le habían hecho, de esta manera tuvo la facilidad generar más ingresos para cancelar sus deudas y darle una vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Due to the good results achieved by applying loans to her business, Rosa is once again approaching Padecomsm to request a loan to use in the purchase of sewing supplies, such as fabrics, clasps, thread, etc., in order to make skirts, dresses and shirts. 

This way she can keep her business running.

With the help of the previous loan she was able to deliver her clients' orders on time, thereby generating more income to be able to pay her debts and provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies, such as fabrics, clasps, thread, etc., to make skirts, dresses and shirts and so keep her business running.

loans.name: Artesanos Del Barrio 1 Group

texts.es:
Francisca es una señora de 36 años de edad es casada con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 6 y 17 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de San Marcos La Laguna.
Francisca (la primera del lado izquierdo en la foto) sabe muy bien que el dinero no viene por sí solo, sino uno tiene que trabajar para obtenerlo, es por ello que se dedica a la  elaboración de ropa típica y artesanía, con esta labor lleva ella  15 años de realizarlo.
Con el afán de incrementar su negocio y mejorar sus tejidos ha decidido solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y estilos para elaborar hermosos atuendos para este fin de año.
Su mayor anhelo es seguir fortaleciendo su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca is a lady of 36 years of age. She is married and has a beautiful family of three children aged 6 to 17. This humble family lives in a community of San Marcos La Laguna.
Francisca (first one on the left in the photo) knows that money does not come by itself, but one has to work for it. That is why she works in the production of traditional clothing and crafts. She has been in this occupation for 15 years.
In an effort to grow her business and improve the clothing she produces, she has decided to request a loan that will be invested in the purchase of threads of different colors and styles to make beautiful costumes for this new year.
Her greatest desire is to continue to strengthen her business and improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy threads of different colors and styles to make traditional clothing.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Fatoumata est celle qui a levé sa main sur la photo. Elle est  une malienne non scolarisé. Elle est âgée de 40 ans, marié et mère  de 04 enfants, âgés de 6 à  18 ans non  scolarisés son mari est un cultivateur. Fatoumata est une femme battante et courageuse qui rembourse tous ses emprunts du RMCR  elle mène le stockage d’arachides depuis 11 ans. Elle prend le prêt pour acheter  des sacs d’arachides qu’elle revend après. Elle s’approvisionne  dans  les foires environnantes  et revend  ses sacs d’arachide dans les mêmes foires. Le profit qu’elle gagne dans son activité la permet de subvenir à certains besoins de sa famille comme la santé des enfants l’hygiène et leur alimentation.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is the woman with her hand raised in the photo. She is from Mali and never received an education. She is a 40-year-old married mother to four children aged between six and 18 years old who are not currently receiving an education. Her husband works as a farmer.

Fatoumata is a brave, hard-working woman who pays back all her RMCR loans. She has been stocking peanuts for the past 11 years. She is requesting this loan to purchase sacks of peanuts which she will then resell. She gets her supplies from the local markets and resells them at these same markets.

The profits she earns from this business allow her to meet some of her family's needs, such as her children's health, hygiene and food needs.

loans.use: to stock peanuts over the course of eight months.

loans.name: Erasmo

texts.es: Don Erasmo, tiene 75 años de edad, es soltero por viudez, vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Él siempre se ha dedicado al comercio por muchos años. Su actividad de negocio es la venta de nieves (hielo molido con jugo, miel o leche condensada) estos helados los vende de manera ambulante movilizándose en una carretilla en su comunidad y alrededores. También vende frutas de temporada. Ha solicitado varios préstamos para mantener su negocio, actualmente solicita otro ciclo y es por 7,000 Lempiras, para reparación de la bicicleta y carretilla de trabajo. Su objetivo es mantener el negocio activo e incrementar las ventas para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Erasmo is 75 years old, widowed and lives in the community of Choloma, Cortes. He has always worked in trade. 

He works selling snow cones - ground-up ice mixed with juice, honey or condensed milk. He sells these frozen treats as a street vendor, travelling with his cart through his community and the surrounding areas. He also sells seasonal fruits.

He has requested several loans to sustain his business and he is requesting a new one of 7000 Lempiras for the repair of his bicycle and work cart. His goal is to keep his business active and to increase sales to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to repair his bicycle and work cart.

loans.name: Rose Mila

texts.en:
Rose Mila is 45 years old and married with seven children, four of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like spices, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Rose Mila has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like spices, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Isak

texts.en:
Isak is very grateful to all Kiva lenders for the previous loan. The loan has helped him to improve his working conditions. He is still working with water installation, and is employed with a private company, but also works running his small business as a mobile freelance worker when he can.

At this time he is requesting a loan for the same business and the same purpose - to purchase additional, sophisticated tools for his freelance water installation business. He has been working so long that the equipment he has is very worn and damaged and is in need of replacement.

With the loan, he will be able to continue to take on extra jobs and more clients, thereby increasing his income and the standard of living for his family.

He hopes that one day he will be able to have his own full-time private business and is sure he would be successful.

loans.use: to purchase additional sophisticated  tools to  increase his income and the standard of living for his family.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: Suriya is a 48-year-old, hardworking woman who has 3 children. She has been providing sewing and tailoring services in her community. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. When she started her business, Suriya’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. Suriya has requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces in order to meet the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money to ensure that her family has a prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Las Unidas De Sucun Group

texts.es:
Josefa es madre de familia de ocho hijos de las edades entre 7 y 19 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Josefa para sacar adelante a su familia y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica de su región, con este negocio lleva ella 3 años de realizarlo.
Josefa por ser los trajes que vende los más preciados de su región su producto tiene mucha demanda, por esa razón junto a un grupo de personas solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de ropa como: cortes, fajas y güipiles. Con esta inversión ella espera fortalecer su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Josefa is the mother of eight children of ages between seven and 19 years old. This family lives in a community of Sololá. 

She buys and sells typical clothing from her region, so that she can get her family ahead and help her husband with the household expenses. She's been in this business for three years, and since she sells the garments that are most appreciated in her area, the demand is high for her products. This is why she is applying for a loan as part of a group.

Josefa will buy products such as skirts, sashes and huipiles. She hopes with this investment to strengthen her business and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing products such as skirts, sashes and huipiles.

loans.name: Los Trabajadores De Xiprian Group

texts.es:
Julio es un  hombre de 26 años de edad es casado con una linda familia con la que vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Julio para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a  su negocio de venta de leña, con este negocio lleva el 5 años de realizarlo. Pero para obtener mejores ingresos se dedica a la venta de aguacates.
Julio con el afán de incrementar su negocio ha decidido solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de más leña y aguacates para abastecer mejor a sus clientes, pues con la época de fin de año ya se está acercando y con ello la demanda de su producto.
Su mayor anhelo es seguir fortaleciendo su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Julio is 26 years old, married and has a beautiful family, with whom he lives in the community of Solola.

In order to earn a living and provide for his family, Julio works selling firewood, which he has done for 5 years. He also sells avocados to improve his earnings. 

For the purpose of increasing his business, he has decided to request a loan, to be invested in the purchase of more firewood and avocados to further supply his clients, as the New Year season is approaching and with it demand for his product.

His greatest wish is to keep strengthening his business and improving his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy firewood and avocados for his business.

loans.name: Farah

texts.en: Farah is a married woman who has been running her own beauty parlor on her street. She is doing her job passionately; she knows the techniques of makeup and hair design and serves her customers by providing bangles, jewelry, and other items. She is a well-known beautician in her town. Farah is a responsible mother of 5 children. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits, and lightening creams, in order to cater to a large number of customers efficiently and to earn a good amount of income for covering her everyday expenditures.

loans.use: to buy more products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits, and lightening creams.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 28-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of a son.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, so her husband is unable to generate any amount of income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money, her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

Therefore Rabia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business.

Rabia is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Natete Tukwatanize Farmers Group

texts.en:
Kedress is a 36-year-old mother of 3 children living in Kagadi, Uganda. Her major source of income is a retail shop and produce buying and selling. She used the previous loan to buy maize, beans and alcohol for selling. She does not regret the loan, which helped her a lot to look after her children and pay school fees for them.

In future, she has plans of building a house for her family and also to buy a motorcycle for a transport business.

All her businesses are affected by unfavorable weather conditions, on top of price fluctuations. Through this group, Kedress is proud to mention that all group members have been in line to educate their children and support each other in any way.

She wants to use this loan restock the retail shop with sugar, rice, biscuits, sweets and other things ahead of the Christmas season. She is a member of Natete Tukwatanize Farmers Group, where members guarantee each other to get loans, as they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: restock the retail shop

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be ambitious.

He operates a tailoring business where he makes clothes. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his family challenge to be lack of access to clean water.

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a 8,000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use.

He hopes that in the future, he will be able to access clean water.

loans.use: to buy a 8,000 litre water tank

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie, who is in the photograph with Simon, her husband, got a loan from you previously with the intention of building a stable for the animals. However, the medical expenses of her husband and other obligations along this line made Marie spend the loan on such causes, instead of building the stable.

Definitely, she now wants to build the stable, and this is why she's requesting this loan again.

loans.use: to build a stable.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz was living a tough life some years ago; it was very difficult to bear her household expenditures. She is 35 years old, a married woman running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband.

She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has five children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children.

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation; now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo. This will help her increase milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario es una mujer de 25 años de edad es soltera con una linda familia de un hijo de tres años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Rosario es una mujer  que todos los días se esmera para darle a su familia una vida mejor, ella es comerciante desde hace 10 años, realiza esta actividad para generar sus ingresos.  A Rosario le preocupa mucho que a este tiempo no hayan podido finalizar la construcción de su casa, por esa razón solicita un préstamo para poder comprar materiales como; cemento, arena y block. Su mayor anhelo es finalizar la construcción de su casa lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Rosario is a 25-year-old, single woman. She and her three-year-old son are a beautiful family that lives in the community of Sololá.

Rosario works hard every day to give her family a better life. She has been a businesswoman for ten years; this is how she earns an income.

Rosario is very worried because she has not been able yet to finish building her house. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, and bricks. Her biggest wish is to finish building her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, and bricks.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio es estudiante de la carrera de Veterinaria, tiene 23 años es soltera vive con sus padres y hermanos, su aspiración es terminar la carrera y ayudar a su familia.
Ella está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante, y es por eso que pone todo de sí para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y comprar materiales de estudios.
texts.en:
Rocio is studying for a degree in veterinary sciences. She is 23, single, and lives with her parents and siblings. Her goal is to complete the degree and help her family, and she is giving all of herself to grow, get ahead, and improve her living conditions. 

Rocio is applying for this loan to be able to cover university fees and buy her study materials.

loans.use: to pay university fees and buy study materials for her degree in veterinary sciences.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is 41 years old, a married lady. She has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices, and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Bushra makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers.

In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.

Bushra wishes to utilize part of her revenues to provide a good quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates to make her stock available for her customers

loans.name: Hương's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hương is 39 years old and she is married. Hương lives in Yen Dinh district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for six years. The main hardship that Hương faces is a lack of capital.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods to sell.

In 2013, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Hương hopes to maintain a successful business. She also hopes for her children to do well in school and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Anastasia Cecilia

texts.es:
Anastasia es una mujer de 20 años de edad es casada con una familia de un hijo, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Anastasia para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a tejer güipiles típicos de su región, con esta actividad lleva ella 5 años de realizarlo le gusta hacerlo pues lo hace desde la comodidad de su hogar.
Anastasia con el afán de comparar más productos para la elaboración de güipiles ha tomado la iniciativa de solicitar un préstamo para la compra de hilos de diferentes colores y estilos y así elaborar este fin de año hermosos atuendos.
Su gran sueño es fortalecer su negocio, contar con su propio local de negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Anastasia is a 20-year-old woman, married, and has a son. They live in the community of Sololá.

Anastasia makes güipiles [traditional garment worn by indigenous women from Central America] to earn an income and get ahead with her family. She has been doing this for five years. She likes to do it because she can work at home.

Anastasia needs to buy more materials to make güipiles, so she decided to apply for a loan to buy threads of different colors and styles, with the intention to make these beautiful garments now that the year is coming to an end.

Her big dream is to strengthen her business, open her own establishment, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy threads of different colors and styles.

loans.name: Mirna Angélica

texts.es:
Mirna es una mujer de 24 años de edad es soltera con una linda familia con la que vive en una comunidad de Panajachel.
Mirna es comerciante cuenta con un negocio de ropa de paca este negocio lo tiene ella desde hace 1 año, esta actividad lo realiza ella con el fin de obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia.
Mirna con el afán de ampliar su negocio ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para la compra de más ropa de paca esto para abastecer mejor las necesidades de los clientes y por su puesto mejorar sus ingresos. Su mayor sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mirna is a 24-year-old woman. She is single and has a beautiful family. They live in the community of Panajachel.

Mirna is a businesswoman. She has been selling clothes from bales for a year. She does this to earn an income and maintain her family.

Mirna, thinking of expanding her business, has decided to apply for a loan to buy more clothes in bales, in order to better fulfill her customers' needs, and of course to improve her income.

Her biggest dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy used clothes.

loans.name: Analia

texts.es:
Analia continua con sus estudios de derecho, esta poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder conseguir sus metas y anhelos, comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso en comprar libros y cubrir otros gastos de la universidad, agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Analia continues with her studies for a law degree. She is putting her greatest effort into achieving her goals and aspirations. 

She comments that her prior loan was used to buy books and cover other university expenses, and she is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to improve her living conditions.

Analia is requesting this new loan to be able to cover her university fees.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Miodrag

texts.en:
Miodrag wants to thank all of the lenders for helping him to purchase food and products for his small market for selling food and beverages in the minority community where he lives. He has been working in his shop with his wife and has been able to expand his shop by adding various products. His daughter is now 17 years old and has just finished high school, so he is hoping that she will be able to start working part time at the shop as well.

At this time Miodrag is in need again for a loan and for the same business in order to purchase more food to sell and to renovate his shop. Miodrag is hoping that the loan will help him again to generate more income for his family by attracting new customers and encouraging his customers to keep returning.

He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their support as the loan will help him to continue to improve his family's living conditions and allow him to continue with his business.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell and to renovate his shop, attracting new customers and encouraging his customers to keep returning.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 37 years old, a married woman and a mother of six children. She has been doing tailoring for many years to help her husband with the expenses. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household together with the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well.

Together with her husband, Shazia manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread, and packs of buttons, ribbons and laces so as to meet orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

Shazia hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, ribbons, and laces so as to meet orders on time.

loans.name: Ilena

texts.es: Ilena continua con sus estudios en administración de empresas, es una mujer muy sacrificada que se esfuerza por poder cumplir sus anhelos de ser una profesional útil a la sociedad. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en pagar las cuotas de su carrera y algunos derechos de examen. Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para el pago de las cuotas de su carrera y la compra de libros.
texts.en:
Ilena continues studying Business Administration. She is a hardworking woman who fights to achieve her dreams and become a professional that is useful for her society.

She says that she used the previous loan to pay the university fees and some examination fees.

She is requesting this new loan to pay the university fees and buy some books.

loans.use: to pay university fees and buy books.

loans.name: Catalino

texts.es:
Catalino es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, tiene 24 años, está cursando el 4to. Año de la carrera de Derecho, comenta que está trabajando en un banco, y  gracias a eso puede estudiar su carrera y su objetivo es terminar el año que viene sus estudios, así poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar la cuota de su carrera y también cubrir el gasto de transporte que tiene.
texts.en:
Catalino is from the city of Caaguazú. He is 24 years old and is in his fourth year of Law. He comments that he is working at a bank, and thanks to that job, he is able to study for his degree. His goal is to complete his studies by next year, so he can help his family.

He is requesting this loan to pay tuition fees for his major and also to cover his transportation expenses.

loans.use: to pay college tuition fees and cover transportation expenses.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura es de la ciudad de Pilar, está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería comercial, y a la vez está trabajando para poder tener los medios para poder cubrir los gastos de sus estudios. Comenta que con sacrificio ya está en el cuarto año de la carrera.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la cuota de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios, luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Laura lives in the city of Pilar. She is studying commercial engineering and working at the same time in order to have the means to cover her college expenses. She says that thanks to her hard work she's been able to make it to the fourth year on her career.
She is asking for a loan to pay for college tuition and to be able to continue to study and figthing for her goals.

loans.use: to pay college tuition

loans.name: Mukadama

texts.en:
Mukadama lives with her family in the capital of Tajikistan. She is married and has four children. Her husband Manuchehr is an entrepreneur. Mukadama has been working at her sewing business for more than seven years. She has a workshop where she serves her clients.

Mukadama sews a variety of women's clothing and she has regular customers, thanks the quality of her service. Mukadama is going to buy a new sewing machine since her sewing machine is broken. Also, she wants to buy fabrics so as to increase her working capital. She awaits your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabrics so as to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary owns a rice paddy and sells her rice to local inhabitants. She is a 41-year-old married woman and has five children. Her oldest child is 20 while the youngest is 10. She hails from the town of Talibon. Aside from farming, she also raises hogs.

Mary faces challenges in earning her livelihood: the lack of capital and the high cost of farm maintenance. She would like to buy fertilizers to reap a bountiful harvest. These would help her boost her business.

With these, she would able to earn more than usual and rebuild her current source of income to become sustainable and to continue to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, charcoal, soap and other items.

She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. Her business goal is to be an importer of products within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open another shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years and a mother of two whose spouse provides additional income.

She is contractor at Mombasa, Kenya, and she has been in this business for the last seven years doing great.

This is her first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase timber for making doors and frames in her rentals.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to repay her loan and educate her children.

She hopes to lead in the market in future.

loans.use: to purchase timber for making doors and frames in her rentals.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business.

Ester has been operating her own fruit and vegetable stand for years, and she earns well from this. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. The couple have had to work hard, but they are determined to get a better income in order to provide their children with a better education, which they don't currently have.

To improve sales, Ester would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional fruits and vegetables. With an amount of PHP 15,000, she can already purchase more quantity and variety of fruits, veggies and other items needed to expand her inventory.

She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Ester hopes to grow her business so she can give her children a good quality education, and likewise to enable her to help others in need. She is consistent in attending her weekly fellowship group for CCT partners which consists of 15 to 30 members. Here the members gain spiritual strength from other members' life changing testimonies, share their own experience of God’s love, repay microfinance loans, and hear God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to have supplementary capital for buying fresh vegetables every morning for her business.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is 38 years old, a divorced woman. She has three children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, she has been running a cloth purchase-and-resale business. She buys cloth of various fabrics, in different colors and designs, from the market at wholesale rates and then sells it to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Salima expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 58 years old. She is married and blessed with one child.

Her business is dress making. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy a sewing machine.

She will use the profits from expanded business to build rental houses.

Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business and get bigger profits.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Dhimiter

texts.en:
Dhimiter repairs home appliances. Annual income from this activity adds up to approximately $1,000.

In the three dynym agricultural land that his family owns, they just plant for family consumption. He also has four beehives from which he sells raw honey. However, he sold no honey this past year and the reason is that they did not produce as in previous times, Dhimiter's stated.

He wants to buy replacement parts for his business.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his refrigerator and washing machine repair business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 51 years old, married, and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan.

She aspires to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo está integrado por 17 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Encarnación, trabajan dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, una humilde vendedora de ropas, se destaca por ser una persona muy optimista, trabajadora y sacrificada, que lucha para poder crecer y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, y que no tengan que pasar por necesidades como las que ella paso.
Pide este préstamo ya que quiere comprar mayor cantidad de prendas y poder ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes, como ser: remeras, camisas, pantalones, jeans y otros, y así seguir con sus ventas. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This group is composed of 17 women, all of them friends and neighbors in the city of Encarnación. They are working in the elimination of poverty program, working hard to improve their life conditions.
Maria is one of the members. She is a humble clothes sales person. She is very optimistic, hard working and self-sacrificing, she fights to be able to grow and give her family a better quality of life, so they won't have to go through the struggles she had to go through.
She is asking for this loan to buy clothes in bulk to be able to offer a larger variety to her customers, such as tee shirts, shirts, slacks, jeans and other items, to keep up with sales. She is thankful for this opportunity to better helself.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes to resell such as tee shirts, shirts, slacks, jeans and other clothes

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Antonio  está en el 2do. ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están trabajando para poder mejorar sus vidas a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Marina quien se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace, es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que se esfuerza por poder salir y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The San Antonio group is in its 2nd cycle of the women's committee program where they all work in order to improve their lives through poverty elimination program. 
One of the members is Mrs. Marina who makes a living selling food that she makes herself. She is a hard working person, a fighter who does her best to get ahead and improve her life conditions as well as those of her loved ones.
She is requesting the loan to purchase cooking ingredients to make her meals such as vegetables, meat, condiments and others in order to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: purchase ingredients for preparing meals such as: vegetables, meat, condiments and others

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres Trabajadoras, ya que eso es lo que son ellas, mujeres que trabajan para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias, por medio de su esfuerzo y a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Delia quien es vendedora de frutas y verduras, comenta que por medio de sus ventas tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que con sacrificio está saliendo adelante, pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas y verduras frescas de estación, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, y luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group goes by the name "Working Women" because that is what they are. Women who work to be able to improve their lives and those of their families through their effort and through the poverty elimination program.
One of the members is Mrs. Delia, who sells fruits and vegetables, she comments that through her sales she has the means to be able to help her loved ones. She is a very hard-working person who is getting ahead through sacrifice. She requests this loan to be able to purchase fresh, in-season fruits and vegetables, this way she will be able to continue with her sales, fighting to improve her life conditions.

loans.use: purchase fresh fruit and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Para La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El grupo esta trabajando dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, como medio de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Cada una pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder lograrlo, pero una de las integrantes que se destaca es la Sra. Eva Eva quien vende Comestibles que ella misma se encarga de hacer todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día. Ella recorre casa por casa y de esa manera tiene los medios para ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Eva pide este préstamo para la compra de materias primas como (carne, pan, hortalizas, entre otros) y de esa manera poder seguir con la elaboración y venta de sus comidas.
texts.en:
This group is participating in the elimination of poverty program, to improve their quality of life as well as their families'.
Every one of them puts in the effort to achieve that goal, but one their members stands outs. Eva sells meals that she makes herself every day, starting very early in the morning. She sells them door to door to get the means to  help her family.
Eva is asking for this loan to buy raw materials such as meat, bread, green vegetables and others to make and sell her products.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare meals to sell such as meat, bread, green vegetables and other items

loans.name: Mujeres Laboriosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Laboriosas  está en el 3º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Teresa  ella se desempeña como tesorera del grupo y se dedica a la venta de comidas dulces y saladas, tiene muchos clientes que siempre compran de ella sus comidas, y es por eso que le va muy bien. Ella es una persona muy sacrificada que lucha por poder crecer y salir adelante a través de sus esfuerzos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas de comidas, como ser: harina, carne, azúcar, huevo, manteca, verduras, y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Laboriosas group is in its third cycle of the women's committee program, where everyone works and helps each other get ahead. They are participating in the survey to eliminate poverty, striving to improve their living conditions.

One of the members of the group is Teresa. She is the treasurer for the group and makes a living selling sweet and savory dishes. She has many customers who always buy her dishes, so she is doing really well. She is a self-sacrificing person who strives to grow and get ahead through her own efforts.

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of supplies, such as flour, meat, sugar, eggs, lard, vegetables, etc., so she can keep selling her dishes. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving so she can continue with her studies.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make dishes, such as flour, meat, sugar, eggs, lard, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Hương is 44 years old and she is married. Hương lives in Yen Dinh district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover her job is unstable.

She has worked in agriculture, raising cows, for 10 years. The main hardship that Hương faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase a baby cow to raise and sell in future.

In 2014, Hương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

Hương hopes for her children to do well in school and for her family to be healthy and happy. With her business profit, she hopes to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a baby cow to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis is farmer living in Mayisyan village of the Armavir region. Sargis is a father of two little children and a loving husband.

He is a teacher by profession, with a university degree, working at the local village school.

He keeps two oxen, pigs, piglets and hens. He also cultivates tomato, apricot and plum. Sargis gets income from selling the harvest and milk products in local markets.

He asks this loan to strengthen and develop his farm. With the requested loan, Sargis plans to purchase 10 piglets, forage for feeding the livestock and fertilizer for land cultivation. He hopes to receive this support and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for 10 piglets, forage for feeding the livestock and fertilizer for land cultivation.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es de la ciudad de Itá, ella está estudiando la carrera de informática, y por medio de sus estudios quiere poder abrirse camino al mundo laboral y ayudar a su familia.
Ella quiere recibir su título y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y la de su familia, y superarse como persona y profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Julia is from the city of Itá. She is studying computer sciences, and through her studies she wants to make her way in the working world and help her family. 

Julia wants to receive her degree, improve living conditions for herself and her family, and better herself both personally and professionally. She is applying for this loan to be able to pay the fees for her career studies.

loans.use: to pay the fees for her career studies in computer sciences.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a woman with one child. She describes herself as hardworking.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.

She hopes that in the future, she will open a boutique. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She repaid previous loans successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
Marte is in the photograph with Ded, her husband. They previously started doing some repairs to their home, but they did not finish.

"Our house is really run down and as such it needs a lot of work and lots of money, too. We have our three little grand kids living with us, and that makes the repairs mandatory," said Marte to the branch assistant.

loans.use: to continue with the repairs the family's rundown home.

loans.name: Blanca Ligia

texts.en:
Blanca is 73 years old and is a happy, married woman. She lives in the municipality of Envigado and has 7 children, who she feels really proud of. Her family is the greatest thing in her life and something that makes her feel accomplished in life. However, she has also been working all her life, for more than 50 years. She has owned a clothes-making business since 1960 which has allowed her to provide for her family.

Now she wants to expand her business, but for this she needs capital that she doesn’t have right now, and it’s important to note that the inputs are expensive. Therefore she’s asking for a loan to enable her to buy a plain sewing machine to improve her production and to increase her clients.

Blanca has many dreams, but her biggest one regards her family. She wants to buy a house where her whole family can live comfortably and safely, and this will make her feel really good and satisfied.

Please help Blanca to accomplish all her dreams, and a loan will bring her much closer to that.

loans.use: to buy a plain sewing machine to enable her to improve her production.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El señor  tiene 56 años de edad es casado. Por mas de treinta años ha trabajado en la mina de su estado como mecánico. Fue asaltado y golpeado cuando regresaba de la jornada laboral. A raíz de esto sufrió secuelas en el ojo derecho el cual presenta desprendimiento de retina, por lo que necesita diferentes tratamientos quirúrgicos los cuales le resultan  costosos. En su trabajo no ha recibido ningún apoyo al contrario esta en riesgo de perder su trabajo debido a que tiene dificultad para trabajar, tiene mas de tres meses en esta situación.
texts.en:
He is 56 years old and married. He has worked as a mechanic at the mine in his state for over 30 years. He was assaulted and beaten up when he was returning from his work day. The after-affect he suffered from this is a detached retina in his right eye.

Therefore, he needs different surgical treatments, which are expensive. He has received no support from his work. To the contrary, he is at risk of losing his job because he it is difficult for him to work. He has been in this situation for over three months.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El es un joven de 33 años de edad es casado, tiene dos hijos de tres y cinco años de edad. Nació con un problema visual donde el puede ver de cerca pero de lejos no por lo que depende en todo momento de sus lentes de contacto. A temprana edad le detectaron esta anomalía, él trabaja como auxiliar de enfermería y en la clínica donde trabaja le han realizado  estudios y es candidato a la cirugía para dejar los lentes de contacto definitivamente. Desgraciadamente con cuenta de momento con los recursos necesarios para solventar la cirugía.
texts.en:
He is 33 years old and married. He has two children, ages three and five. He was born with a vision problem where he is able to see up close but not in the distance. Therefore, he is dependent upon contact lenses at all times. This defect was diagnosed at an early age.

He works as a nurse's aide. In the clinic where he works they have done studies, and he is a candidate for surgery so that he will no longer need contacts. Unfortunately, at this time he does not have the resources needed to pay for the surgery.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Tudo Vai Da Certo Group

texts.pt:
O grupo Tudo vai da certo se conheceram no próprio local de trabalho, são amigas e cada mutuaria tem uma loja próximo a outra no mesmo espaço. O grupo já solicitou nove empréstimos com o Banco do Povo (BPCS). Graziela e Rosimeire, vendem acessórios para celular e Verônica vende tênis.
Risoleta é a líder do grupo e tem 42 anos. Ela é casado tem  dois filho mora com seu esposo no Município de Maua em São Paulo. Ela é uma pessoa muito carinhosa, honesta, batalhadora tem muito carinho com seu trabalho.
         Risoleta vende acessórios para celular e com o seu trabalho ajuda no sustento de casa .Ela trabalhar a mais de 5 anos com estes artigos e tem muita experiência. Iniciou o trabalhar nesta área porque já tinha trabalhado como vendedora e com sua experiência, decidiu trabalhar com um produto que muitas pessoas compram frequentemente. A atividade dela  e especial porque com o seu trabalho ela pode ajudar com uma renda a mais em casa e investir na educação do filho. Ela se sente orgulhosa por que tinha um sonho que se transformou em realidade.
        Risoleta precisa de um empréstimo para a compra de capas, películas para celular, cartão de memória, pen drive. A renda extra deste empréstimo permitirá que ela invista na loja, e poupe uma parte. No futuro, ela pretende trocar de carro e viajar com a família. 
O grupo queria dizer aos investidores, que se sentem feliz por saber que existem pessoas solidárias e que se preocupam com o próximo.
texts.en:
The members of the "Tudo vai da certo" [Everything will be fine] group met while working. They are friends, and each member has their store next to each other. The group has already requested nine loans at Banco do Povo (BPCS). Graziela and Rosimeire sell cell phone accessories, and Verônica sells tennis shoes.

Risoleta is the leader of this group. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband in the municipality of Maua, in São Paulo. She is a very loving, honest, and hardworking woman who loves her job.

Risoleta sells cell phone accessories; this is how she contributes to the home's sustenance. She has done this for more than five years and has a great experience. She started to work in this area because she had worked as a saleswoman before, and with her experience, she decided to work with a product that many people frequently buy.

Her activity is special, because with her job, she can contribute to her family with an additional income, and pay her children's education. She feels proud because her dream came true.

Risoleta needs a loan to buy covers, screen protectors, memory cards, and pen drives. The additional income resulting from this loan will help her to invest in her store, and have a little extra for her personal expenses. In the future, she plans to change her car and travel with her family.

This group wants to tell Kiva lenders that they feel happy of knowing that there exist supportive people that care about others.

loans.use: to buy covers, protective screens, memory cards, and pen drives.

loans.name: Costa San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo Costa San Antonio está en su ciclo 23 del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las personas que se esmera por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos es la Sra. Nancy, quien se dedica a la venta de leche, comenta que tiene muchos clientes que siempre le hacen muchos pedidos y todos los días empieza su trabajo desde muy temprano para que sus clientes tengan la leche para el desayuno.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de leche en cantidad, de manera a poder seguir cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes, y mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia por medio de su trabajo.
texts.en:
The Costa San Antonio group is in its 23rd cycle of the Women's Committee program. They belong to the poverty elimination program, where each gives their best effort to be able to grow and get ahead in life. 
One of the people who is striving to improve her life conditions, and those of her loved ones, is Mrs. Nancy. She sells milk and comments that she has a lot of clients who always make large orders and every day she begins her work very early so that her clients can have their milk for breakfast.
She is requesting the loan to invest it in the purchase of milk in large quantities, this way she will be able to continue meeting her client's orders and improving her life conditions, and those of her loved ones, through her job.

loans.use: purchase milk in quantity for sale.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama SANTA ANA, es un grupo antiguo y numeroso, se encuentran en el octavo ciclo del programa de comités, con 18 integrantes, ellas están agradecidas y orgullosas por formar parte de este programa que les brinda la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Marisa, quien se destaca por su espíritu emprendedor, trabaja desde su propia casa, cuenta con una pequeña mercería, donde tiene todo tipo de productos variados.
La Sra. Marisa pide este préstamo para la compra de productos variados para la venta, como ser calzados, prendas variadas, y artículos de bazar, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
This committe is called Santa Ana. This is large and old group on their eighth cycle of loan in the committee program, with 18 members. They are very grateful and proud to be part of this program provided by Fundacion Paraguaya.
One of the members is Marisa, has an entrepreneurial spirit. She owns a notions store where she sells a variety of products.
Marisa is asking for a loan to buy miscellaneous items to resell such as shoes, chothes and kitchen items in order to generate more sells. She is thankful for this opportunity to continue to grow and improve every day.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products such as shoes, miscellaneous clothes, kitchen items and others

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 30-year-old man who raises pigs to earn a living. He has been doing this for three years. He is from Clarin, Bohol, and he is married and blessed with a five-year-old daughter.

John needs to work hard to provide for the needs of his family. He is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, and to buy feed.

In the future, John aspires to augment his livelihood in order to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una señora  de 63 años de edad es casada, y se encuentra jubilada. Desde edad temprana fue diagnosticada con una enfermedad crónica y nunca llevo un tratamiento adecuado debido a esto ahora  tiene problemas en su retina lo que no le permite ver bien. Por tal motivo tampoco puede estar sola, su esposo en todo momento la acompaña. Necesita urgentemente una cirugía para recuperar su vista. Sus recursos no le alcanzan para solventar el tratamiento.
texts.en:
She is 63 years old and married. She is retired. At an early age she was diagnosed with a chronic illness, and it was never treated adequately. Because of this, she now has problems with her retina that do not allow her to see well. For this reason she is not able to be alone. He husband is with her at all times.

She urgently needs surgery to recover her vision. She does not have enough resource to pay for the treatment.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Meswalehe

texts.en:
Meswalehe is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over two years, Meswalehe has been operating an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of lack of capital in her business.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Gerarda

texts.en:
Gerarda is a 47-year-old mother of four from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She learned how to do farming after being married to a farmer, and she has been in this business for 18 years now. She grows rice and vegetables in order to provide for her children.

She is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and spray for her farm. Gerarda's hard work will mean that her family can have something to eat out of their harvest, and an income too to cover the needs of her children.

Her profit goes towards her children's education.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and spray

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena is 51 years old. She is married and blessed with 4 children.

Her business is farming, and she has been in this business for 4 years. She earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. She will use the profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business and have a healthy, educated family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El es un señor de 49 años de edad es casado. Trabaja en una constructora como supervisor en obras de construcción, la mayoría del tiempo tiene que estar bajo la luz del sol.
Hace  meses empezó a notar un lesión en su ojo derecho la cual ha crecido presentando dolor, esta sometido a un tratamiento de gotas para desinflamar y se pued extirpar la lesión, la cirugía es complicada e incluso costosa. El seguro social le ha negado este servicio debido a que no lo realizan, desafortunadamente por el momento no cuenta con los recursos suficientes, debido a que él es el único sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
He is 49 years old and married. He works as an on-site construction supervisor. Most of the time he needs to be under the sun's light. Months ago he started to note a lesion on his right eye that has grown and is causing pain. He is under treatment with drops to reduce the inflammation. They can remove the lesion, but the surgery is complicated and expensive.

He has not had the surgery because social security has denied coverage. Unfortunately, he does not now have enough resources because he is the sole support of his family.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Shadow Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nhân is 41 years old and married. She has done business for 10 years. Nhân lives in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Nhân faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods to resell.

This is Nhân first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Nhân hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to resell.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson requests funds to buy three bulls that he will sell during the festive season when the prices go higher.

Benson is hard working and honest and appreciative of the Kiva support and partnership.

Previously, Benson was able to purchase a dairy cow, that has even given birth and has increased his income, since he sells their milk.

Bemson is doing all that it takes to repay his loans so that he can qualify for more funding.

loans.use: to buy bulls that he will sell.

loans.name: Rifat

texts.en:
Rifat is a 46-year-old married woman with 3 children.

She is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands, and her skill is known throughout the town.

Some years back, she was hardly able to manage her household activities with only her husband's small income. Then, through loans from the Kashf Foundation, she initiated her hand embroidery business.

Rifat has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads and frames to meet her customers' orders on time and to earn a good amount of profit.

This financial help can take Rifat closer to her dream of providing her children with a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads and frames in order to meet her customers' orders on time and to earn a good amount of profit

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 41 years old and married to Lazaro, and blessed with two children aged 14 and 12.

She has been a tailor for 13 years and earns a monthly income of Kshs. 25,000.

This being her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, she intends to buy materials for dressmaking.

Emily hopes to help pay school fees for their children from her profits. Her dream is to open up more outlets in town.

loans.use: to purchase materials for dressmaking.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es una mujer de 23 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 5 años y una hija de 1 año, y su negocio s la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, luchadora y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la popular zona ‘16 de julio’ dónde e se realiza la tradicional feria los días jueves y domingo, donde –se dice- se puede encontrar desde una aguja hasta un camión. 
Silvia es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, su forma de vestir es tradicional (manta, sombrero y pollera) y su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y en su círculo social y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto propiedad de la familia, construido de adobe que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida como; el “pesq’e” de quinua, la preparación es sencilla, se lava la quinua para hervirla y una vez cocida, se agrega leche, mantequilla y a veces huevo, “el preparado queda como una crema de buen sabor, para después servirla y adornarla con queso rallado…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque el precio de la comida es accesible a todo público.
