La ventaja de su negocio e que la comida es muy popular y tiene demanda, la desventaja es que no cuenta con ayuda para abastecer la demanda. Su sueño es estabilizar su negocio, ella desea comprar insumos de cocina como, quinua, arroz, fideo, aceite, queso, carne, huevo, leche y otros. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Silvia solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de cocina por mayor para cocinar comida tradicional.
texts.en:
Silva is a 23 year single old woman with a five year old son, and a one year old daughter. Her business is the sale of traditional food. She is a good mother, and a hardworking, responsible person. She conducts her business in the popular “16 de julio” area where the traditional fair is held on Thursdays and Sundays, a place where they say that you can find anything from a needle to a truck.

Silvia has a dark complexion, and long black hair that she wears in a braid. She wears traditional clothing (a shawl, hat, and skirt). Her native language is Aymará, which she speaks with her family and her social circle, and she speaks Spanish in the general culture and in her business. She shares her life with children that are not yet school age. They live in a family-owned room built of adobe that has potable water, electricity, and a sewer system.

In her business, she sells food such as “pesq’e” de quinua”. The preparation is simple: she washes the quinoa, boils it, and once cooked; she adds milk, butter, and sometimes eggs. “The preparation results in a good cream flavor, which may then be served and garnished with grated cheese”, she says. Her business is successful because her price is affordable to the public. She has an advantage because her food is very popular and in demand, but the disadvantage is that she doesn’t have help to meet the demand.

Her dream is to stabilize her business, and she wishes to purchase kitchen supplies such as quinoa, rice, noodles, oil, cheese, meat, eggs, milk, and others. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the three years that she has been in business. For this reason, Silvia is requesting a loan to purchase wholesale kitchen supplies to cook traditional meals.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale kitchen supplies to cook traditional meals.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses has been dealing in bags and shoes for 20 years and he is so happy about the progress of his business.

Moses has managed to take very good care of his family without any complaint. However, Moses has bigger dreams of owning a wholesale, renown boutique serving his customers with different fashions and designs.

At this time, Moses intends to buy more shoes, and women bags to sell this festive season.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and bags to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married mother with two school going children. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, Janet has sold shoes from door to door to neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost and lack of capital.

With the loan Janet is requesting Kes 50,000 to purchase second hand shoes for resale.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase second hand shoes for resale.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 28-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband in improving their financial situation, so she started a business selling clothes. She believed she could earn some respect and make a better world for her children, and contribute to their education.

Asia is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase good quality cloth of different colors, and she hopes to earn substantial profits through this investment.

This loan will help her to have a decent life and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good quality cloth of different colors, and then to earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.name: Kongneou

texts.en:
Kongneou is 25 years old, a single student from the Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia.

He is a finance and banking major at a university. In order to support his studies, he also works at a children's center in the city. Being on staff, Kongneou can earn approximately $6.60 per day.

Kongneou is in his third year at the university, and since he is lacking finances to pay his tuition fees of the third year, he requested a loan, which will help him finish his third year successfully.

In the future, he plans on finding a better job with a bank with a reasonable salary.

loans.use: to pay his school's tuition fees.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité MUJERES TRIUNFADORAS está en el 5to. ciclo donde todas han demostrado laboriosidad y capacidad para trabajar en equipo. El grupo es antiguo y bastante unido, con  la  plena convicción de trabajar y ayudarse todas juntas, así facilitar el progreso y calidad de vida de todas.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Leonarda , ella es muy trabajadora, ella cría animales y también realiza bordados y todo tipo de trabajos de choché como zapatillas bordadas, bolsos, carteritas, vinchas, gorros entre otros.
Ella pide este préstamo para la compra de animales para la cría y también de balanceados para poder seguir con la cría de animales como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Triunfadoras committee is in the fifth cycle, where they have all demonstrated dedication and teamwork ability. This is an old group, rather cohesive, holding a strong belief in working all together and helping each other to facilitate their progress and quality of life.

Leonarda is one of the members. She works hard raising animals, and she also does embroidery and all kinds of crochet needlework including embroidered slippers, bags, little pouches, hairbands and hats. 

She is applying for this loan to buy animals for raising, as well as to buy balanced feed so she can continue with this work as she has been doing. Leonarda is grateful for the oppportunity she is receiving to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy animals for raising and balanced feed for the same.

loans.name: Live Happy Everyday Group

texts.en:
Vân is 46 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant where she sells snacks for 7 years. Vân lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household, and market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Vân faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more supplies to maintain her small restaurant where she sells food for breakfast.

This is Vân's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profits, Vân hopes for her children to find good jobs, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies to maintain her small restaurant where she sells breakfast food.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, fabric conditioner, and a variety of canned goods.

She is a 35-year-old married woman and has four children. Her oldest is 14 while her youngest is four.
Her income goes to food and school expenses. Her husband works abroad.

Demands on basic commodities are at a peak now. But unfortunately, she has very low purchasing capability to cope with these demands.

She is asking for a loan to acquire additional stocks like rice, soft drinks, and assorted groceries. With these, she could manage the flow of merchandise on her store and be able to pay her obligations.

Marita is determined that she could make her business to be more productive in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to acquire additional stocks like rice, soft drinks and assorted groceries

loans.name: Juntas Podemos Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Juntas Podemos está en su ciclo número 3º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, a través del trabajo en equipo con que cuenta el  grupo. Todas  se han comprometido a  trabajar y a realizar actividades   para llegar a los objetivos en común que tienen dentro del  grupo. 
La Sra. Lourdes, una de las integrantes ha logrado aumentan la variedad de productos que vende en su despensa y poco a poco la ha ido mejorando, ella es una una persona muy sacrificada que con la lucha diaria ha podido crecer.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, enlatados, panificados, bebidas y otros, de manera a poder seguir creciendo y mejorando cada día.
texts.en:
Juntas Podemos group is going through its 3rd cycle with the women's committee program, where they all work hard and help one another to get ahead, thanks to their team efforts. They are all committed to work and finish their activities to reach their common goals as a group.
Lourdes is one of the members. She's managed to increase stock at her grocery store little by little and she's made improvements. She is very self-sacrificing and she fights every day to be able to grow.
She is asking for this loan to buy grocery products for her store such as vegetables, fruit, canned items, breed, drinks and others in order to grow and improve every day.

loans.use: to buy a variety of grocery products such as vegetables, fruit, canned items, breed, drinks and others

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 27 years old and she is married with 2 children.

She has had a dairy farming business for 3 years. She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya. She will be using the loan to buy animal feeds for her cows so they will produce more milk and better milk, and thus increase her income.

She will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan and to buy another cow.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to live a happy life.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for her cows so they will produce more milk and better milk, and thus increase her income.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother who supports one person in her family. She operates a grocery store, a business she has been doing for the last two years that generates a monthly income of KES. 30,000.

She has requested her second loan with Visionfund Kenya which she will use to purchase more vegetables for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida works hard to support six children. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines.

Florida requested a PHP 5400 loan through NWTF to invest in a a sanitary toilet.

Florida is aware that the sanitary toilet will not only save money, help the environment and reduce health problem due to spread of common diseases.

loans.use: to purchase materials to construct a sanitary toilet.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 43 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell.

Marissa has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with two children and she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell. Josephine has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Davida

texts.en:
Davita's husband became ill some months back and she had no money to pay for the medical expenses and visitation to a health specialist.

At that time, she had no money to pay for all the expenses. Therefore, they borrowed from relatives with the promise that they would pay them back before the end of this year. This is why she is requesting this loan.

loans.use: to repay a debt for her husband's medical visitation and expenses.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is a married mother of two children, whom all attend school. She lives at her house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatma operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her village for the past five years. She faces major challenges of seasonality and transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding to increase her monthly income.

With the loan of Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal for resale and to pay for transport. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal for resale and to pay for transport.

loans.name: Fexhrije

texts.en:
To help support her family, Fexhrije keeps cows and sells their milk and dairy products.

Her cow is currently not producing milk and this has impacted her family's income.

Fexhrije is requesting a loan to purchase a new cow so she can sell milk.

Fexhrije's husband works for an electrical company, but the money he earns is not enough to meet their daily needs.

She is very happy and grateful for Kiva's lenders for his opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase a new milk cow.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “La Esperanza” está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cintia, quien es una persona muy sacrificada y emprendedora que se esfuerza por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas y calzados variados, comenta que poco a poco ha ido creciendo y mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Tiene muchos clientes y ha ido mejorando gracias a que siempre tiene muy buena cantidad de clientes que le hacen muchos pedidos.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de ropas y calzados variados para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
La Esperanza group is going through the elimination of poverty program. One of their members is Cintia; she is very self-sacrificing and entrepreneurial, and works hard to improve her living conditions as well as her family's.
She sells miscellaneous clothes and shoes. She says she's been growing and improving her quality of life little by little as well as her loved ones.
She has many customers and she's been able to improve thanks to the many of them who place several orders.
She is asking for a loan to buy miscellaneous clothes and shoes to continue selling as she's done thus far. She is thankful for this opportunity to grow and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to resell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a lady from Siaya who has a grocery store. She is a single mother who supports one person in her family.

Elizabeth has operated her business for 24 years and generates a monthly income of KES 25,000. She has requested a second loan through VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more vegetables for resale. She will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the business. Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is a 60-year-old married woman with three adult children. With her determination of lifting her financial stability, she is proficiently running her rice retailing business in the town of Clarin, Bohol. She has been doing this for 31 years to sustain each day, thus, for household expenses, food and personal care products. In short, the profits that she earns from her sales aren’t enough for this woman who dreams of a sustainable means of living. That’s why she is requesting of a loan to buy more rice.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 52 years old. She is widowed and blessed with four children.

Her business is a retail shop and farming. She has been in the business for 10 years, earning a monthly income of 6000 Kenya shillings.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy sugar, salt, cooking oil detergents, rice, flour etc. for her shop.

Josephine will use the profits to expand her business to meet her family's budget.

Her hopes and dreams are to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, salt, cooking oil detergents, rice, flour etc

loans.name: Orlie

texts.en:
Orlie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like pig fattening.

Orlie dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Flutura

texts.en:
Flutura or 'butterfly' in English needs to make repairs to her home where her raises her three children, ages 17, 10 and five.

She started making some repairs with a previous loan, however, she did not finish."I have to make the house liveable because so far, it hasn't been," said Flutura during the interview.

Flutura is in the photograph with her five year old son.

loans.use: to make repairs to the family's home.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is a 33 years-old, mother of three children. Two attend school.

Liana and her husband are involved in farming. They cultivate grapes and corn and sell the harvest at local markets.

Because the land area is small, Liana requested this loan to purchase more land to enlarge their space used for cultivation.

She believes the profits will help improve her family's living conditions.

Liana waits your support and faith to improve her family's agribusiness and see it develop in the future.

loans.use: to pay for land to enlarge land cultivation space.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of 2 children.

The income generated by her husband (also shown in the photo) is insufficient to cover all their household expenses, so she initiated her milk selling business. She has been doing this for many years with the support of her husband, and she has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality.

With the support of the Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Recently she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo in order to increase her milk sales and earn profit, and thus provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

Parveen aspires to further expand her business and increase the number of animals that she currently owns.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo in order to increase her milk sales and earn profit, and thus provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Gullnaz

texts.en:
Gullnaz is a responsible mother. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for seven years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Her husband needs some maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to pay for maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Gullnaz has applied for this Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Gullnaz's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. This will provide him better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Gullnaz also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Gullnaz is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Fakhira

texts.en:
Fakhira is a responsible mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Fakhira's husband has been providing transportion facilities by driving a taxi for 20 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance of his taxi because its current condition is not good, and it requires more maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make this maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Fakhira has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Fakhira's husband can afford the maintenance costs easily. This will provide better transportation facilities to earn a profitable income. Fakhira also plans to make savings with the profit of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Fakhira is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of the repairs to her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Mujeres Luchadoras” está en su 26º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, además trabajan dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas luchan y se esmeran por mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las que integra este grupo es la Sra. Sara quien tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta tarde en la noche, ella con su sacrificio y esfuerzo ha ido mejorando poco a poco y hoy ya es conocida en el barrio y tiene ya una buena clientela formada.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos variados para la despensa, como ser bebidas, lácteos, panificados, verduras, frutas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, deleitando a sus clientes con la variedad que les ofrece.
texts.en:
Mujeres Luchadoras group is on  its 26th cycle in a women's committee program. They are also participating in the elimination of poverty program and they work hard to improve their lives.
Sara is one of the members. She owns a grocery store and she works every day very early in the morning, till very late at night. With her hard work and sacrifice she's been able to improve little by little and today she is well known in her neighborhood and she has a well established client base.
She is asking for this loan to buy a variety of grocery products such as drinks, dairy products, bread, vegetables and other products to keep up with sales and please her customers with the large variety that she offers.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, bread, vegetables and other products to stock a grocery store

loans.name: Pacitas

texts.en:
Pacita is 58 years old and is from Jagna, Bohol.

Three years ago, she started raising hogs and growing vegetables like pechay, which is also known as bok choy. She likes her business because it also provides food for herself and her husband.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seedlings, feed and piglets. She is optimistic that she will be able to turn her business around and make a good profit out of it.

She will use her income for savings and healthy food.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, feed and piglets.

loans.name: Libertine Omega

texts.fr:
Libertine Omega a 24ans, et est légitimement mariée. Elle a deux enfants non encore scolarisés car ils n’ont pas encore l’âge scolaire.
L’activité sera la vente de jouets en cette période de noël. Le commerce est saisonnière et a été exercée  depuis 2005, Ses parents ont déjà exercé cette activité. Elle n’était pas encore mariée qu’elle avait déjà son propre stand. Mais elle suivait ce que ses parents faisaient. Elle ne vend que des produits adaptés à chaque saison, et stockent  les produits non écoulés pour les revendre à la prochaine saison. Le prêt sert à acheter des jouets pour enfants : poupées  GM/ MM /PM, dinette, des voitures téléguidées, robot, moto, des ballons de foot et basket, des pistolets à eau ainsi que des piles et les fournitures scolaires non écoulées vont être stockés jusqu'à la prochaine saison
Elle habite dans une maison qu’elle a héritée de ses parents. Les prêts qu’elle a obtenus lui ont été bénéfiques car les produits ont augmenté.
texts.en:
Libertine Omega is 24 years old and is legally married. She has two children who do not yet go to school because they are too young.

The business in question is the sale of toys during the Christmas period. The work is seasonal and she has been doing it since 2005. Her parents used to be in this line of work too. She had her own stall even before she got married. But she was following in her parents footsteps. She only sells seasonal toys and stores the products she does not sell until the next season. The loan will be used to buy toys for children; small, medium, and large dolls, toy kitchen sets, radio controlled cars, robots, motorbikes, footballs, basketballs, and water pistols, as well as batteries and school supplies - the products she does not sell will be stored until next season.

Libertine Omega lives in a house that she inherited from her parents. The loans that she has received previously have been helpful in increasing her range of products.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of toys.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 34 years old, a married woman, and a mother of four children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing it for many years.

She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons, etc. to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en:
Sultana was living a tough life some years ago as it was very difficult to manage her household expenditures. She is a 44-year-old married woman who has been running a milk selling business for many years with the help of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She keeps buffaloes for milking, and sells the milk in her area. Her business is now doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses.

Sultana has 4 children, and she is a dedicated mother who wants the best for her children. She has taken out many loans from the Kashf Foundation, and now she has requested a new loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo in order to increase her milk sales and earn a good amount of income. This will help her to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo in order to increase her milk sales and earn a good amount of income. This will help her to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a married mother with two children, whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, Mwanarusi has operated a clothes selling business, from door to door to neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital.

With the loan of Kes 50,000 Mwanarusi wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 39 years old married woman and a mother of five children. To support her family (husband also shown in the photo) she began the a milk selling business.

Rehana is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She happily supports her family with the income she generates.

Rehana has requested a loan of 60000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales, to generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

Like many women it was financial constraints that played a potent factor in encouraging Rehana to approach Kashf Foundation for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Luchadoras tiene 17 integrantes, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando y esforzándose por salir adelante.
La Sra. Maria es una de las integrantes, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano, hasta muy tarde en la noche. Maria es una mujer muy sacrificada quien comenta que por medio de su despensa se gana la vida de una manera digna para poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para vender en su despensa, como ser frutas, verduras, carne, bebidas, y otros y de esa forma poder seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Luchadoras is made up of seventeen members. They are part of the poverty elimination program, striving and making efforts to get ahead.

Maria is one of the members. She has a well-stocked grocery store where she works every day from very early until late evening hours. Maria is a self-sacrificing woman, she comments that through her grocery sales she earns a living in a decent way so she can give her family a better quality of life.

Maria is applying for this loan to invest in grocery products to sell, including fruits, vegetables, meat, and beverages, so that she can continue working as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy grocery items including fruits, vegetables, meats and beverages.

loans.name: Mujeres Esperanza Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, son personas muy sacrificadas y luchadoras que quieren salir adelante, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una se ha puesto como meta poder crecer y salir adelante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ana, quien través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, ella se dedica a la venta de Ropas y otros productos, con lo cual ha podido sacar adelante a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar ropas variadas para la venta, de manera a poder seguir teniendo una buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
.
texts.en:
17 women make up this group.  They are very sacrificing and striving women who want to get ahead.  They are in the program to eliminate poverty.  Each one has set a goal to grow and get ahead and improve their living conditions.

One of the members is the Señora Ana, who through effort and continuous work and the application of the vital behaviors of a successful women, finds herself improving her poverty situation.  She works selling clothing and other products, with which she has been able to get her family ahead.  

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy various clothing to sell, in this way to be able to continue having a good variety to offer to her customers.

loans.use: To buy various clothing to sell.

loans.name: Guliston

texts.en:
Guliston was born in 1976. She is married and has four children. Guliston lives with her family in the capital of Tajikistan.

She has been busy with her sewing service for more than 15 years. Guliston has a workshop which is located in the central market. Guliston’s husband helps her with the service as he is also a sewer.

Guliston is going to buy a new sewing machine, as her present sewing machine is old. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine for increasing her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy sewing machine for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 42 years old mother of three children. She has been selling cloth for the past six years to help provide for her family's needs.

Zubaida needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy more clothes. She has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Zubaida can purchase the clothes to improve her inventory. Her profits will be used to support her family and business.

Zubaida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Nadia Carole Lylia

texts.fr:
Nadia Carole est une femme dynamique et travailleuse de 26ans. Elle est mariée légitimement et son mari est chauffeur. Le couple a un enfant de 4 ans et celui-ci est scolarisé dans une école privée. La famille loue la maison d'habitation en ce moment et l' objectif est de pouvoir construire leur propre maison sur un terrain d’héritage dans l’avenir.
Elle a exercé l’activité de vente de sandales depuis mars 2015. Elle s’est livrée à cette activité  car elle n’a pas fini ses études. La création de l’activité a été facilitée, car ses parents ont déjà effectué ce type d’activité. Afin de se distinguer de la concurrence, elle a préféré de se lancer dans la vente de sandales car les produits sont toujours faciles  à vendre, de plus c’est la saison de pluie. Le prêt sert à acheter différents types de sandales : en forme de crocodile, sandale  pour enfants et adultes, des sandales pour femmes, des sandales en caoutchouc pour tout âge.
texts.en:
Nadia Carole is a dynamic and hard-working woman of 26. She is legally married and her husband is a driver. The couple have a 4-year-old child who attends a private school. The family currently rents their home and their aim is to build their own house on a plot of inherited land in the future.

Nadia Carole has been selling sandals since 2015. She started this business because she did not finish school. She was able to start her business with the help of her parents, who were already in this line of work. In order to distinguish herself from her competition, she prefers to sell sandals as they are always easy to sell and it is also now the rainy season. The loan will be used to buy different sorts of sandals; crocodile-shaped sandals, sandals for children and adults, sandals for women, rubber sandals for people of all ages.

loans.use: to buy different types of sandals.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support six children. She is married and has a farming rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16700 loan through NWTF to buy a sanitary toilet.

Jocelyn is getting the sanitary toilet because she wants to promote the proper hygiene and sanitation for her family.

Jocelyn is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she helps the environment and reduces health problems due to the spread of diseases.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a sanitary toilet, like wood, galvanized iron, nails, etc.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 59 years old and is married with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Anita has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Anita requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

Anita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Anita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Cecinanda

texts.en:
Cecinanda is 57 years old, from Jagna in Bohol. She is married with a 17 year-old daughter.

Last year, Cecinanda started raising pigs for income. However, it will take four months before she can sell her pigs.

She is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed, so she can increase the size of her hogs and feed them enough to be healthy.

Healthy pigs are more attractive to buyers and will allow Cecinanda to negotiate higher prices when selling.

Cecinanda dream to expand her business, so she can support her child's needs in the future.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Mengil

texts.en:
Mengil is 49 years old, married with five children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, soft drinks, milk, sugar, coffee, etc.

Mengil has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, soft drinks, milk, sugar, coffee, etc

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson has run a motorcycle spare parts business for seven years.

He is a married man and a bread winner of his family whose dream is to build a residential house.

This is a plan Wilson has had for long time. He looks forward to starting the project though he lacks the funds to do so.

Wilson is requesting a loan to buy materials, like cement and paint to use on his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like cement and paint to use on his house.

loans.name: Durim

texts.en:
Durim want this loan to purchase items such as drapes, sheets and blankets to sell.

He in the photograph with his wife, Blerina, and their daughter.

loans.use: to purchase drapes, sheets and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a widowed woman with seven children, two of whom attend school . They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food .

Asha has operated a Khanga wrap cloth for women) selling business, from home and door to door to her neighbors and passersby.

She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

Asha is requesting a loan to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a hard-working lady. She is 40 years old and is a married woman. She initiated her business selling milk as it was difficult to run household activities with the small income of her husband (also shown in the photo).

She has buffalos and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Zarina’s job is to look after the buffalos and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures.

Therefore, Zarina has requested a 60,000 PKR loan to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers in order to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers in order to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.name: Voriagno Jean François Regis

texts.fr:
Voriagno est un homme travailleur débrouillard de 43ans et il est à la fois vendeur et éleveur. Il est célibataire et habite chez son oncle. Il projette de construire une maison près de son domicile actuel, tout en le bâtissant petit à petit. Il ne prévoit pas encore de se marier tant que sa vie ne sera pas encore stable
L’activité est l’achat et la revente d’ustensiles de cuisine. Depuis 2004, il a était éleveur de chèvre. Mais depuis que son oncle a achevé sa maison, Voriagno a décidé de déménager  et d’entreprendre l’activité. Ce qui a facilité  l’implantation  sur les lieux de vente. Ses produits sont de bonne  qualité  mais le coût augmente ce qui explique cette demande de prêt.
Le prêt sert à acheter des ustensiles de cuisine qui seront revendus : assiettes, cuillères  en aluminium, des fourchettes en aluminium, des bols, et des carafes etc...
texts.en:
Voriagno is a hard-working and resourceful 43-year-old man, who is both a retailer and a breeder. He is single and lives with his uncle. He aims to build a house, bit by bit, near to his current residence. He doesn't see himself getting married until he has a stable life.

The business concerned is the sale of kitchen utensils. Voriagno has been a goat-breeder since 2004. But, since his uncle has finished his house, Voriagno has decided to move out and to start this business, which made setting up the sales location easier. He has good quality products, but their prices are rising, which is why he is requesting this loan.

The loan will be used to buy kitchen utensils for resale, including plates, aluminium spoons, aluminium forks, bowls, and carafes.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils; plates, spoons, forks, table knives, glasses, dishes, carafes, etc.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Divino Niño Jesús está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una de las integrantes e ha propuesto mejorar y crecer, no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona.
Una de las integrantes es la Maria, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, y sumado a las ventas que hace en su humilde despensa, está luchando por crecer. Poco a poco a través de su esfuerzo ha ido creciendo y luchando.
La Sra. Maria solicita de este préstamo para la compra de productos variados para la venta en despensa, como azúcar, harina, bebidas en Gral. Yerbas, productos lácteos, etc. para su posterior venta, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group called Divino Nino Jesus [Devine Child Jesus] is in the poverty elimination program, in which each one of the members has proposed to improve and grow, not just economically, but also as a person.

One of the members is Maria, who through effort, continuous work and the application the essential behaviors of a successful woman, in addition to the sales she makes in her humble store, is striving to grow. Little by little, through her endeavors, she has been growing and succeeding.

Sra. Maria is requesting this loan in order to buy various products to sell in the store, like sugar, flour, general beverages, herbs, dairy products, etc., for subsequent sale, which will help her realize her business plan, which will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy supplies to sell, such as: sugar, flour, general beverages, herbs, dairy products, etc., for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo Divino Niño está en su ciclo número 2do Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 12 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Otilia, quien vende prendas variadas y con su trabajo se gana la vida de una manera honrada para poder tener los medios para ayudar a su familia y darles una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Pide este préstamo ya que necesita surtirse con prendas variadas para poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, quiere comprar remeras, camisas, pantalones, jeans, y otros.
texts.en:
The group Divino Niño (Divine Child) is in their 2nd cycle of the program of the committee of women, where all of them are part of the program to eliminate poverty.  12 members find themselves below the line of poverty, that is to say an extreme poverty.

One of the members is la Señera Otilia.  She sells various clothing; and with her work, she is earning a living in an honorable way to be able to have the means to help her family and give them a dignified life without want.

She is requesting this loan since she needs to stock up with various clothing to be able to fulfill the requests of her customers.  She wants to buy t-shirts, shirts, pants, jeans, and other things.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, shirts, pants, jeans, and other clothing to sell.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Laura industriously earns additional income through other business ventures by buying and selling livestock.

Laura dreams that one day she will be able to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Lucien

texts.fr:
Lucien est un homme rigoureux de 49 ans. Il est marié avec 8 enfants à charge. Il habite à la campagne et pratique l’élevage porcin depuis de nombreuses années.
Il a déjà bénéficié de plusieurs prêts successifs chez Vahatra ou il a pu acheter une vache laitière et pratiquer plusieurs cultures. Pour ce prêt. Lucien compte acheter quelques porcin et de la provende pour l’engraissement de ces porcins. 
Lucien est très sérieux dans la gestion de son élevage afin de pouvoir assurer le bien-être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Lucien, age 49, is a rigorous man, married with 8 dependent children. He lives in a rural area and has been a pig farmer for many years.

He has obtained many successive loans from Vahatra, which allowed him to buy a dairy cow and to grow various crops. Lucien will use this new loan to purchase a few piglets and some feed to fatten them.

Lucien takes his pig farming activity very seriously, as he wants ensure that he provides for his family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feed for his pig fattening activity.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela es una persona que se esfuerza mucho por poder mejorar su vida a través de sus estudios, pone todo lo mejor de si para poder lograrlo, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, lo cual le die de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con sus estudios.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulacion como lo vine haciendo.
texts.en:
Angela is a person who works a lot to be able to improve her life through her studies. She puts all the best of herself forward to be able to achieve it. She says that she used her previous loan to pay the costs of her degree, which she says helped her a lot to be able to continue with her studies.

She is requesting this new loan to be able to cover the costs of the degree as she had been doing.

loans.use: to cover the costs of her degree.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fatima es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, está estudiando la carrera de Administración de Empresas, es funcionario y por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder cubrir los gastos de su universidad 
Su meta es recibir su título de la carrera y ejercer en la profesión.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Fatima is from the city of Paraquarí. She is studying the career of Business Administration. She is an official, and through her work she has the means to be able to cover the costs of her university.

Her goal is to receive her degree title and practice her profession.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay the costs of her degree, and in that way be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay the costs of university.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen lives in rural Lyantonde. He is married and a father to three children aged three, eleven, and thirteen.

Here Stephen appears on his farm with his cows. His business is farming and he keeps mainly cattle. He also grows crops and vegetables, though on a small scale. He usually grows tomatoes and cabbages to help him to adequately provide for his family's needs.

Stephen also dreams of venturing into another business, which is raising pigs. For this purpose, he is asking for a loan to buy feed, piglets, more vegetable seeds, and a sprayer for insecticides.

Stephen dreams of making his business successful so that his children can go to better schools.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets, more vegetable seeds, and a sprayer for insecticides.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.fr: Jean Claude veut reprendre un autre prêt pour acheter de nouveau des légumes : 1.5 tonnes de carotte, 250 Kg de courgettes et 250 Kg de pomme de terre. Ils n’arrivent pas encore à satisfaire ses clients venant des provinces. Le prêt précédent lui a permis d’assurer la rentrée scolaire et à constituer plus d’épargne. Il a comme projet de construire une autre maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Jean Claude wants to take out another loan to buy a new load of vegetables: 1.5 tons of carrots, 250 kilograms of zucchini, and 250 kilograms of potatoes.

He has not yet been able to meet the demand of his customers from the countryside.

[Earnings from] Jean Claude's previous loan allowed him to cover school fees for the new semester and increase his savings.

He is working to build another house for his family.

loans.use: to buy 1.5 tons of carrots, 250 kilograms of zucchinis, and 250 kilograms of potatoes.

loans.name: Jahongir

texts.en:
Jahongir is a kind and industrious man. He is married and has a son. Jahongir works in a private organization. He is very hardworking man and he works hard, so his manager respects him for his responsibility.

Jahongir needs financial support because his wife is ill. He is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy medicines for the treatment of his wife. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for his wife's treatment.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es de la ciudad de Pilar, es ya abogado recibido, pero con el propósito de poder crecer en lo profesional es que está estudiando una especialización judicial.
Él es una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora que quiere salir adelante, es por eso que pone todo de sí.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de las cuotas de su especialización, de manera a poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Diego is from the city of Pilar. He is already a lawyer, but he has the goal to be able to grow in the profession. He is studying judicial expertise.

He is a striving and very hardworking person who wants to get ahead. That is why he puts forth all of himself.

He is requesting this loan to be able to cover the fees of his specialization, in order to be able to cover these costs that he has.

loans.use: to pay the costs of his specialization.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a young mother to her three-year-old son. She is from Jagna, Bohol.

Jennifer is engaged in hair styling and services to make a woman's hair beautiful, like hair-relaxing. She also make crafts from recycled materials. This business is instrumental in providing for her son's needs.

Jennifer would like to expand her business. She is asking a loan to buy hair-relaxing chemicals so she can serve more customers in her place, thus generating more income.

It is her dream to make her business big someday for her family to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy hair-relaxing chemicals

loans.name: Lyziel

texts.en:
Lyziel is 43 years old, and married with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a dried-fish making business in the Philippines.

Lyziel requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish.

Lyziel has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is 53 years old, a widow, and runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices and after sewing and making embroidery patterns, she sells it to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being.

For the improvement of her business, Perveen has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently. This will increase her net income for improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently, to increase her net income to improve their standard of living.

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr:
Martine est une veuve de 56 ans. Elle a quatre enfants. Un de ses enfants s’est déjà marié et les rois autres sont encore à sa charge et ont déjà quittés l’école. Son feu mari nous a quitté depuis longtemps. Elle a élevé ses enfants toute seule depuis ce temps. 
Martine est dans la vente de friperie de vêtement depuis 1983. La vente de friperie est adapté à son cas, c’est pour cela qu’elle continue toujours de l’exécuter. Elle a pour objectif d’étendre son activité et de ne pas rester à la vente de friperie d’habits mais de se lancer dans la téléphonie par exemple.
Le prêt servira à acheter une balle de blouson, une balle de vêtement à capuchon, et des pantalons.
texts.en:
Martine is 56 years old and a widow. She has four children. One of the children is already married, and the others are still under her care and have already finished school.

Her husband left long ago, and she raised her children all alone during that time.

Martine has worked selling used clothing since 1983. This work suits her well, and that is why she has continued in this line of business.

Her goal is to expand her business, and to not stop with just selling used clothing, but maybe launching a business in the telephone business, for example.

The loan will serve to buy a bale of blouses, a bale of hoodies, and a bale of pants.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una joven casada de 29 años esta en espera de su primer hijo y fue diagnosticada con un embarazo de alto riesgo por lo que tuvo que dejar su trabajo, su esposo trabaja como almacenista por lo que su economía es muy limitada para poder solventar la cesárea que requiere para que su hijo no corra riesgo en la labor de parto
texts.en: She's a 29-year-old married young woman expecting her first child.  She had to stop working because she was diagnosed with a high-risk pregnancy.  Her husband works as a shopkeeper and her budget is too limited to be able to pay for the Caesarean section she needs so there's no risk to the child during labor and delivery.

loans.use: to pay for a Caesarean section delivery

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr:
Julienne a 48 ans. Elle est veuve et a 4 enfants dont l’un est le seul à encore étudier. Un autre de ses enfants l’aide dans son activité et les 2 autres se sont déjà mariés. 
L’activité de julienne est la vente d’imperméable et des sacs à dos et cartable. C’est une activité saisonnière. Elle en est à son 3eme prêt au niveau de CEFOR. Même après ses longues années dans la vente, elle est toujours prête à le faire car ce travail lui apporte que des bienfaits. Et elle voudrait encore développer et améliorer l'activité. En cette période de pluie, Le prêt servira à acheter différent types d’imperméables.
Elle a pour objectif la réussite de sa fille  en l’assistant au maximum et aussi d’avoir un terrain dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Julienne is 48 years old, a widow, and has four children. Only one of the children is still in school. Another one of her children helps her with her business, and the other two are already married.

Julienne sells rain gear, backpacks, and schoolbags seasonally.

She is on her third loan with CEFOR. Even after many years in commerce, she is always ready to do this work because it is profitable. And she would like to continue to develop and improve her business.

In this rainy season, the loan will serve to buy various types of rain gear.

Her goal is that her daughter does really well as her assistant and to own a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy different types of rain coats.

loans.name: Ma. Liezyl

texts.en:
Ma. Liezyl is a hardworking woman of 30 years old from the town of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is married and her husband is working in another country to provide for them.

Ma. Liezyl is a responsible wife. She tried her best to help in raising her three children by selling Avon products such as lotion, body talc, perfume, fashion ware and jewelry. She also buys and sells rice from farmers.

She is asking a loan to increase her capital and buy more cosmetics and jewelry.

She hopes that someday, she will earn enough and that her husband will be able to come back and find a stable job in the country.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and jewelry.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El Sr. Pedro es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo, está cursando el primer  año de la carrera de Contabilidad.
Comenta que por medio de sus estudios quiere abrirse camino y ser un buen profesional que ayude a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de una computadora, que le ayudará a poder hacer sus trabajos de la universidad.
texts.en:
Pedro is from the city of Curuguaty, where he studies and works at the same time. He is in his first year of an accounting program.
He comments that through his program he wants to open new paths for himself and be a good professional who will help others.
He is requesting this loan to be able to buy a computer that will help him to be able to do his university course work.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Nomenjanahary

texts.fr:
Nomenjanahary a 52 ans. Elle est marié et son mari est chauffeur de camion. Le couple a 3 enfants dont l’un âgé de 17ans et les deux autres, jumeaux âgés de 13 ans respectivement.
Nomenjanahary est dans la vente de riz depuis 2010.  Elle était femme au foyer avant, elle s'occupait de son ménage et de sa famille (son mari et ses enfants). C'est une mère attentionnée et travailleuse. Sa priorité est le bien-être de sa famille. C'est pour aider son mari à entretenir le ménage et soutenir la famille qui la pousse à exercer une activité génératrice de revenu.
Elle a pour objectif de devenir un grossiste en riz et de créer un grand marché dans l’expédition de riz. Elle a aussi l’idée de s’acquérir un terrain afin d’y construire sa propre maison, dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Nomenjanahary is 52 years old. She is married and her husband is a truck driver. The couple has three children; one is 17 years old, while the other two are twins and 13 years old.

Nomenjanahary has been selling rice since 2010. She was a housewife before, taking care of her home and family (husband and children). She is an attentive and hard-working mother. Her priority is her family's well-being.

It is for this reason that she helps her husband to take care of the household and support the family through outside work.

Her goal is to become a rice wholesaler and to create a large market exporting rice. She also has an idea to buy some land in order to build a proper house, in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.fr:
Yvonne est une femme de 49 ans. Elle est mariée, mère de 5 enfants. Elle habite à la campagne et pratique toute sorte de culture et d’élevage, cela depuis 11 ans. 
Elle est emprunteuse chez Vahatra depuis 3 ans. Les prêts successifs d’avant lui ont permis d’acheter un terrain en vue d’une construction de maison. Ce prêt va lui servir à l’élevage de poulets de chair et à la vente de chaussures friperie. 
Yvonne est enthousiaste pour gagner des bénéfices afin d’améliorer la condition de vie de ses enfants et de construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Yvonne, age 49, is married with 5 children. She lives in a rural area where she has been a crop and animal farmer for 11 years.

She became a client of Vahatra 3 years ago, and successive loans allowed her to buy some land where she plans to build a house. This new loan will support two activities, namely raising broiler chickens and selling second-hand shoes.

Yvonne is motivated to run profitable activities. She wants to improve her children's living conditions and to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy broiler chickens to raise, and one bale of second-hand shoes to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es estudiante de la carrera de Derecho, para solventar sus estudios tiene un negocio, el cual es una despensa en su casa, y por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder cubrir sus gastos.
Su  meta es la de poder terminar sus estudios, y de aquí a cierto tiempo se ve trabajando en su profesión, siendo útil a su familia en primer lugar y a su comunidad.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
María's a law student and to pay for her studies she has a business, a grocery store in her home. Her job is the means to be able to cover her expenses.

Her goal is to be able to finish her studies and within a certain amount of time be working in her profession and being useful to her family above all and to her community.

She's requesting this loan to pay the fees for her program so she can continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Aloida

texts.en:
Aloida works hard to support her family. Aloida is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Aloida has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Aloida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jackie Aimée Nicole

texts.fr:
Jackie a 52 ans et elle est mariée. Son mari est chauffeur de taxi. Le couple a un enfant qui a déjà quitté l’école pour aider sa mère. 
Elle est dans la vente de friperie. Avant de vendre ses articles dans son quartier, elle faisait du porte à porte, mais maintenant c’est son fils qui la succède dans le porte à porte. Son dernier prêt lui a permis l’achat de friperie et de bibelot en tout genre.
Elle a abandonné le porte à porte à cause d’une maladie et a préféré vendre ses articles dans son quartier. Jackie est une femme débrouillarde, c’est ce qui lui a permis d’étendre sa gamme de produit en ajoutant de la friperie et divers  petits articles de ménage. 
Elle a pour objectif l’extension de ses produits afin de former de plus grande somme pour l’épargne.
texts.en:
Jackie is 52 years old and is married to a taxi driver. The couple has one child who has quit school to help his mother.

Jackie sells used clothing. She used go door-to-door to make her sales, but now her son does this work. She stopped going door-to-door, because she was sick and preferred to sell her products just in her neighborhood.

Her previous loan allowed her to buy used clothing and various knickknacks.

Jackie is a hard-working woman, and this allows her to expand her product range by adding used clothing and various household items.

Jackie's goal is to diversify the products she sells in order to earn more and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy used clothing and household items.

loans.name: Marie Eliane

texts.fr:
Marie Eliane a 60 ans. Elle est veuve et a 7 enfants qui ont tous quittés le nid familial. Elle vit seule et est très active. Elle travail dure pour ne pas dépendre de ses enfants. 
Marie Eliane en est à son 4eme prêt au niveau de CEFOR. Elle est dans la vente de vêtements fripe et des peluche à l'occasion. Elle fait ce travail depuis 11 ans et pendant les périodes d’hiver, elle ajoute des couettes dans ses articles de ventes. Elle commence la vente très tôt le matin et ne cesse que le soir. 
Elle a pour objectif d’épargner au maximum afin de prévoir sa retraite.
texts.en:
Marie Eliane is 60 years old. She is a widow with 7 children who have all left the nest. She lives alone and is very active. She works hard so that she does not have to depend on her children.

Marie Eliane is on her 4th loan from CEFOR. She sells second-hand clothing and second-hand soft toys. She has been doing this for 11 years and, during the winter period, she also sells quilts. She starts work very early in the morning and only stops in the evening.

Her goal is to save as much as possible in order to have something for her retirement.

loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand clothing and soft toys.

loans.name: Louisette

texts.fr:
Louisette a 45ans et elle est mariée. Son mari est maçon tâcheron, il travaille pour son propre compte. Le couple a 3 enfants, âgés respectivement de 14, 11 ans pour les deux jumeaux. Ses enfants sont tous scolarisés. 
Louisette est à son 5eme prêt au niveau de CEFOR. Elle est dans la couture depuis 2010 et confectionne des maillots pour enfants. Elle effectue ses ventes hebdomadairement. Elle se consacre entièrement pour son travail. Des fois elle passe plus de 24heures à son travail lors d’importante commande.  
Louisette ne vend son produit que tous les mercredis. Son plus grand objectif est la réussite de ses enfants dans leur parcours scolaires.
texts.en:
Louisette is 45 years old and married. Her husband is a self-employed jobbing bricklayer. The couple have 3 children, one aged 14 years and 11-year-old twins. All the children attend school.

Louisette is on her 5th loan with CEFOR. She has been a seamstress since 2010 and makes shirts for children. She makes her sales on a weekly basis. She dedicates herself completely to her work. Sometimes she works for over 24 hours when she has important orders to fulfill.

Louisette only sells her clothes on Wednesdays. Her biggest goal is to watch her children succeed academically.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and elastic.

loans.name: Tajy Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo tiene 19 miembros, donde todas están luchando y esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza trabajando por mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elizabeth, quien es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de manera ambulante, y es por medio de sus ventas que tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo ya que necesita comprar prendas de todo tipo para poder seguir con sus ventas, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones, jeans, y otras prendas. Agradece por la oportunidad que todas reciben de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group has 19 members, who are all working and exerting themselves in order to better their life conditions and those of their families. They are all in the poverty elimination program working to better their quality of life.

One of the members is Elizabeth, who is a hardworking and enterprising person. She makes a living selling articles of clothing on the street and by these sales, she has the means to help her loved ones.

She is asking for this loan which she needs to buy all kinds of articles of clothing so she can continue her sales, such as tee-shirts, collared shirts, pants, jeans and others. She is grateful for the opportunity that they all receive to be able to better their life conditions.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing to sell, such as: tee-shirts, collared shirts, pants, jeans and others.

loans.name: San Agustin Group

texts.es:
En total son 22 mujeres inspiradas que se esfuerzan día a día para solventar los gastos del hogar y por sobre todo aumentar sus ingresos, y mejorar las condiciones de vida y las de sus familias.
La Sra. Ramona es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de queso y de leche, comenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella los productos que vende, y es por medio de sus ventas que tiene los medios para poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de leche y queso en cantidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas y cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir mejorando su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
In all they are 22 woman inspired to work hard every day to pay for the household expenses and especially to increase their income and improve their living conditions for themselves and their families.

Ramona's one of the members of this group. She earns a living selling cheese and milk. She say she has very good customers who always buy the products she sells. Through these sales she has the means to be able to give her family a better quality of life.

She's requesting this loan to buy milk and cheese wholesale so she can continue to make sales and fill her customers' orders.

She's grateful for the opportunity to keep improving her business.

loans.use: to buy cheese and milk wholesale to sell

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina works hard to support her family. Christina is married and has a butcher shop business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of meat to sell.

Christina has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Christina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of meat to sell.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a responsible mother of one child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 10 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family.

Her husband needs to make maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to make maintenance on his taxi. Therefore, Zainab has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Zainab's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn profitable income. Zainab also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Zainab is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Simonette

texts.fr:
Simonette est une femme dynamique de 40 ans. Elle habite à la campagne avec son mari et ses 6 enfants. Elle tient une petite quincaillerie au bord de la route depuis 15 ans.
Elle est emprunteuse chez Vahatra depuis 1 an. Elle a pu augmenter le capital de son activité grâce aux prêts successifs qu’elle a contracté. Pour ce prêt, elle va acheter des fers ronds en série. Son commerce marche vu qu’elle est la seule qui tient une quincaillerie dans la ville.
Elle espère gagner beaucoup de bénéfices pour améliorer la condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Simonette, age 40, is an energetic woman. She lives in the countryside with her husband and her six children. She's been running a small hardware shop on the roadside for 15 years.

She's been a borrower with Kiva's partner, Vahatra, for one year. Thanks to the successive loans she took out, she was able to increase the working capital of her business

With this loan, she will buy a series of iron bars. Her business is doing well since she's the owner of the only hardware store in the city.

She hopes to make a hefty profit in order to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: To buy iron bars to sell in her hardware store

loans.name: Lalao

texts.fr:
Lalao est une femme âgée de 41 ans. Elle vit en ville avec son mari et ses 4 enfants. Elle vend des poulets de chair dans son quartier, au bord de la route. 
Lalao a pu créer une autre activité ou elle fait de l’élevage de poulets de chair avec les prêts successifs qu’elle a eu chez Vahatra auparavant. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 125 Kg de poulets de chair qu’elle va vendre  dans son pavillon. 
Elle espère gagner beaucoup de bénéfices afin d’augmenter le capital de son activité et d’épargner pour l’avenir de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Lalao, age 41, lives in the city with her husband and her four children. She sells broiler meat on the roadside, in her neighborhood.

With the loans she obtained previously from Kiva's partner, Vahatra, she managed to start another business, in which she raises poultry.

She intends to use this loan to buy 125 kg of broiler meat to sell in her stall.

She hopes to make a hefty profit in order to bolster the working capital of her business and put money away for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy 125 kg of boiler meat to sell in her neighborhood

loans.name: Sterine Michèle

texts.fr:
Michèle a 37 ans et elle est divorcée. Elle élève seule sa fille de 8 ans après son divorce. Elle se consacre entièrement pour l’éducation de sa fille, très tôt le matin, elle étale déjà ses produits et ne rentre que très tard le soir. Elle garde ce rythme 7 jours sur 7. Son objectif est d’améliorer leur niveau de vie et de tout faire pour la réussite de sa fille.
Michèle est à son 5eme prêt au niveau de CEFOR. Avant elle produisait de la cire et s’occupait elle-même de la vente de son produit. A présent, elle a ajouté la vente de produit de beauté et de bibelots à son activité.
Le prêt lui servira à acheter des articles pour femme ainsi que des produits de beauté : Masque pour visage, parfum, vernis, déodorant, chapeau, jouet…
texts.en:
Michèle is 37 years old and divorced. She is raising her 8-year-old daughter on her own after her divorce. She dedicates herself entirely to ensuring her daughter's education. She displays her products for sale very early in the morning and only comes home very late in the evening. She does this 7 days a week. Her aim is to improve her and her daughter's standard of living and to do everything she can to ensure her daughter's success.

Michèle is on her 5th loan from CEFOR. She used to make wax and sell her own products. Now, she also sells beauty products and trinkets.

This loan will be used to buy items for women and beauty products like face masks, perfume, varnish, and deodorant, as well as hats and toys.

loans.use: to buy hair products, nail varnish, deodorants, perfumes, photo albums, etc.

loans.name: Integracion Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Integracion, son 18 mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que luchan por poder salir adelante, cada una pone su mayor esfuerzo y sacrificio.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Jessica, quien se dedica al reciclaje de productos de todo tipo, como ser cartones, plásticos, aluminio, papel y otros, que ella misma recoge por las calles y que también compra en cantidad para poder revender. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que con su humilde trabajo se gana la vida de una manera digna.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de productos reciclados en cantidad para la venta, como ser papeles, cartones, aluminio y otros, de manera a poder seguir luchando por su familia y sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
This group is called Integracion and it is made up of 18 very hardworking and entrepreneurial women who strive everyday to get ahead, each one putting forth her best effort and sacrifice.
One of the members is Jessica, who works recycling all types of products, such as cardboard, plastic, aluminum, paper and others that she collects from the streets and which she also buys in large quantities to be able to resell.
She is a very hardworking woman, who with this humble work earns a living in a dignified manner.
She is requesting this loan to buy recycled products in large quantities, such as paper, cardboard, aluminum and others, in order to be able to continue fighting for her family and loved ones.

loans.use: to buy recycled products to resell, such as paper, cardboard, aluminum and others.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Nueva Esperanza está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Fidelina, quien vende bebidas variadas en su casa, y es por medio de sus ventas que lucha por dar a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones. Fidelina es una mujer muy sacrificada que con esfuerzo y esmero está saliendo adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la comprar de bebidas variadas, como ser gaseosas, cervezas, vinos y otras
texts.en:
The group named "New Hope" is in its second loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program, in which all work and help each other get ahead. All of the members have taken the poverty elimination survey and the results indicated that three of the women are below the poverty line, which means they are living in extreme poverty.

One of the members is Fidelina, who sells assorted drinks in her house. Through her sales, she fights to give her family a respectable life, not lacking anything. Fidelina is a woman who sacrifices and is moving forwards with effort and care.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in buying assorted drinks, such as carbonated beverages, beers, wines and others.

loans.use: to invest in buying assorted drinks, such as: carbonated beverages, beers, wines and others.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a married woman. She has 3 children. She operates a restaurant.

She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a farm where he grows crops and also keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

David describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient rain. He will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy farm supplies. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy another cow.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores works hard to support her family. Dolores is married and has a buying and selling of bananas business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.

Dolores has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
