Parviz is young and smart man. He is single and lives with his parents. Parviz is a student of the 6th course Tajikistan Medical University. He is an active student and usually takes part in many activities.

He wants to be a good medical specialist in future. Parviz must pay for the university tuition but he does not have the money. Parviz is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to pay for the university tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition.

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Francisco, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, poniendo su esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Agripina quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y sumado a la venta de comidas que hace lucha y tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. Ella pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder ir creciendo en su emprendimiento y asi seguir ayudando a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The San Francisco Group is in the poverty elimination program and is making an effort to better their living conditions and those of their loved ones.

One of the members is Agripina, who through her efforts and constant labor, along with the sale of the meals that she makes, strives to and has the means to be able to help her family. She puts all her energy into growing her business venture and with that, continuing to help her family.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy supplies to make her meals, such as vegetables, meat, condiments and other things, so she can continue with selling like she has been.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments and other supplies to make meals.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre San Juan está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, es un grupo nuevo que trabaja dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una esforzándose por poder salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Patricia quien se dedica a hacer y vender comidas ella misma, comenta que todos los días inicia su trabajo desde muy temprano en la mañana, que es cuando se levanta a hacer sus comidas y después las vende de manera ambulante por su barrio.
Patricia pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos variados para poder hacer comidas para la venta, como ser: verduras, carne, condimentos, panificados, hortalizas y otros, y de esa manera poder seguir con su emprendimiento como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group named “San Juan” is in its first loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program, in which all work and help each other to get ahead. It's a new group that works in the poverty elimination program, each one exerting herself to get by.

One of the members is Patricia who makes a living by making and selling her own food. She says that every day she starts working very early in the morning, which is when she gets up to prepare her food and later she sells them on the streets of her neighborhood.

Patricia is asking for this loan so she can buy assorted supplies so she can make her food for sale such as: vegetables, meat, condiments, baked goods, greens and others. In this way she can continue with her business as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make meals such as: vegetables, meat, condiments, baked goods, greens and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock her shop with retail goods.

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane, a 42-year-old woman, has maintained a hog-raising business for many years now. She is from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. She is married with two children aged 3 and 12. Her husband is a farmer.

She is asking for a loan to buy more piglets, feed and supplements. This will help her produce healthy pigs that she can sell at a good price. Her income will help her provide healthy meals for her children and pay their school fees.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and supplements

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be loving.

She operates a farm where she grows onions. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be crop diseases.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer and pay farm labor costs. Her business goal is to have a large-scale farm within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay farm labor costs.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

Peter will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to be an importer of clothes within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Leandro

texts.en: Leandro is 38 years old married man with 3 children and lives in Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Lenadro help his wife runs a sari-sari store selling home use products in their community to earn a living. He borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, shampoo and biscuits for sale. He saves a portion of his income in preparation for his children's future education. Leandro's future is to expand his sari-sari store for bigger income earn.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a Kiva borrower. She has four children. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be locals.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will open a boutique. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Mercelita

texts.en:
Mercelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of vegetables business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of vegetables like eggplant, tomatoes, squash, etc., to sell for her buying and selling of vegetables business.

Mercelita has been in this business for 14 years. Mercelita earns additional income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of vegetables like eggplant, tomatoes, squash, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita works hard to support her family. Angelita is has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy new fish nets and materials for boat repair.

Angelita has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Angelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new fish nets and materials for boat repair

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! This is Siti, one of Ruma's agents. Siti is a housewife who has been blessed with two children, one son and one daughter. They live in Bekasi, the satellite city located east of Jakarta. For Siti and her husband, they realize that they have to save more to continuously support their children’s education. Therefore, to support her family, besides selling daily consumer products to her community, she runs a business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving utility bill payments. She was introduced to this business by a Ruma agent and she is one of the agents who is performing very well.

As the demand for transactions increase, Siti is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to process more mobile airtime credits and utility bill payments transactions, especially on the weekends. In the photo, Siti is the one who is sitting in her own stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to communication service.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman and has been blessed with five kids who attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Rose has operated a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over three years. She mentioned disease outbreaks causing losses as a challenge in the business. Rose dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is married with two children, both of whom are in school. She works very hard to support her husband in order to provide for their needs.

Lucy sells used clothing in the market where she generates income to help pay her children's school fees and upkeep.

The demand placed on her goods has become very great so she is seeking a loan from Kiva through ID-Ghana to purchase more cloth to sell to her buyers. She will use her income to repay the loan, school fees and the upkeep of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to sell to her buyers.

loans.name: Sinavere

texts.en:
Sinavere has three children and does everything that she can to give them what they need, as she loves them very much. Her husband is employed as a janitor and also works part time in construction since his main salary is low. Sinavere operates a handicraft business from her home. This has allowed her to be able to be home with her children to meet their needs but to also supplement their low income. She has to work late into the night for her clients, but she is happy to do the work since it helps her to be able to give her children a better education. 

At this time she is requesting a loan in order to purchase material for her work so that she can meet the needs and requests of her clients. The loan will directly allow her to satisfy the clients and increase her client base and income. She promises to pay on time and appreciates the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase material for her sewing and handicrafts business to satisfy the clients

loans.name: Fetije

texts.en:
Fetije, a very lovely woman who has a lot of positive energy and works hard for her four children, wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan. The loan has helped her to improve her family's condition and standard of living.

Her husband is still performing, playing musical instruments for various celebrations and events, but typically has much more profit and work in the summer seasons.

Fetije recently is doing handicrafts, making sweaters that she then sells in a market. She works from her small home so that she is available for her children and is able to care for the family needs.

At this time, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase materials to make her sweaters. She will be able to increase her income easily by being able to produce more of her handicrafts to sell and can attract more clients with newer products.

She looks forward to one day having her own workshop and increasing her income even more so that she can always provide a better life for her children. She strives to give her children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make her sweaters to increase her income easily by being able to produce more of her handicrafts to sell and to attract more clients with newer products.

loans.name: Dara's Group

texts.en: Dara’s group live in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Dara makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Hei's Group

texts.en: Hei’s group live in a rural village in Kampot province in Cambodia. Hei makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Seinean's Group

texts.en: Seinean’s group live in a rural village in Kompot province in Cambodia. Seinean makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Elisa Liliane

texts.fr:
Elise  est une femme courageuse et travailleuse de 38 ans. Elle est veuve. Elle s’occupe seule de ses deux enfants âgés de 13 et 10 ans. Ces derniers sont tous scolarisés dans une école privée.
Depuis l’année 2000, Elise a pratiqué la vente dans un magasin général après avoir abandonné son poste dans une entreprise de zone franche. C’est pour l’utilisation dans cette activité qu’elle a besoin de ce prêt. Un prêt qui en est à sa 5eme.
Elle s’occupe seule de son activité. C’est-à-dire qu’il n’y a qu’elle pour s’occuper de la vente ainsi que de l’approvisionnement en produit, tous les jours. 
Elise et ses enfants vivent actuellement dans la maison de ses beaux-parents. Elle a pour objectif d’avoir une maison en plus de la réussite de ses enfants dans leur parcours scolaire.
texts.en:
Elise is a good, hard-working woman who is 38 years old. She is a widow. She is raising her 2 children, aged 13 and 10, on her own. Her children both attend a private school.

Since 2000, Elise has been selling products in a general store after leaving her job working for a company in the free trade zone. She needs this fifth loan for her retail business.

She works alone, meaning that she has to make the sales and get the supplies herself, every day.

Elise and her children are currently living with her in-laws. Her goal is to have her own home and to watch her children succeed academically.

loans.use: to buy honey and staple products like rice, oils, sugar, salt, soap, candles, matches, batteries, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Katupyry 2 está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Delia; quien se dedica a la venta de comidas y bebidas en su casa, ella a través de las capacitaciones y charlas que le ofrece la fundación paraguaya ella pudo ir mejorando su nivel de vida. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora que lucha por sus seres queridos para  poder darles una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Ella solicita de este préstamo para la compra de los ingredientes que ella utiliza para la elaboración de las comidas como por ejemplo carne, huevo, aceite entre otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
Kuña Katupyry 2 Group is in its second loan cycle in the women's bank program, in which everyone works and helps each other to get ahead.

One of the members, Delia, earns a living selling food and beverages in her home. She's a very enterprising woman who strives to give her loved ones a decent life without deprivation. Through the trainings and lectures offered by Fundación Paraguaya she has managed to keep improving her standard of living.

She's requesting this loan to buy the ingredients she uses to make her dishes, including meat, eggs, and oil.

She's grateful for this opportunity to be able to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy meat, eggs, oil, and other ingredients

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Niño Jesús está en su ciclo número 2º del programa de comité de mujeres, están muy contentas por formar parte del grupo, ya que a través de él podrán mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Anastacia, integrante de este grupo, tiene una despensa, ella es una persona muy trabajadora que desde siempre ha trabajado y lucha por seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la  de sus seres queridos. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos variados para su despensa, como ser carne, verduras, frutas, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir creciendo en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The Niño Jesús (Baby Jesus) group is a group of women in their second loan cycle. They are very happy to be a part of this group because through it they can improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones.

Anastacia, a member of this group, has a pantry. She is a hard worker who has always worked and struggled to keep improving her living conditions and those of her loved ones. She is thankful for the opportunity to be able to keep growing and improving.

She is asking for this loan to buy various products for her pantry, such as meat, vegetables, fruits, bakery products and others, in order to continue growing her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients, such as meat, vegetables, fruits, bakery products and more, to make meals.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man with 3 children. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the Kes 95,000 loan to buy more stock of meat to enable him meet demand during the upcoming festive season. His business goal is to be an exporter of meat within 5 years.

He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to open another business outlet.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be industrious.

He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, soap, flour, rice and other items. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items.

His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Fedelina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fresh fish. Fedelina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of fishing nets for her fishing business.

Fedelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing nets.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 45 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, eggs, etc.

Erlinda has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan is an entrepreneur from Pavlograd. He runs a vending location at a local marketplace selling men's outerwear. Ruslan owns his vending facility. He has been in this sphere of business for 4 years. One of the struggles small businessmen in the Ukraine have to face on a daily basis today is unstable exchange rates which causes purchase prices to go up all the time.

Ruslan is hoping to invest 10,000 Hryvnias in assorted men's sweatshirts, hoodies and shirts for further retail sale this winter. He always tries to look for ways to grow and develop his business

loans.use: to purchase assorted men's sweatshirts, hoodies and shirts for further retail sale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be honest.

He operates a posho mill where he sells maize flour. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more stock of maize to produce maize flour.

He hopes that in the future, he will expand business. He will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize

loans.name: San Miguel 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Miguel 2 está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir, en una pobreza extrema, pero luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, es una mujer muy activa y trabajadora, que pone su mayor esfuerzo para ser el ejemplo para sus compañeras y a la vez ayudar a su familia. Se dedica a la venta de ropas, y pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, camisas, jeans, pantalones y otros, de manera a poder seguir mejorando sus ventas.
texts.en:
The San Miguel 2 group is working to eliminate poverty, with three members who are living below the poverty line, i.e., in extreme poverty, but struggling to improve their living conditions.

One of the members is Maria, who is the president of the group. She is a very active and hardworking woman who puts forth her best effort to be an example to her peers and also help her family. She sells clothing and is requesting a loan to buy T-shirts, shirts, jeans, pants and more, in order to further improve sales.

loans.use: buy clothing for sale, such as T-shirts, shirts, jeans, pants and others.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Kuña Guapa 2 está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Matilde quien  a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Ella tiene una despensa que con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo ha podido montar e ir mejorando día a día. Es una mujer muy luchadora que se unió a este grupo para poder seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
La Sra. Matilde solicita  este préstamo para la compra de los productos que vende en su despensa, como por ejemplo azúcar, aceite, fideos, entre otras cosas que ella vende en su despensa.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Guapa” Communal Bank is in their second cycle of the women’s committee program where everyone works and helps each other get ahead. Matilde is one of the members, and through effort and constant work, and putting essential behaviors of a successful woman into practice, she is improving her poverty situation.

She has a grocery store, which she has been able to set up through much hard work and effort, and her business continues improving every day. She is a very hardworking woman, and she joined this group to be able to continue improving living conditions for herself and her family.
Matilde is requesting this loan to purchase products to sell in her grocery store such as sugar, oil, noodles, and other items that she sells.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell in her grocery store such as sugar, oil, noodles, and other items that she sells.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma works hard to support her family. Norma is married and has a (Yakult) prebiotic dairy products business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional prebiotic dairy products to sell.

Norma has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Norma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional prebiotic dairy products to sell.

loans.name: Estelle Marie Celina

texts.fr:
Estelle a 36ans, elle est mariée mais pas illégitime (en concubinage). Elle a 3 enfants dont une fille et 2 garçons. Un de ses garçons âgés de 15ans est en classe de 4eme dans un établissement public. Un autre de 14 ans est en 6eme. Et enfin,  sa fille âgée de 9 ans est en 9ème dans une école primaire publique. Son mari est maçon et est payé tous les 2 semaines. 
Le couple est propriétaire d’une  maison en bois. Le couple a pu construire cette maison à partir des bénéfices tirés des activités antérieures. Leur objectif est de pouvoir réhabiliter  leur maison : construction en brique.
Estelle est vendeuse d’articles de cuisine. De 2005 à ce jour, elle a exercé cette activité, les articles sont faciles à porter lors des déplacements sur le marché. Les produits sont vendus sur le marché de la capitale.
Le prêt sert à acheter des articles qui seront revendus au marché : paille de fer, cyprex, zex, éponge et des gants de cuisine.
texts.en:
Estelle is 36 years old and cohabits with her partner. She has 3 children, one girl and two boys. One of her boys, aged 15, is in Year 8 in a public school. The other, who is 14, is in Year 6. Finally, her 9-year-old daughter is in a public primary school. Her husband is a bricklayer and is paid every 2 weeks.

The couple own their own wooden house. They were able to build this house thanks to the profits they earned from previous activities. Their aim is to be able to rebuild their home, this time in brick.

Estelle sells products for the kitchen and has been doing so since 2005. Her merchandise is easy for her to carry to the market and it is sold at the market in the capital.

This loan will be used to buy articles for resale at the market; scouring pads, Cyprex and Zex cleaners, sponges, and oven gloves.

loans.use: to buy kitchen products; scouring pads, Zex cleaner, sponges, oven gloves.

loans.name: Nilsa

texts.es: Nilsa es una persona muy sacrificada y luchadora, y comenta que montó para su veterinaria, y tiene muchos clientes que siempre acuden hasta su negocio. Poco a poco quiere crecer y es por eso que pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para su veterinaria, como ser shampoo, medicamentos y otros productos.
texts.en: Nilsa is a very demanding person and a fighter. She comments that she set up her veterinary clinic and has many clients who  always come to her business. She wants to grow little by little and so she is requesting a loan to buy veterinary supplies such as shampoo, medication and other products.

loans.use: to buy veterinary supplies like shampoo, medications and other products.

loans.name: Aliabbas

texts.en:
Aliabbas is 20 years old. He was born in Imishli region. He has a family of parents and a younger sister who resides there at the moment. Aliabbas is a student at university and it is his second year. His family loves him a lot and they miss him.

He studies in Baku. He comes home on holidays and sometimes for weekends and during this time he helps his family with farming. Aliabbas has one aim in life: to become a great surgeon. He knows that it is an ambitious target, but he studies hard and fights for his principles in life. He is very studious and always reads additional materials, searches on the internet for new things, and also has a very sociable personality. He is ready for class everyday and makes his professors proud. He is believed to become a great doctor because he shows great enthusiasm. He is taking his studies on this subject very seriously and also has great ambition.

Aliabbas knows that growing Azerbaijan requires great professional doctors in the medical field. He tries his best for this end. Currently due to his family's difficulty he needs 1,500 AZN. This amount he will use for paying his tuition fees. He is very hopeful that KIVA lenders will show their support.

loans.use: pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: San Miguel 3 Group

texts.es:
20 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza,  donde todas están luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las Sras. Zulma, quien se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, a través de la venta de verduras frescas y de estación que comercializa desde hace un tiempo, por lo que ya tiene muchos clientes.
La Sra. Zulma solicita de este prestamo para la compra de verduras como lechugas, locotes, cebolla entre otros, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
There are 20 women who make up this group. They are in the elimination of poverty program, where they all are striving to be able to improve their living conditions.
One of the members is Zulma, who is improving her situation of poverty through selling fresh and seasonal vegetables which she has sold for some time, and for which she has many customers.
Zulma is requesting this loan to be able to buy vegetables, such as lettuce, peppers, and onions, among others. This will help her to finalize her business plan, which will help her to improve her revenue.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell, such as lettuce, peppers, and onions, among others.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La Sra. Olga es de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, ella tiene una Despensa en su propia casa, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, comenta que tiene 6 años en su negocio, y ya es muy conocida en el barrio.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que con sacrificio se ha abierto camino y ayuda a su marido por medio de su trabajo a mantener la casa.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, panificados, enlatados y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Olga is from the city of Villa Elisa. She has a food store in her home. She is married and has 2 children. She comments that she has had her business for 6 years, and she is very well-known in the neighborhood.

She is a very hard-working woman who, through sacrifice, has made her way, and who helps her husband through her work to support their home.

She is asking for this loan to be able to purchase supplies for her food store, such as vegetables, fruits, breads, canned goods, and others, and thus be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruit, breads, canned goods, and others to dispense.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Liza is 39 years old and two of her children are in school.

Liza has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 7000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as sugar, fish, vegetables, etc.

Liza has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar, fish, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Zarman

texts.en:
Financial constraints, the desire for a better life, and good quality education for her 3 children are only a few of the valuable factors that encouraged Zarman  to start her business selling animals by taking a loan from Kashf Foundation. Zarman is 41 years old and she is a married woman. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. 

She needs to improve her business to support her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40000 PKR to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Berthine

texts.fr:
Berthine a 40 ans, elle est divorcée. Elle a quatre enfants, l’aîné de 19 ans est marié, le second de 16 ans a arrêté ses études faute de moyens financiers, la  fille de 21 ans l’appuie dans son activité, la dernière de 10 ans est scolarisée dans une école privée. Elle ne paie pas de loyer. Elle projette l’extension du local où elle habite en raison de son exiguïté.
Berthine a exercé l’activité de vente de poissons depuis 2005. Avant, elle s’adonnait à la vente de viande. A la formalisation de l’unité, elle a choisi la vente de poissons. Le développement de l’activité dépend de la qualité et de la quantité de produits offerts sur le marché, elle connaît bien les fournisseurs ainsi que la qualité des produits d’où cette demande de second prêt pour développer l’activité.
Le prêt sert à acheter divers poissons d’eau douce  et des poissons de mer pour le revendre au grand marché de la capitale.
texts.en:
Berthine is 40 years old and is divorced. She has 4 children. Her eldest son, who is 19, is married. Her second-eldest son, who is 16, had to stop his studies due to a lack of funds. Her 21-year-old daughter helps her with her business and her 10-year-old daughter attends a private school. Berthine does not pay rent. She plans to extend her home as it is presently very narrow.

Berthine has been selling fish since 2005. She used to sell meat before deciding to start a business selling fish. The development of her business depends on the quality and quantity of the products she offers for sale at the market. She knows the suppliers well, as well as the quality of the goods, which is why she is requesting this second loan in order to expand her business.

The loan will be used to buy various different fresh water and salt water fish for resale at the Grand Market in the capital.

loans.use: to buy fresh water and salt water fish.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras De San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El grupo se encuentra dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder conocer su situación y conforme a ello poder esforzarse por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosana, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace todos los días desde muy temprano en la mañana. Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella y le va muy bien.
La Sra. Rosana solicita de este préstamo para la compra de comidas en cantidad, empanadas, sándwich  para poder mejorar y abastecer su producción y también para la compra de insumos para hacer más comidas para la venta.
texts.en:
The group is in the "Poverty Spotlight" program. Each one is making her greatest effort to find out her situation and make an effort to improve.

One of the members is Rosana, who earns a living selling food she herself makes every day, starting very early in the morning. She says she has very good customers who always buy from her, and that it's going very well for her.

Rosana's requesting this loan to buy food wholesale, empanadas, and sandwiches to improve and stock her production. She's also going to buy ingredients to make more food to sell.

loans.use: to buy food wholesale, empanadas, and sandwiches to improve and stock her business and to buy ingredients for making more food to sell

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es:
El Sr. Sebastián se desempeña como vendedor, está casado con la Sra. María, quien a su vez tiene una despensa y venta de artesanías y manualidades hechas por ella misma en su casa, lo cual le permite generar ingresos sin salir de su casa y estar a los cuidados de sus hijos.
Él y su esposa se esfuerzan por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus hijos. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la refacción de su vivienda, el cual es el lugar donde está su despensa.
texts.en:
Sebastian is a salesman and is married to Mary, who has a shop and sells arts and crafts she makes at home. This allows her to generate income without leaving her home so she can care for their children.

He and his wife are working to improve their living conditions and those of their children. He is asking for this loan to invest in the renovation of their home, which is where their shop is.

loans.use: renovate his home, which contains a shop.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El Sr. Cesar tiene 40 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Catalina y vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá, proviene de una familia que se dedica netamente a la fabricación y ventas de artesanías así como la tradicional sobrecama y hamacas. Desde muy joven acompañó a su padre en la ventas así de a poco comenzó a trabajar solo, hoy en día ya tiene una muy buena clientela formada donde cada fin de semana se va a cobrar y colocar su mercaderías. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra sobrecamas, hamacas, frazadas y otros productos para la venta.
texts.en:
Cesar is 40 years old and married to Catalina. They live in the city of Carapeguá and belong to a family that earns a living purely through making and selling artisanal products, like traditional bedspreads and hammocks.

From a very young age, he accompanied his father on sales and gradually began working alone. Today, he has a very good customer base formed and goes to collect and every weekend goes to receive and drop off his goods. He's asking for the loan to buy bedspreads, hammocks, blankets and other items for sale.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, hammocks, blankets and other items for sale.

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
El Sr. Fausto continua con las ventas de menudencias que hace, comenta que su préstamo anterior le fue de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con sus ventas, además de ello su esposa tiene una despensa en su casa y de esa forma ambos se ayudan para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción de manera a ampliar su casa, el cual es su despensa en la cual tiene su negocio.
texts.en:
Fausto continues with the giblet sales he does. He says his earlier loan was very helpful for being able to continue with his sales. In addition to this, his wife has a pantry in the house and both things help them to be able to grow and get ahead.

He's asking for this loan to invest in construction materials to grow his house, which is where his pantry is and where he has his business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to remodel his house.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 

She requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business like rice, milk, young coconut, sugar, etc.

Rebecca has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business like rice, milk, young coconut, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Noong Het 22 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuong, 29, is Thai ethnic lady who has been married and become the mother of two boys. She lives with her husband and her children in a Thai ethnic traditional house in a small village, where people mainly rely on agricultural production for a living. Like other villagers, Mrs. Thuong and her husband work very hard at farming and animal husbandry with plenty of activities such as growing wet rice, upland rice, cassava, corn, raising pig, and duck. 

This is the sixth time that she has taken a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy piglets and food for them. She hopes that the investment will go well and bring good income for her family.

Mrs. Thuong dreams that her children will be successful in their careers and escape from poverty. In the picture, she stands first from the right.

loans.use: to buy piglets and food for them.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is 43 years old and a married woman. She is involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. 

Saima has requested a loan of 50000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business so she can boost her earnings with the loan.

loans.use: to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors.

loans.name: Las Poderosas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario las poderosas, lo integran tres mujeres laboriosas que luchan por el bienestar de sus familias, la coordinadora es Karen de 35 años de edad, acompañada, madre de dos hijos por quienes trabaja duro, para darles un futuro mejor,  ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace seis años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de camisas, pantalones, chores y faldas. La segunda socia es Martha de 54 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de tortilla, la tercer socia es Rosa de 55 años se dedica a la venta de comida.
texts.en:
The "Las Poderosas" communal bank is made up of three industrious women who fight for the well-being of their families. The coordinator is Karen. She is 35 years old, married and the mother of two children. She works hard for them, to give them a better future. She has worked selling clothing for six years. She is requesting the loan to buy shirts, pants, shorts and skirts.

The second member is Martha who is 54 years old who works selling tortillas. The third member is Rosa who is 55 years old who works selling meals.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, shorts and skirts.

loans.name: Ceyhun

texts.en:
Ceyhun is 20 years old. He is from Imishli region, and his family is in the southern part of the country.

Ceyhun is a student at university, and he has been studying since two years ago. Alongside his parents, he has one younger brother. Being the eldest son of the family, his family has great expectations for him. They are proud that their son is studying in Baku, far away from home. And all his relatives believe that one day Ceyhun will be a successful man and make the whole town proud.

He is very a studious person. He prepares for the lessons, does homework timely and always gets good grades from the finals. Ceyhun is referred by a professor as a future economist. He is taking his studies on this subject very seriously and also has great ambition.

Ceyhun is aware of Azerbaijan's being a geopolitically strong country and he wants to analyze the economy once he becomes an economist after graduation.

Ceyhun is facing financial difficulty. It has become difficult for his parents to pay the tuition fees, so he needs 1,900 AZN. These funds he will use for paying the tuition fees. He is very hopeful that Kiva lenders will show their support.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fees.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. María está casada con el señor Ramón, ambos tienen 2 hijos pequeños, por quienes se esfuerzan para poder sacarlos adelante. Ella tiene en su casa una despensa y el Señor por su parte posee una carpintería. 
Ambos ponen todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.  Pide este préstamo para la compra de productos variados para la venta, como ser verduras, frutas, carne, enlatados y otro, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Maria is married to Ramón and together they have two small children, who they work hard to bring up. She has a pantry in her house and her husband, for his part, has a carpentry shop.

Both give their all to be able to grow and get ahead and give their family a better quality of life. She asks for this loan to buy various products to sell, like vegetables, fruits, meat and canned goods, among others. In this way, she'll be able to continue with her sales as she's been doing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, meat, canned goods and other things to stock her pantry.

loans.name: Estrella Del Norte Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Estrella del norte  está conformado por cuatro mujeres emprendedoras de éxito,  coordinado por María Elena de 41 años de edad, casada, madre de tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas desde hace cinco años donde oferta una amplia variedad de productos a sus clientes. Solicita  por doceavo ciclo el financiamiento en la institución para la compra de cadenas, pulseras, anillos y aretes con créditos anteriores logro comprar más mercadería y con las ganancias compro un televisor, la segunda socia es Lili de 35 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa, la tercer socia es María Esther de 22 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado y la cuarta socia es Ángela de 29 años, se dedica a la venta de fritanga.
texts.en:
The solidarity group, Estrella del norte, is made up of four successful entrepreneurial women. The group is coordinated by María Elena, who is 41 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has worked selling articles of clothing for five years, in which she offers a wide variety of products of her customers.
She is requesting the loan for the twelfth financing cycle in the institution to buy chains, bracelets, rings and earrings. With previous loan she has been able to by more merchandise and with the earnings she bought a television.
The second member is Lili, who is 35 years old and works selling clothing. The third member is María Esther, who is 22 years old and works selling clothing and footwear. The fourth member is Ángela, who is 29 years old and sells fried foods.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as men's and women's pants, men's and women's shirts; gold jewelry like chains, bracelets, rings, and anklets; women's shoes; etc.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija has opened her second business. In addition to her rental houses, she is now selling fresh water to the residents of her village.

This is her ninth loan from VisionFund Kenya and she will use the loan to purchase water storage tanks.

She hopes to supply water even when there is a shortage and hopes to have a clean and happy family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase water storage tanks to improve her water business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a single woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows onions, kale, and potatoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will succeed in business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with five children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows maize and beans and also keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 15 years and her primary customers are locals.

Salome says her biggest business challenge is crop pests. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is the responsible mother of 1 child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 15 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family.

Her husband needs to make maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to make maintenance on his taxi. Therefore Rabia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Rabia's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Rabia also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Rabia is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: 's husband repair his taxi.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells scrap metal. His primary customers are locals.

Nicholas will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy gutters to harvest rain water and a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy gutters to harvest rain water and a water tank to store it.

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr:
Justine a 61 ans. Elle est veuve. Ses cinq enfants sont tous déjà mariés. Son fils qui a déjà divorcé habite chez elle. Elle loue une maison, son fils l’appuie financièrement. Justine projette de ne pas dépendre financièrement de ses enfants et de disposer des fonds pour développer des activités en milieu rural.
Justine a développé le petit magasin général depuis 2011. Avant, elle s’adonnait à l’activité de marchand ambulant dans d’autres régions : vente de légumes, activité qu’elle a abandonnée en raison de l’insécurité en milieu rural et à cause de son âge déjà avancé. Elle a choisi de créer le magasin général car c’est une activité moins fatigante.
texts.en:
Justine is 61 years old. She is a widow. Her 5 children are all already married. One of her sons, who is divorced, lives with her. She rents a house and her son helps her financially.

Justine plans to be self-sufficient and not have to depend on her children financially, and to build enough funds to be able to develop business activities in the country.

Justine has been developing her small general store since 2011. Before that, she was a street seller and sold other products, like vegetables, which she stopped doing because of the insecurity in rural areas and her advanced age. She decided to create a general store because it is less tiring work.

loans.use: to buy staples like rice, sugar, salt, oil, matches, candles, soaps, candy, pastas, etc.

loans.name: Agelica

texts.en:
Agelica is a married woman with three children and describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for five years and her primary customers are locals.

Agelica says her biggest business challenge is not having adequate working capital. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 50 years old, married to Kutoleh, and blessed with three children.

She has been in the vegetable and dairy farming business for six years and earns a monthly income of Kshs. 25,000. This being her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, she intends to buy dairy feed and more vegetables for resale in the village.

Rose anticipates to save more for higher borrowing from the expanded business profits. Her dream is to grow her business so that she may improve her income.

loans.use: to buy  dairy feed and more vegetables for resale in the village.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a married man with four children. He describes himself as a visionary. He operates a motorcycle transport business, where he transports customers using a motorcycle. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are local people. He will use his KES 50,000 loan to buy his own motorcycle to use in providing transport services. His business goal is to own a tuk-tuk (motor rickshaw) within five years.

loans.use: to buy his own motorcycle to use in providing transport services.

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es: Mónica es una comerciante de 36 años que reside con su hijo de un año y su cónyuge en un barrio tradicional de Barranquilla, ella heredó de su madre esta profesión y lleva cinco años en su propio negocio.  Todos los días son una oportunidad para encontrarse con sus amigos, vecinos, familiares y conocidos y promover ventas de su catálogo de productos, calzado y prendas de vestir, por ello es muy importante mantener un surtido a la vanguardia y contar con un capital que respalde las solicitudes de sus clientes.  En la actualidad Mónica realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar vestidos, blusas, pantalones y artículos para el cuidado personal, inversión con la que proyecta incrementar sus ventas y con ello sus utilidades. Mónica sueña con darle una vivienda propia a su familia y trabaja para que sus deseos se hagan realidad.
texts.en:
Mónica is a 36-year-old wholesaler who lives with her one-year-old son and her partner in a traditional neighborhood in Barranquilla. She inherited this profession from her mother and has had her own business for five years. 

Every day is an opportunity for her to meet with her friends, neighbors, family members and acquaintances and promote sales from her product catalog (shoes and clothing). As a result, it's very important for her to maintain a fashionable stock and have capital that supports her customers' orders. 

Currently, Mónica applied for a loan, a Kiva credit, which is an opportunity to link her financial life through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy clothing, blouses, pants and personal care products. She projects this investment will increase her sales and thus her profit. Mónica dreams of giving her family a good life and works so her dreams can become a reality.

loans.use: to buy clothing, blouses, pants and personal care products.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a single woman with one child. She describes herself as a determined person. She operates a farm where she keeps poultry and dairy cows. She has been in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are local people. She describes her biggest business challenge as a shortage of stock to meet customer demand. She will use her KES 40,000 loan to buy more chickens. Her business goal is to have more dairy cows within five years. This is her first loan fromSMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for her farm.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is married with two children. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years and his primary customers are locals.

He says his biggest business challenge is a lack of adequate working capital. James will use this loan of KES 30,000 to buy more stocks of sugar, rice, bread, soap and other items to sell. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years.

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, rice, bread, soap and other items to sell.

loans.name: Keziah

texts.en:
Keziah is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a farm where she grows onions, beans, kale, and tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for four years.

Keziah's business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is 43 years old and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has three sons and one daughter who are in school. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothing for two years and he is the sole provider for the household.

Shehnaz's husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Shehnaz is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband with these purchases. This loan will enable him to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profits.

Shehnaz is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: expand her husband's clothing business.

loans.name: Gabriel Alfredo

texts.es: Gabriel de 40 años es un comerciante que reside en un barrio del municipio de Soledad y cuenta con una amplia experiencia de cinco años en la comercialización de juguetes en una feria que se realiza todos los años para la temporada decembrina, alternamente en el resto del año comercializa artículos para el aseo en el hogar, ropa de cama y víveres.  Gabriel es padre de dos hijos menores de edad y se encuentra separado de su cónyuge, sin embargo él es muy responsable con el bienestar de sus hijos y su meta personal es costearles sus estudios académicos y profesionales.  Sus compras las realiza en el centro de Barranquilla y realiza viajes a Maicao un municipio de la Guajira donde encuentra una excelente oferta de productos a buenos precios.  Gabriel realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar juguetes para la temporada de navidad y víveres; aceite, arroz, leche en polvo, legumbres.  El sueño de prosperidad de Gabriel es tener un almacén misceláneo y mejorar sus ingresoso.
texts.en:
40-year-old Gabriel is a salesman who resides in a neighborhood in the Soledad municipality. He has five years' experience in marketing toys at a fair that is held every year for the holiday season. The rest of the year he sells personal care products, bedding and food staples.

Gabriel is the father of two minor children and is separated from his spouse, but he is very much responsible for the welfare of his children. His personal goal is to pay for their academic and professional studies.

He makes his purchases in the center of Barranquilla and makes trips to the town of Maicao in the Guajira area, where there is an excellent range of products at good prices.

Gabriel applied for a loan through Kiva partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo (the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation) to buy toys for the Christmas season and food staples including oil, rice, powdered milk and vegetables. Gabriel's dream of prosperity is to have a variety store and to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy toys for the Christmas season and staples including oil, rice, powdered milk and vegetables.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is an honest and hard-working man who, after much focus in business, began to work hard to get his child ahead. Currently he has a store in the market where he sells television sets, television antennas and decoders. His wife, who is his primary support, doesn't allow this committed man stop his growth as a salesman.

At this time, Isaac's business is at a key point, given that his customers are demanding more and better-quality products. Because of this, he is asking for a loan from Kiva with ID-Ghana which allows him to buy more television sets and other electrical appliances. With this he will take advantage of the season of the year and increase his earnings. In the future he wants to improve the infrastructure of his store and be able to sell more electrical appliances.

loans.use: to buy more television sets and other electrical appliances.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 48-year-old woman, and the mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a vegetable seller by profession, her husband sells vegetables, e.g. onions, potatoes, tomatoes, etc. Her husband is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Nasreen's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables for reselling so that her husband can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position her husband is not in a condition to purchase vegetables for his business purpose.

Therefore Nasreen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for the business purpose.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: 's husband to increase his vegetable business

loans.name: Lantoniaina Madeleine

texts.fr:
Lantoniaina a 23 ans, elle est mariée. Le couple a deux enfants (8-6 ans) scolarisés dans une école privée. Le mari l’appuie dans cette activité. 
Le couple ne paie pas de loyer, néanmoins il projette de réhabiliter leur maison en 2016 (extension) et acquérir un terrain si le prix est à la portée du revenu et de l'épargne du ménage.
Lantoniaina vend des sacs et des sacoches. C’est une activité exercée depuis 2014.Le développement de l’activité de petit commerce dépend de la connaissance des besoins des clients et des articles qui se vendent bien. Elle a choisi la vente de sacs et sacoches car le marché est actuellement très porteur.
texts.en:
Lantoniaina is 23 years old and married. The couple have 2 children, aged 8 and 6, who both attend a private school. Her husband supports her with her business.

The couple do not pay rent but plan to extend their house in 2016 and to buy some land if they can afford it with their income and household savings.

Lantoniaina has been selling bags and backpacks since 2014. The development of her small retail business depends on knowing the customers' needs and which items sell well. She chose to sell bags and backpacks because the market is currently very promising.

loans.use: to buy travel bags, backpacks, handbags.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana runs a beauty salon in Vinogradovo, where she offers manicure and pedicure services to her female customers. She rents a facility for work and prefers to work on her own without hiring any other employees at this point. Diana started this business only two years ago, so she is relatively new to this sphere of work.

Diana is 23 and she is single. She lives with her mom, which helps her balance expenses and help her mother.

Diana loves running this business. She invests a lot of energy and effort into quality services and her clientele, which pays off really well.

At this point, Diana is seeking 10,000 grivnyas to buy an ultraviolet lamp, a dry-heat sterilizer and other supplies for her day-to-day work.

loans.use: to buy an ultraviolet lamp, a dry-heat sterilizer and other supplies for her day-to-day work

loans.name: Mohiniso

texts.en:
Mohiniso is a hardworking woman. She is married parent of three children. Mohiniso’s husband is an electrician.

Mohiniso is going to start her own business deal and, in this way, get ahead. She wants to start a business with sewing because she can sew national women's dresses. She took part in a course called “To Get Ahead” of the women's organization and got a certificate.

She is asking for a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy a new sewing machine for organizing her new business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Dios Nos Ayude Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Dios con nosotros es conformado por tres microempresarias exitosas coordinado por Raquel de 32 años de edad, soltera y madre de tres hijos de 15,11 y 8 años de edad por los que trabaja fuertemente para sacarlos adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos nuevos y usados con la ayuda de su hermana quien también  atiende a los clientes en el principal mercado de la ciudad desde hace quince años. Solicita por séptimo ciclo el financiamiento en la institución para la compra de zapatos y sandalias. con el crédito anterior logro comprar un equipo de sonido y su meta es hacer crecer el negocio. La segunda socia es Marvelly  de 40 años propietaria de una pulpería y la tercer socia es Josefa de 48 años, quien se dedica a la venta de ropa.
texts.en: The communal bank "Dios Con Nosotros" is made up of 3 successful small-businesswomen.  The group coordinator is Raquel.  She is 32 years old, single, and is the mother of 3 children aged 15, 11, and 8.  She works very hard to provide for them.  She has a business selling new and used shoes.  Her sister helps with the business by serving customers in the main market of the city.  Raquel has had this business for 15 years.  She is requesting her 7th loan from the institution to buy shoes and sandals.  With her previous loan, she was able to buy a stereo.  Her goal is to grow her business.  The other members of the group are Marvelly, 40, who owns a grocery store, and Josefa, 48, who sells clothing.

loans.use: to buy shoes and sandals

loans.name: Belquis

texts.es: Belquis, tiene la edad  de 31 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y sus hijos, los cuales son  su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle al cultivo de café y así que tenga un buen desarrollo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo de su cosecha, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo del café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Belquis is 31 years old, married and lives with her husband and children, which are her first priority. With her loan, she aims to buy fertilizers and other products to apply to the coffee crop so it develops well, as well as pay for labor to apply products and help with the plantation once her crop develops. This way, she'll be assured of achieving good work.

Her aim is to take advantage of the good soil and climate conditions in the zone for this crop and also put into practice her experience of several years growing coffee. In addition to being able to buy the best high-quality products for her plantation to develop well and healthy, she'll also have an adequate harvest and a significant short-term production.

When the expected harvest comes in, she wants to use it for the welfare of her family to meet some family goals and continue investing more in the crop. This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has not had a previous loan in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given her an easier loan with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy products to help with her coffee.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is 46 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines.

Allen requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig. She has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Allen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Mehnaz

texts.en:
Mehnaz is a responsible mother of six children who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for ten years. He takes responsibility for covering all the financial needs of the entire family. His taxi needs maintenance, because the current condition of his taxi is not good. It should receive daily maintenance, but he does not have sufficient funds to provide it. To help him, Mehnaz has applied for a Kiva loan through Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan, Mehnaz's husband can easily afford the maintenance on his taxi, which will permit him to provide better transport facilities and earn a good income. Mehnaz also plans to make save part of her husband's profits, to meet her family's future needs.
Mehnaz is very grateful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the expenses of repairing her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Zelia

texts.en:
Zelia lives in Dili B and her business is a restaurant. She lives near many people, so she had the idea to open a restaurant for everybody nearby to come and eat there. She earns a good income every day because many people come to eat in her restaurant. She is very happy with her business.

Now she is applying for a loan of $ 1500 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business because she wants to open a bigger restaurant in the future. She opened her restaurant a few years ago with her own working capital. She is taking this loan because she wants to use it to buy more foodstuff such as rice, beef, pork, fish, chicken, herbs, eggs, instant noodles and otherthings for the restaurant.

She hopes that, with this loan, her business will improve in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, beef, pork, fish, chicken, herbs, eggs, instant noodles and other food products for the restaurant.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is a simple housewife. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her 4 children. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of family. Naheed is also providing sewing services and earning an income to contribute, with her husband, to managing the household.

She needs different kinds of goods, e.g needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, and etc. for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and is also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Naheed is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Rubina is a 38-year-old married woman. She runs a small low-income private school. The school has an enrollment of around 128 children, and she hopes to improve her enrollment in future. Despite facing financial challenges because of competition from other schools in the community, she has provided needy children with a free education, along with free books and uniforms. She has applied for a loan of PKR 110,000 to improve her school building and provide a comfortable environment for her students by purchasing new furniture. Rubina desires to educate her students to brighten the future of her country.

loans.use: to improve the building where she runs a small low-income private school and to provide comfortable new furniture for her students.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.fr:
Clotilde est une femme de 59 ans, mariée à un chef d’équipe et n’a qu’un seul enfant, un jeune homme de 20 ans. Le principal souci de Clotilde est son fils unique  qui traverse actuellement une période difficile en raison de sa jeunesse, elle a comme objectif la réussite de son enfant dans ses études  pour que son enfant ait un avenir meilleur.
Depuis 2007, Clotilde s’est livrée dans la vente de riz et à la gargote. Elle a construit  un local de vente en face  de son domicile. Elle a une expérience dans la gargote. Le riz est, soit vendu sur le point de vente , soit livré aux clients. 
Le prêt servira à acheter divers variétés de riz (makalioka, tsipala, stock tampon, gasy, mavokely)  destinés à la revente et des légumes (haricot-vert, patate, pomme de terre) pour l’activité de gargote.
texts.en:
Clotilde is a 59-year-old woman who is married to a team leader and only has one child, a young 20-year-old man. Clotilde's main concern is her son, who is currently going through a difficult time because of his youth. Her goal is to ensure that her child succeeds in his education so that he has a better future.

Since 2007, Clotilde has been selling rice and food in a small canteen. She built her sales point in front of her home. She has experience working in a canteen. The rice is either sold to customers at the point of sale, or delivered to them.

The loan will be used to buy different types of rice (makalioka, tsipala, stock tampon, gasy, and mavokely) for resale and vegetables (green beans, sweet potatoes, potatoes) to serve in her canteen.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and vegetables.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 20 years old. He is from in Imishli region, and his family lives there. He started his higher education two years ago. He has two siblings and parents. Being the eldest son of the family, he loves to support his old parents, such as helping them daily in farming activities during holidays and on the weekends.

He is a very hard-working person and very passionate about his studies. Ahmad is labelled as a diligent student at the university. He studies in Baku capital city, which is far from his home.

Ahmad is studying history and is very fond of this subject. He knows that Azerbaijan, as an independent country for 20 years, has a rich history, and Ahmad wants to be both part of it and contribute to it. He is thinking of being a historian and writing books about the glorious past of his motherland.

Currently he requires 1,800 AZN. With this funding, he is going to pay tuition fees and purchase the university textbooks. He hopes that Kiva lenders will show their support.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen Del Carmen está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Concepción, una zona aun alejada de la capital del país, que se esfuerza por crecer y salir adelante.
La Sra. Esmilce es una de las integrantes, ella tiene un negocio de ventas de comestibles, minutas, a parte eso hace artesanías en crochet como ser artículos de la casa, vestimentas o por zapatillas. 
Solicita de este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer alimentos para la venta, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The group called "Virgen Del Carmen" is in their first loan cycle with the Women's Committee Program. It is from the city of Concepción, which is an area far from the capital that is striving to grow and progress.

Esmilce is one of the members. She has a business selling food and miscellaneous items. Besides this she makes crochet handicrafts such as household items, clothing and shoes.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies to make foods to sell such as vegetables, meat, condiments and others. In this way she can continue with her work as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to be able to grow and progress.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for meals such as vegetables, meat, condiments and others.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria continua con sus estudios en contabilidad, por medio de sus estudios quiere abrirse camino y ayudar a sus seres queridos, comenta que con su préstamo anterior pudo pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con sus estudios.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar la matricula de su carrera, y también las cuotas de su universidad.
texts.en:
Maria continues with her studies in accounting.  Through her studies, she wants to make her way and help her loved ones.  She says that with her previous loan she was able to pay the fees of her degree, which was of much help to be able to continue with her studies.

Today she is requesting this new loan to be able to pay the matriculation of her degree and also the fees of her university.

loans.use: To pay matriculation of her degree and fees.

loans.name: Ikatu Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado IKATU está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres integrado por 17mujeres todas ellas son vecinas quienes luchan día a día para sacar a sus familias adelante. Estas señoras mejoraron sus ingresos gracias al esfuerzo que realizan.
Una de las integrantes que se destaca por ser una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora, es la Sra. Paola, quien es vendedora de ropas, comenta que tiene todo tipo de prendas, y que por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus demás seres queridos. Ella se define a sí misma como una persona que lucha y se esfuerza por quienes ella quiere.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas variadas para la venta, como ser jeans, camisas, pantalones, remeras y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Ikatu Communal Bank is in their third cycle with the women’s committee program, which consists of seventeen women.  They are all neighbors who strive daily to get their families ahead.  These women are improving their income thanks to their efforts.

Paola is one of the women who stands out for being a hard worker, and being willing to make sacrifices.
