She sells clothing and tells us that she has all types of garments, and that through her work she has the means to be able to help her family and the rest of her loved ones.  She describes herself as a person who strives and makes an effort for those she loves.

She is requesting this loan to purchase a variety of clothing to sell such as jeans, shirts, pants, T-shirts, and other items.  In this way, she will be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing to sell such as jeans, shirts, pants, T-shirts, and other items

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo trabaja como empleado en una empresa, está casado y su esposa siempre la ayuda en todo lo que puede.
Guillermo desde niño le gusta estudiar y desea ser un gran profesional, en su carrera de administración de empresas.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar sus materiales de estudios, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Guillermo works as an employee in a business. He is married, and his spouse helps in all she can. Ever since childhood Guillermo has liked to study and hopes to be a great professional in his business administration career.

He seeks this loan to be able to buy study materials, in order to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to buy study materials.

loans.name: Jennibeth

texts.en:
Jennibeth is a 27-year-old woman who does domestic work for a living. She goes fishing and her husband is also a fisherman. She lives in her own home with her husband and four-year old son. They work together to meet the family needs and expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing nets and nylon. These materials are very vital to her livelihood. These will help improve her on-going catch, and help her in seeking ways to become more productive.

In the future, she hopes that she can improve her livelihood and be able to save for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing nets and nylon.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a quarry where he sells building stones. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are locals.

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Joash

texts.en: Joash is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells meat. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use and also in the butchery. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is a 25-year-old man from Kisumu who is married and supporting two people in his family.

He peovides transport services via his motorcycle, a business he has been doing for the last two years and makes a monthly income of KES. 20,000.

He has applied for his second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase a tracking system to help him secure the motorcycle from any possible theft.

He is planning to use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase a tracking system  to help him secure the motorcycle from any possible theft.

loans.name: Dianah

texts.en:
Dianah is 39 years old and a tailor at Voi Kenya. She is a mother of three and her spouse provides for additional income. For the last three years, she has been in this business earning good income.

This is her third borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business, she will use the money requested to purchase African prints and assorted sewing threads in preparation for the festive season ahead.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to repay her loan and educate her children.

She hopes to own a boutique in future.

loans.use: to purchase African prints and assorted sewing threads.

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.en:
Exaltacion is 63 years old and married.

Exaltacion is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig. She has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Exaltacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Bessie

texts.en:
Bessie is 47 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Bessie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like condiments, snack foods, personal care products and other groceries. Bessie has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Bessie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like condiments, snack foods, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is a married woman. She is 61 years old with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jessie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell to her customers.

Jessie has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 50 años trabajadora y madre de un hijo de 27 años. Es licenciada en rehabilitación y medicina física, está soltera y actualmente vive en Xalapa, en donde tiene su negocio.
María inició su negocio hace 5 años y es una empresa que se dedica a la distribución de recursos para clínicas y spas. Ofrece la venta de aparatología, ropa desechable, líneas cosméticas e imparte cursos de actualización a médicos, enfermeras y cosmetólogas.
Tomo la decisión de arrancar el negocio ya que en Veracruz existía la oportunidad de implementar un negocio que cubriera esta necesidad y la supo aprovechar. 
En los últimos años, su empresa ha crecido y cumplido con sus objetivos. Hoy en día, la empresa tiene un alcance para toda la república e incluso el extranjero.
Con la idea de tener una solvencia económica para poder crear sucursales, María ha solicitado un crédito para comprar ropa desechable y de esa manera poder cubrir los pedidos que tiene e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria, 50, is a hardworking woman, and single mother of a 27 year old son. She has a master’s degree in physical medicine and rehabilitation, and currently lives in Xalapa where she has her business.

Maria started her business five years ago, and the business is engaged in the distribution of resources for clinics and spas. She sells equipment, appliances, disposable clothing, and cosmetic lines, and also provides refresher courses for doctors, nurses and cosmetologists.
She decided to start the business because there was an opportunity in Veracruz to establish a business that met this need, and she knew how to take advantage of it.

In recent years, her business has grown and met its objectives. Today, the business extends throughout the republic and even abroad.

With the idea of having financial solvency and being able to open other store locations, Maria is requesting a loan to purchase disposable clothing, and in this way, fill her orders, and increase sales.

loans.use: to purchase disposable clothing, and in this way, fill her orders.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos es de la ciudad de Itá, está estudiando la carrera ingeniería en zootecnia, comenta que le gustaría ser un buen profesional que ayude a las demás personas por medio de su trabajo.
Sus metas son, ser un buen ingeniero, trabajar de forma independiente y tener su propia producción bovina y porcina.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Marcos is from the city of Itá. He is studying the degree of engineering in animal husbandry. He says that he would like to be a good professional who helps other people through his job.

His goals are to be a good engineer, to work independently, and to have his own production of cattle and swine.

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees of his degree and in this way be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay the fees of his degree.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
El Señor Marcelo es de la ciudad de Itá, trabaja en un comercial y al mismo tiempo es estudiante Universitario, está cursando el 4to Año de Licenciatura en Radiología.
Comenta que trabaja desde pequeño, es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Marcelo is from the city of Itá. He works in a store, and is also a university student. He is in the 4th year of a degree program in Radiology. He states that he has worked since he was young. He is a very responsible person with goals to get ahead.

He seeks this loan to cover the costs of fees and tuition, in order to cover these costs he has.

loans.use: to cover the costs of tuition and fees.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 36 years and sells snacks, soft drinks and bottled water at Voi Kenya.

She is a single mother of five who has been doing well in this business for the last three years.

This is her fourth borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan requested to purchase stocks of snacks, soft drinks and bottled water for resale.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to educate her children.

She hopes to have a happy family and educated children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, soft drinks and bottled water.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 26 years old and single. He is a farmer of tea, sheep, and cows.

He began farming in 2012 and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000 from sales of tea and milk.

This being his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, he intends to buy fertilizers for his crops and dairy feed for his cows.

With the anticipated profits, he will be able to pay school fees for his brother who is currently in school.

loans.use: to provide fertilizers for his crops and also buy dairy feed.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 30-year-old green grocer at Kilifi, Kenya. She is a mother of two who has been in this business for the last three years with a good income.

This is her fourth borrowing after successfully repaying her loans. She will use the money requested to purchase tomatoes, kale, onions and cabbages.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, kale, onions and cabbages

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 28 years old, single and blessed with one child who is two years old.

She has been selling cereals, a business she has done for one year and earns a monthly income of Kshs 35,000.

This being her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, she intends to buy more maize, beans and sorghum for resale in the market as she anticipates providing medical care and food for her child from the expanded business profits.

Her dream is to live a healthy life with happiness.

loans.use: To purchase stock of cereals to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, juice,bread, flour, soap, rice and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the 90,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of sugar, bread, soap, flour and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children and buy land for his family.

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy land for his family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, bread, soap, flour and other items.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be trustworthy.

She operates a retail business where she sells phone accessories and also operates an M-Pesa business. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy town, and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy more phone accessories and add M-Pesa float.

This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more phone accessories and add M-Pesa float.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be hard working. He operates a quarry where he mines building stones. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy materials to set up a green house to enable him to grow tomatoes. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy materials to set up a green house

loans.name: Calisto

texts.en:
Calisto is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, soap, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour and other items. His business goal is to own a wholesale shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children. He will use the anticipated profits to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour and other items

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years old and married with six children. With four of her children in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, canned goods, snack foods, home care products and other groceries. She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, canned goods, snack foods, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Carolina Stefany

texts.es: Carolina de 18 años es madre soltera, ella reside en un humilde barrio de Malambo y en su afán de conseguir recursos para el sostenimiento de su hija de apenas un años de edad, contó con el apoyo de un amigo que le provee alimentos empacados: galletas, maní, leche en polvo, golosinas entre otros productos, para dar inicio a su vida como comerciante.  Todos los días está dispuesta a realizar ventas y su compromiso es inmenso, puesto que su único ingreso depende de su propio esfuerzo y dedicación.  Como su capital es muy escaso realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para mejorar sus inventarios y comprar más variedad de galletas, maní, leche y mercancías varias para proponerles a sus clientes. Esta inversión permitirá que trabaje con los recursos apropiados para cumplirle a su clientela y sus ingresos sean mucho mayores. A futuro desea mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hija.
texts.en:
18-year-old Carolina is a single mother. She lives in a poor area in Malambo. Carolina was trying to have the necessary resources to support her 1-year-old daughter and obtained the support of a friend who distributes packaged goods: cookies, peanuts, powdered milk, candy, etc., to start her life as a businesswoman. 

She is willing to make sales everyday and her commitment is immense, as her only income depends on her own effort and dedication. As her capital is scarce, she requested a loan from Kiva after joining the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, in order to increase her stock and buy a variety of cookies, peanuts, milk and other merchandise to offer to her clients. This investment will allow her to work with the appropriate resources to serve her customers and increase her income. In the future she wants to improve her quality of life and that of her daughter.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cookies, peanuts, milk and other merchandise to offer to her clients.

loans.name: Rafael Enrique

texts.es: Rafael de 55 años es padre de tres hijos y vive en compañía de su cónyuge en un barrio del municipio de Malambo, él laboró por años en una empresa privada sin embargo sus expectativas eran jubilarse pero por decisiones administrativas no fue posible, al quedar cesante y sin expectativas de empleo, recibió el consejo de una amiga quien le sugirió iniciar su propio negocio de café Internet.  Hoy en día cuenta con 6 años en su negocio con muy buenos resultados y un ingreso seguro, es por ello que desea mejorar las condiciones de su local y comprar un aire acondicionado el cual financiará a través de un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y lograr su proyecto. A futuro Rafael considera que su negocio será más visitado por los habitantes del sector y con ello sus utilidades mejoraran, así logrará mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Rafael, 55, is the father of 3 children, and he lives with his wife in a neighborhood of the municipality of Malambo.  For years, he worked for a private company and he expected to eventually retire from this company.  However, because of management decisions this was not possible, and he was left unemployed and without any prospects for employment.  

A friend advised him to start up his own internet cafe business.  Today, he has 6 years of experience with this business, and has had great results and a secure income.  This is why he wants to make some improvements to his business and buy an air conditioner, which he will finance through a Kiva loan.  This is an opportunity for him to establish a credit history with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo and implement his project.  In the future, Rafael thinks that his business will be the most popular in the neighborhood, and so his profits will increase and he will be able to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner for his business

loans.name: Charline

texts.fr:
Charline est une femme travailleuse et dynamique de 37 ans, elle vit en concubinage avec un collecteur et celui-ci quand il est en repos ou a du temps libre, l'appui dans l'exercice de son activité. Le couple a 3 enfants  dont tous scolarisés  (14-5-3 ans).  
Charline est dans la gargote  depuis 2005. Elle a un lieu de vente fixe qui n’est ouvert que le soir, car dans la matinée, elle se consacre à la préparation et la livraison de ses produits qui sont sur commande de ses clients. Elle a  suivi une formation sur la restauration  et projette de développer l’activité d’où cette demande de prêt, ses atouts sont ses expériences et la formation suivie. 
Elle a comme objectif le développement de l’activité  et la réussite de ses enfants dans leurs études.
texts.en:
Charline, age 37, is a hard-working and dynamic woman whose common-law partner is a collector. When he is not working and has free time, he helps her with her activity. The couple have 3 children ages 3, 5 and 14 who all go to school.

Charline has been running a food counter since 2005. Since she spends mornings preparing and delivering food orders, her counter is only open during the evening. She received restaurant training and plans to expand her activity, which is why she is seeking this loan. Her assets are her experience and her training.

In addition to the expansion of her activity, Charline's goal is support her children's success with their studies.

loans.use: to buy meat, poultry, cheese, vegetables, pasta, sausages, offal.

loans.name: Chepkwony Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 29 years old, single, and blessed with one child aged one year old. She has been into a clothes-selling business for three years and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000.

This being her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, she intends to buy clothing materials for sale to her customers.

She anticipates she will improve her business from the expanded business profits.

Her dream is to open a big boutique in town and settle down.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale to her customers.

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
She is a single mother who supports one person in her family.

She operates a grocery store, a business she has been doing for the last two years and generates a monthly income of KES 30,000.

She has requested her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more vegetables for resale.

She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 53 years old. She is married with three children. 

She has had a dairy farming business for 10 years. She will be using the loan to purchase an asset motorcycle for hire for her to earn more income.

She will use the anticipated profit to improve her housing structure and to repay her loan.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to have a successful business and to live a happy life.

loans.use: to purchase an asset motorcycle for hire.

loans.name: Siphira

texts.en: Siphira is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, juices, soap, flour and other items. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 51,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap, flour and other items

loans.name: Rono

texts.en:
Rono is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows maize and also keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 14 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be bad weather.

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to increase production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be ambitious.

Elizabeth operates a farm where she grows maize, beans and also keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 21 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor weather.

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy fertilizer and repair her maize storage area. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

She will use the anticipated profits to increase her farm area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and repair her maize storage area.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureene is a married woman with 2 children. She operates a retail business where she sells eggs. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

Maureene describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of eggs. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of eggs

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a Kiva borrower. She has five children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Alin

texts.en:
Alin started her business years ago with her own working capital. She had a lot of difficulties because she did not have enough working capital to buy the needed items according to what people requested. After a few years she got information about Tuba Rai Metin. She came to get informed and she was very interested.

Alin is requesting a loan of $ 1.000 to buy more needed items to keep in her store such as slippers, sardines, milk, eggs, candies, noodles, biscuits, aqua, detergents, soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

She has been busy with her business and she is happy to do that. Her husband is very helpful in doing business because he is also a businessman. She wants to make her kiosk bigger in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, sardines, milk, eggs, candies, noodles, biscuits, aqua, detergents, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en: Tomas is the father of one son. Tomas works as a driver and he needs a loan to replace the engine of his car. It is very important for him to do that because he is the only who supports his family  Tomas pays rent and he sends his son to the school  Tomas is not selling beer now because he is too busy with the transportation business so he hopes you will help him again.

loans.use: to replace the engine of his car

loans.name: Silvito Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Silvito  está integrando por 5 mujeres quienes día a día, trabajan fuertemente para sacar adelantes a sus familias, sintiéndose orgullosas de poder tener sus propios negocios y obtener ingresos económicos para prosperar en la vida. El grupo lo coordina Kirlian de 28 años, acompañada y madre de dos hijos de 6 y 2 años, ella se dedica a la venta de protectores para celulares desde hace nueve años y solicita por primer ciclo el financiamiento en la institución para la compra de protectores y accesorios para celulares.  La segunda socia es Freyzis de 36 años quien es propietaria de una pulpería, la tercer socia es Ana de 26 años propietaria de una pulpería, la cuarta socia es Yadira de 54 años, propietaria de una librería, la quinta socia es Flor de 51 años quien vede ropa nueva.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Silvito is made up of five women who work hard day by day to get their families ahead, feeling proud to be able to have their own businesses and to have economic income to have a prosperous life.

The group is coordinated by Kirlian who is 28 years old. She is married and mother of two children who are 6 and 2. She has worked selling cellphone cases for 9 years. She is requesting a loan for the first time to buy cellphone cases and accessories.

The second member is Freyzix, 36 years old, owner of a general store; the third members is Ana, 26 years old, owner of a general store; the fourth member is Yadira, 54 years old, owner of a book store; the fifth member is Flor, 51 years old, who sells new clothing.

loans.use: to buy cases and accessories for cellphones.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 63 years old, married, and blessed with seven adult children.

Her business is selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in the business for 10 years and earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand Kenyan shillings.

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy more stock of cabbages, kale, tomatoes, onions, avocados, and other fruits and vegetables to sell. She will use the profits from her expanded business to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more cabbages, kale, tomatoes, onions, avocados, and other fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself to be focused.

Pamela operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is 29 years old, single and blessed with two children aged 4 and 6 years old.

She has been into planting and selling vegetables for two years and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to buy fertilizers and seeds for planting. She anticipates paying back the loan and saving from the expanded business profits.

Her dream is to expand her vegetable farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for planting

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 37-year-old lady from Kisumu who has a grocery store business. She is a single mother of one and has run her business for the last two years. She generates a monthly income of KES 30,000.

Betty requested a second loan from VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase more vegetables for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to reinvest in her business. Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 34-year-old father of four children agese 12, 7, 5, and 5, all attending school. He is a cattle-keeper and a milk trader. He has worked six days a week and 10 hours day since 1995. He is also a boda boda cyclist, from which he generates an extra income.

He hopes to use the loan to purchase more cows for his business and boost his milk business. He usually supplies his goods to fellow farmers and local people in his community and the surrounding areas. He, however, faces the challenge of too much drought, which affects his cows, leading to low milk yields. He is described as an honest and hardworking man in business.

He requests banks to train them properly on how to use the money and the implications of not paying on time, which he thinks will help them grow.

loans.use: to purchase more cows and boost his milk business

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a married man. He has seven children. He operates a quarry where he mines building stones to sell. He has been involved in this business for 11 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transportation.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use.

He hopes that in the future, he will improve the living standards of his family. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use.

loans.name: Los Fieles Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Los Fieles está conformado por dos mujeres laboriosas y un microempresario exitoso quienes solicitan por sexta vez el financiamiento en Kiva, el grupo es coordinado por María una mujer luchadora de 51 años de edad, soltera y madre de dos hijos de 1 y 4 años quienes son su mayor motivación, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace 16 años, una de sus metas es prosperar el negocio por lo que solicita el crédito para la compra de camisas, pantalones, chores y faldas. Uno de sus logros con el crédito anterior fue aumentar sus ventas y comprar un televisor. La segunda socia es Elisabeth de 24 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa y el tercer socio es Samuel de 56 años de edad quien tiene un taller de mecánica.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Los Fieles (The Faithful) is made up of two hardworking women and a successful micro businessman, who are requesting a loan from Kiva for the sixth time. The group is coordinated by María, a hardworking, 51 year old woman. She is a single mother of two children of 1 and 4 years old who are her highest motivation.

She has worked selling clothing and shoes for 16 years. One of her goals is to grow the business which is why she is requesting the loan to buy shirts, pants, and skirts. One of her successes with the last loan was increasing her sales and buying a television set.

The second member is 24 year old Elisabeth. She works selling clothing. The third member is 56 year old Samuel who has a mechanic workshop.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, and skirts.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 56 years old and sells animals. As a business, he has been doing very well.

He is requesting his first loan with Visionfund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase more animals for resale. He will use the anticipated income to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his working capital

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 31 years old. She has been in the motorcycle business for the last two years and is doing well. She has employed one youth who rides her motorcycle. She is a mother of two; her spouse provides additional income.

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the money requested to purchase motorcycle spare parts and repair her motorcycle.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to expand her grocery shop.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to own a big retail shop and have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a 47-year-old shopkeeper at Siaya, Kenya. She is a mother of 4 whose spouse provides additional income.

For the last two years she has been selling cereals and it has been going well.This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase additional sacks of dried maize, dried beans, and cereals to resell.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to repay her loan. 

She hopes to own a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of dried maize, dried beans, and cereals to resell

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus is 45 years old and sells snacks in Voi, Kenya. He is a father of four and has been successfully running his business for the last six years.

This is his third loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the money to purchase soft drinks and snacks for resale and will repay the loan with his anticipated profits.

He hopes to own a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and snacks for resale

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a single man and describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells plastics for recycling. He has been involved in this business for three years and his primary customers are locals.

Anthony says his biggest business challenge is a lack of adequate working capital. He will use his KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of plastics to sell. His business goal is to own a big factory for processing plastics within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional materials to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock of plastics to sell.

loans.name: Philis

texts.en:
Philis is a single mother of three children. She operates a retail business where she sells sand, ballast, and stones. She has been involved in this business for 12 years and her primary customers are locals.

Philis describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of adequate working capital. She will use her KES 110,000 loan to buy more sand, ballast, and building stones to enable her meet customer demand. She hopes that in the future she will prosper.

loans.use: to buy more sand, ballast, and building stones to sell.

loans.name: Geovana

texts.en: Geovana is 30 years old. She is the mother of one son. She is a single mother and she operates a little restaurant that she owns. She also sells beer. Geovana supports her parents. She needs a loan to buy more ingredients to make Bolivian dishes. Geovana would like to have a bigger restaurant in the future and her own house because she is living with her parents. She also has to send her boy to school. She hopes you can help her. In the picture Geovana is with her son at her parents house.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make Bolivian dishes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 55 years old.  She is an accountant.  She needs a loan to fix her room because rain damaged the walls.  Maria pays rent and she has a son that goes to college.  Maria also is using glasses because her sight is damaged.  Maria's son is going to college so she has to pay college too.  Maria is working hard and hopes for help again.  In the picture, she is at work

loans.use: to fix her room

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en:
Philemon is 53 years old married to Milka and blessed with two children aged  14 and 6 years old.

He has been into dairy farming business for eight years and earns a monthly income of Kshs.35,000.

This being his first loan with VisionFund Kenya,he intends to buy more dairy feeds,pesticides and deworming medicines for the cows.hopes this will improve productivity of milk.

With the anticipated profits, he will be able to buy food for his family as well as pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: to buy more dairy feeds,pesticides and deworming medicines

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 45 years old. He is married and blessed with 5 children. His business is farming and livestock trade. He has been in the business for 10 years.

He earns a monthly income of Kes. 8,000 shillings. This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy cows and goats for selling.

He will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for his children.

His hopes and dreams are to grow his business bigger and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy cows and goats for selling

loans.name: Anorbiby

texts.en:
Anorbiby was born in 1966 year in Tajikistan. She is very kind and smart woman and is married with 3 children. Her husband is a master of repairing cars. Anorbiby 18 years ago began her own business because she needed the money.

Anorbiby has been buying and selling women clothes for 18 years. She sells a variety of clothes and she tries to offer high quality clothes for local women. Anorbiby is going to buy new items for the new season. She is asking for a loan of 10000 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Hernán

texts.es: Hernán, tiene la edad  de 73  años, está casado,  vive con su esposa, la cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de alimento para cerdos de buena calidad y que tengan buenas características para que los lechones  puedan transformar este alimento en desarrollo y kilos de peso en el tiempo menos posible y otros productos para darle en el periodo de desarrollo y engorde, además pagar mano de obra para la manutención de los animales, y de esta manera asegurarse de darles una buena asistencia. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones  que cuenta la zona para esta actividad, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de cerdos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para sus cerdos y así que  tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que un engorde  adecuado, y tener a corto plazo animales con el peso ideal para la venta. Con el ingreso de la actividad que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en su negocio. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. ÉL no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Hernán is 73 years old, married, and lives with his wife, who is his highest priority. With his loan he plans to buy good quality food, for his pigs, with good properties, so that the pigs can transform the food into development and kilos of weight in the shortest time possible; and other products to give them in the period of development and fattening. He also plans to pay for labor for the support of the animals, in order to ensure that they have good support. What he plans is to take advantage of the good conditions in the area for that activity, and also to put into practice the experience he has gained in several years caring for pigs.

He will be able to buy better products of higher quality for his pigs, so that they have good development and health, in addition to adequate fattening, and in the short term will have animals with an ideal weight to sell. He hopes to use the income he obtains from this job for the wellbeing of his family, to meet some family goals, and to continue investing in his business.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had previous loans in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to care for his pigs.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a bakery where he makes cookies. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are retail shops. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price changes. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for making cookies. He hopes that in the future, he will expand the business and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for making cookies

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as honest. He operates a farm where he keeps cows and also grows crops. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Ny's Group

texts.en: Ny’s group live in a rural village in Kompot province in Cambodia.  Ny makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo es estudiante de la carrera de Ingeniería Eléctrica, su meta personal es de recibirse para ayudar a su familia, y quiere poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
Él está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder recibirse y poder ser un buen profesional útil a la sociedad. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Gustavo is a student whose major is Electrical Engineering. His personal goal is to graduate so that he can help his family, and he wants to be able to give them a better quality of life. He is giving his best effort to be able to graduate, and to be able to be a good professional who is useful to society. He is requesting this loan to be able to pay his tuition so that he can continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay his college tuition.

loans.name: Teodoro Uvaldo

texts.es:
El señor Teodoro tiene 40 años de edad, vive con su esposa tiene 2 hijos que dependen de él, vive en una comunidad de Trojes, al Oriente de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace seis años al negocio de venta de productos de la canasta básica.

Don Teodoro es un hombre con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de de arroz, azúcar, manteca, jabón, harina, espagueti, salsa, papel higiénico, pan, escobas, sardinas, etc. desea surtir mas su negocio y además con el apoyo del crédito pretende ampliar mas su negocio y así obtener más ganancias.

Uno de sus sueños es ampliar más su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida junto a su familia.

Trojes, Honduras - Noviembre 2015
texts.en:
Teodoro is 40 years old. He lives with his wife and has two children who depend on him. He lives in a community of Trojes, in eastern Honduras. He has his own home and has a made a living for the last six years by selling staple goods.

Teodoro is a man who wants to get ahead. He is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, butter, soap, flour, spaghetti, sauce, bread, sardines, toilet paper, brooms, etc. He wants to stock his business more and with the support of the loan, he aims to expand his business and earn more profits.

One of his dreams is to expand his business and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Trojes, Honduras - November 2015.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, butter, soap, flour, spaghetti, sauce, bread, sardines, toilet paper, brooms, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 32 years and married to James. Together they have been blessed with two children, both younger than eight years old. James helps provide additional income for his family.

Caroline operates a retail shop where she sells cereal and soft drinks to her customers. She has been in business for the past 14 years.

Caroline has requested a loan of KES. 35,000 to buy bags of maize and crates of soda for resale. This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya after successfully repaying her previous one.

She desires to be financially self-reliant and to educate her children for life.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and crates of soda to sell.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is a single woman. She has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells fruit. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fruit.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits

loans.name: Norita

texts.en:
Norita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Norita is 46 years old and has one child who is in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Norita requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional bundle of fishing net, bamboo, etc for her business.

Norita has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Norita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bundle of fishing net, bamboo, etc for her business

loans.name: Rwencwera Bakyara Tukwatanize Group

texts.en:
Kevina is a forty one year hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She is a very good entrepreneur who operates a retail shop alongside crop growing and animal rearing. She got her start up capital from her small savings and opened up the retail shop because it was the easiest business she could manage. She has responsibilities of paying school fees for her children and looking after her family. Her dream of expanding her shop to a wholesale store still stands amidst challenges of inadequate capital and high prices of goods.

She needs a loan to buy more sugar, soap and other items to sell. Kevina is a member of Rwencwera Bakyara Tukwatanize Group where members guarantee each other to get a loan since they do not offer securities.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap and other items to sell.

loans.name: Kigunga Twetungure Women's Group

texts.en:
Viola is a thirty five year old hardworking married woman, a member of Kigunga Twetungure Women's group. She lives in Kamwenge with her two children who all attend school. She runs a bar and from the proceeds, she has been able to provide for her family. Apart from the bar, she also does crop farming and rearing of pigs to earn an additional income.
Her good dream of expanding her business into a big bar is limited by the stiff competition from other prominent bars. So she believes if she can stock enough spirits and beer, she will cope up with the competition.
Viola needs a loan to buy more beers and spirits to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more beers and spirits to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married mother of one  child who is young to  attend school. She rents a house that  has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is rent .
For over one year, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Imaculada

texts.en:
Imaculada is requesting a loan of $ 1.500.00 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as sauces, sardines, biscuits, coffee, candies, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

Imaculada opened her kiosk a few years ago, with her own working capital. She is happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. And she will improving her management with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: to buy sauces, sardines, biscuits, coffee, candies, including soft drinks and hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu  is a married woman; she has four children, all of whom attend school. Saumu  rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Saumu  has operated a firewood  selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Laurend

texts.en:
Laurend hasn't been feeling well lately and he wants to go to a health specialist and this is where this loan will go to. " I have been working hard and non-stopping for very long time and at the same time I have been feeling unwell. I have no clue what causes my health deterioration. I want to believe that it is due to my exhaustion, but it cannot be possible.I have been losing weight rapidly in addition to having some other symptoms, " said Laurend in the interview.


He is 39 and a married father of two, 12 and 9 years old. Laurend has been doing agriculture for the past ten years and also about two years ago he started another activity, collecting damaged and salvage cars and selling their useful parts or repairing some of them. From this activity he has been earning roughly $2500/year. In the five dynym agricultural land that he owns, he mostly plant onions and potatoes and from selling onions he makes approximately $2100/year and from potatoes $1900/year.

loans.use: to pay for a medical visit to a health specialist

loans.name: Jasmina

texts.en:
Jasmina is the mother of 2 boys, living in a minority community. She has been involved in agriculture based on her family tradition, planting wheat for selling and for her family's consumption. She also plants various vegetables that her son is able to sell in the market. While her husband works as a doctor, he has a low salary and she uses the profit from her land to supplement their income.

At this time she is in need of a loan in order to purchase wheat, artificial guano and to pay for others to work on her land. She knows that the investment will help her to be able turn a larger profit and that she will then be able to use that money to ensure a better education for her children. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support

loans.use: to purchase wheat, artificial guano and to pay for others to work on her land  to be able turn a larger profit

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is the age of 38, living with her two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband has been running a mobile shop for many years and generating income for his family. He troubleshoots the mobiles; he sells the mobile accessories such as charger, body, data cable etc and provides the recharge facilities of different networks.

Nowadays, a lot of demand increases of accessories and for recharge, sometimes he has to refuse his customers. But he does not have savings to further invest into business because he has spent his all income over household expenses.
Therefore, Tahira requested a loan for her husband so he can be empower to buy additional accessories and extra credit for recharge facility.
Tahira thanks to Kiva and field partner, over this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy accessories and extra credit for recharge facility for her husband's mobile shop

loans.name: Dancille

texts.en:
Dancille is a married 35-year-old woman with three children who are between 6 and 16 years old. Dancille works hard to support her family and provide them with a better life.

For the past 15 years, Dancille has sold items in a small shop. Every morning she opens her shop at 8 am and works tirelessly until her daily supply is sold. Sometimes she is required to venture outside of her shop to sell her items door to door.

She is requesting a loan from Kiva, via Vision Finance Company, to expand her business by purchasing additional inventory. With her profits, she will be able to get medical insurance for her family and will use the remaining profit to expand her current business by purchasing various goods such as beans, rice, sugar, and soap to sell.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional inventory for her resale business.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are ladies. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. He hopes that in the future, he will expand the business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Adrin

texts.en:
Adrin is 53 years old and a taxi owner in Mombasa, Kenya. She is a mother of two whose spouse provides additional income. She has been in this business for the last 15 years and is doing well.

This is her second borrowing from VisionFund to finance her business.

She will use the loan to service her taxi and the anticipated profit to repay her loan.

She hopes to own a fleet of taxis in future.

loans.use: to service her taxi.

loans.name: Arlaine

texts.en:
Challenges in business like unhealthy competition and insufficient capital do not exempt any entrepreneur; like Arlaine, a loyal partner of CCT since 2013, who has always been dedicated to growing her 'gowns for rent' business year after year. She may have experienced ups and downs while operating her store, but discouragement could never hold her back in pursuing her life goals.

She has been running her business for 10 fruitful years already, and by carefully meeting the demand of customers, Arlaine was able to gain more patrons and significantly increased her profit. As of today, her net earnings add up to almost PHP 20,000 per month, and she expects to further increase them in the next few years.

She needs additional capital to buy more stocks of new gowns for rent. A loan amounting to PHP 50,000 will suffice for this, and she is thanking you in advance for whatever amount you will lend her.

Arlaine still regularly meets with her co-fellowship members every week where she get inspiration and wisdom of God’s undeserved grace and love. CCT’s approach is wholistic and transformative, giving emphasis to the importance of the integral work of God in the communities they serve.

loans.use: to expand her inventory of gowns for rent.

loans.name: Twekambe Kyarwakya Group

texts.en: Demitiria aged 28 is a resident of Kagadi-Uganda who owns a restaurant a business she started in 2012 using savings from farming. Demitiria is single mother of 3 children who is so hardworking having started her business in order to earn a living.  However she is faced with a problem of little working capital forcing her to request for a Kiva loan through Hofokam to buy sauce pans and tables for her restaurant. In future she plans to start up a retail shop and educate her children. She is a member of Twekambe Kyarwakya group where members have to guarantee one another in order to access a loan as they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy new saucepans and tables for her restaurant.

loans.name: Sitti Hawa

texts.en:
Sitti Hawa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell fruits business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of fruits to sell for her buy and sell fruits business.

Sitti Hawa has been in this business for 16 years. Sitti Hawa earns more income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fruits to sell

loans.name: Yae Kyaw (Boe) Village Group

texts.en:
Yae Kyaw (Boe) group members were helped to purchase high quality feeds and ducks. From previous loan, some customers could expand their duck raising business and whereas, the remaining could cover their living cost. 
According from the success, five more borrowers will join the group that totals 23 borrowers. To have regulations at their duck raising business, the group intends to purchase more ducks and feeds from this recycling loan.

loans.use: to purchase ducks and high quality feeds, which will support 23 borrowers

loans.name: Mikocheni Group

texts.en:
Alen who is in his early 40's is single with two grown up children. He has been running two projects, selling chips and a gengeduke for three years now. He works from 6am to mid-night daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used he previous loan to increase his business stock and has managed to pay back his loan successfully. He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of the group which is now doing great with their loan. He used the profit to take care of his family, to repay loan and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to increase on Irish potatoes, cooking oil to increase on gengeduke stock. He dreams of building his own house.

Alen will share this loan with his loan group Mikocheni which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase socks of Irish potatoes and cooking oil to expand his gengeduke stock.

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.en:
Iskandar is young and smart man. He was born in 1993 year. Iskandar is single and he lives with parents and he is a student of the 4th course. He studies at the National University of Tajikistan for a degree in Economics.

Iskandar reads a lot of books and he is one of the best students. He dreams to be a good specialist in future and to be of service for the well-being of society. He is asking for a loan of 9000 Somoni to pay for the university tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition for a degree in Economics

loans.name: Justiner

texts.en:
Justiner is 57 years old. She is married and blessed with six children.

Her business is dress making, selling used clothes and farming. She has been in these businesses for 11 years. She earns a monthly income of 8,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy a water tank.

She will use the profits to reinvest in her business.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business and improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es: Don Jose Francisco es un agricultor que tiene amplia experiencia en cultivo de diversas hortalizas. Con el propósito de continuar en este negocio, solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000), para la compra de insumos agrícolas necesarios para el crecimiento y desarrollo de los cultivos. De esta forma logrará mantener y aumentar los ingresos provenientes de dicha actividad.
texts.en:
Don Jose Francisco is a farmer who has a vast experience in the cultivation of various vegetables.

For the purpose of continuing this business, he is requesting a loan of one million Colones (₡ 1 000 000), to buy the necessary agricultural inputs for the growth and development of the crops.
In this way he will manage to maintain and increase the earnings from the mentioned activity.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for the cultivation of vegetables.

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nga is 41 years old and she is married

She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.
Nga lives in Yen Dinh district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
The main hardship that Nga faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

In 2014, Nga joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Nga has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Nga hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine is a married woman. She has seven children. She operates a retail business where she sells livestock. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be drought.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more goats. Her business goal is to have more livestock within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional livestock.

loans.use: to buy more goats

loans.name: Kisuura Tweyombeke Group

texts.en:
Harriet is a 30 year old mother of 6 children living in Kagadi Uganda. She owns a retail shop selling general merchandise. She also does farming for additional income. She started this business in 2007 with an aim of making money to be used to look after her family’s increasing demands. She wishes to achieve her greatest desire of educating her children to university. She is challenged by price fluctuations and high rental fees.

She will use the loan facility to buy stock of sugar, soap and general merchandise for selling. She is a member of Kisuura Tweyombeke Group where members guarantee each other to get loans as they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, soap and general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Zinat

texts.ru: Зинат успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав средства по назначению. Она очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день у нее в обороте есть товар на сумму 10,000 сом (KGS). Также имеется 6 овец, а на 1,0 Га земли Зинат выращивает рис для продажи. Зинат повторно обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS) на покупку товара в магазин с целью увеличения ассортимента. Доходы от кредита позволят Зинат развить бизнес и накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Zinat successfully repaid her loan, using the funds for their designated purpose. She is very thankful to Kiva and to everyone who helped with her financing.

Today, Zinat has goods in stock worth 10,000 som (KGS). She also has 6 sheep, and grows rice for resale on 1.0 hectares of land.

Zinat has once again applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 35,000 som (KGS) to buy goods for her store, with the goal of increasing the variety of goods available. The income from the loan will allow her to develop her business and save money to repair her home.

loans.use: to buy products for sale in order to provide better variety for her customers.

loans.name: Kastriot

texts.en:
Kastriot is 27 years old and is been pictured with his wife, Rasme and his three children out of four whose ages range from 1 to 9 year old. Since he was 17 years old, he started buying/selling thrifty items, just like majority of members in his ethnic community of Roma Albanians. In this activity he uses his father's car that it recently broke down. He now wants to repair this car and buy stocks of inventory items to resell and this is why he needs your financial help.


"Buying and selling is something that our community enjoys doing it; some of us buy & sell new items whereas some others like myself buy and & resell used items. We buy them in large quantities by kilos, in the neighbor countries and sell them around here. At times we have our own booths and some other times we have a vehicle and drive around regions and villages calling out from a loud speaker," said Kastriot trying to explain the activity process to the branch assistant.

loans.use: to stock up on used clothes to resell and also repair the vehicle that he uses for transporting of items

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful businesswoman .

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread and other items

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. Her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy gutters to harvest rain water and a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy gutters to harvest rain water and a water tank

loans.name: Liza

texts.es:
Liza es de la ciudad de Pilar, tiene dos hijos, está trabajando en su carrera, la cual es de derecho, ella ya es abogada recibida, y comenta que es consciente que la capacitación debe ser constante para ir creciendo cada día, y mejorar así el nivel de vida de uno mismo y los que los rodean.
Ella está siguiendo un postgrado judicial, de manera a poder seguir creciendo en conocimiento y mejorar de esa manera.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su postgrado, y así poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Liza is from the city of Pilar, and she has two children. She is working on a degree, with is her right. She has already graduated as a lawyer, and she says that she knows that the training should be ongoing to continue growing everyday and to improve her life and that of those around her.

She is continuing with a legal post-graduate education. In this way, she will be able to continue growing in her knowledge and improve in this way.

She asks for this loan to invest in post-graduate tuition, so that she can continue studying.

loans.use: to pay post-graduate tuition.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a farm where she grows maize, beans, carrots and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a married man. He operates a farm where he keeps poultry. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are locals. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more poultry. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more poultry.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a Kiva borrower. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. His primary customers are locals. He describes high prices as his biggest business challenge. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will have a good business that will support his family. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza thanks you for your generosity because her previous loan helped her establish her business. That loan enabled her to purchase additional grocery products to increase her product inventory. Her business profits were used to provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

Liza is very positive that she can further improve her business with another 30,000 PHP loan. This new loan will be used to purchase additional stock, including groceries, toiletries, and beverages. By offering more items for sale, her customers will likely buy more products. An increase in sales will result in a significant increase in profit, which will make her business more viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, this will allow Liza to sustain her family's needs.

Liza dreams that her children will attain quality education in the best universities. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургул, 45 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей школьников, супруг и дети помогают по хозяйству. У Нургул среднее образование, она работает в больнице медицинской сестрой. Также вместе с супругом занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду, Нургул на сегодняшний день имеет 6 коров. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нургул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для разведения и увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, также хочет приобрести мебель для дома.
texts.en:
Nurgul is 45 years old, married, and the mother of 2 school-aged children. Her husband and children help her around the farm. Nurgul has a secondary-level education, and she works as a nurse in a hospital. In addition, she and her husband raise animals, which they began doing 5 years ago. Thanks to her very hard work, Nurgul now has 6 cows. Her monthly income is around 11,000 som (KGS).

In order to continue developing her business, Nurgul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock for breeding, and to increase the size of her herd. Nurgul plans to use the income from the loan to continue developing her business, and also wants to purchase furniture for her house.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Sairakul

texts.ru: Сайракул, 51 год, замужем, воспитывает троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У нее - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 25 лет назад с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Сайракул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 8 коров. Ежемесячный доход составляет 23,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сайракул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Сайракул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и постройку продуктового магазина возле дома.
texts.en:
Sairakul is 51 years old, married, and is raising three children while also running her own farm. She has a secondary-level education, and as the primary source of income for her family, she raises animals, which she began doing 25 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Sairakul's very hard work, her farm now has 8 cows. Her monthly profit is around 23,000 som (KGS).

In order to continue developing her farm, Sairakul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy some steers for fattening and resale. Sairakul plans to use the income from her loan to continue increasing her quantity of domesticated livestock, and to construct a grocery store near her house.

loans.use: to purchase some steers to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Blanca Fanny

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer que tiene 63 años. Es viuda, no tiene hijo, gracias a sus padres aprendió a ser una persona emprendedora y es así que empezó a realizar su propio negocio de venta de comidas, lo viene realizando desde años atrás en su domicilio ofreciendo comida típica que en la zona no es fácil de encontrar y la atención que ella brinda a sus clientes es lo que más les gusta por la zona.
Ella quedo viuda años atrás, pero eso no era un obstáculo,  aun así logro seguir adelante con su vida por que tenia hijas que mantener y a las que debía demostrar la lucha que día en día se hace para lograr lo que se quiere en esta vida.
Actualmente tiene su local en su domicilio donde ofrece colada morada, tilapias y otros alimentos mas, el sector donde ella vive se llama Natabuela sector don la gente se dedica a la agricultura de frejol, tomate, por la zona también ofrecen platos típicos como las exquisitas fritadas y también la gente viene por esta zona por el turismo que brinda Atuntaqui donde hay producción de prendas de vestir, se puede visitar la fabrica antigua de Imbabura y otro lugares más que se encuentra en la ciudad de Antonio Ante.
Con el crédito que solicita en Fundación Alternativa va realizar compras necesarias para el local, seguir remodelando para una buena atención a todas las personas que visitan su local.
Agradece a KIVA por el apoyo que le brindan en todo los proyectos que necesita cada cliente de la zona.
texts.en:
Blanca is a 63-year-old woman. She is a widow. Thanks to her parents, she learned to be an enterprising person, and it is because of this that she started her own business selling food. What she learned years ago in her home offering traditional food is that in the area it is not easy to find, and the service she offers her clients is the most liked in the area.

She became a widow years ago, but it was not an obstacle. Even with this, she succeeded in going forward with her life because she had daughters to take care of. She had to show them to fight day after day to succeed in what they want in life.

At present, she has a location in her home where she offers "colada morada" (a traditional beverage), tilapia, and other food. She area where lives lives is the Natabuela sector, where people are dedicated to agriculture--growing beans and tomatoes. The area also offers traditional dishes, such as exquisite fried foods. People also come to the area for the tourism Atuntaqui offers, where garments are produced. One can visit an old factory in Imbabura and other places that are found in the city of Antonio Ante.

With the loan that she requests from Fundación Alternativa, she is going to buy necessary items for her restaurant, and she is going to continue remodeling for good service to everyone that visits her location.

She is thankful to Kiva for the support that they offer in all the projects for her client in the area.

loans.use: to buy items for her restaurant, including chairs and new tables, so that she provide good service to her clients and promote loyalty.

loans.name: Shilpaben And Group

texts.en:
Shilpaben is a young entrepreneur of 24 years of age. She hails from the Dahod district of Gujarat. She is a mother of three children – one son and two daughters. Shilpaben runs a sewing business and makes a monthly income of Rs. 5,000 from it. She now wants to expand her business by purchasing a new sewing machine. For that, she seeks a loan. She expects her monthly income to increase by Rs. 3000. With the increase in her income, she will be able to ensure a more comfortable lifestyle for her household of six.

Shilpaben is the leader of a group of four women. Each woman seeks a loan to expand her respective business. They all hail from similar backgrounds and want to expand their respective businesses to contribute more to their family income. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to expand her sewing business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria has been living with a man for over 15 years and the couple has five children, all of whom are going to school. Maria is the owner of the family house. The house is made of adobe so the material is not as strong as it should be  Maria needs a loan to buy a milking cow.  Maria is in the dairy business. She hopes you can help her because she has great plans for her family.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Pio

texts.en:
Pio is 35 years old and lives with his parents. He supports them.  Pio is a farmer and he goes to many markets to distribute his products. Pio has been trained by his father so he knows what to do.
