Pio also raises cattle and sells the animals at many fairs. Pio needs a loan to buy more breeding cows for his business. He hopes you can help him. Pio has a lot of the money to buy the animal, but he needs a little help.

loans.use: to buy more breeding cows.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en: Claudia is a 22-year-old woman. She is single but she is the mother of two daughters. She is living at her parents house. Claudia is a farmer who raises and sells cattle. She goes to many local fairs to sell bulls mostly. Claudia needs a loan to buy more cattle that she will feed and resell. She hopes you can trust her. She is healthy and she has been learning about this business since she was a child.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Justiniano

texts.es:
Justiniano está cursando la carrera de Contabilidad, en el tercer año, en el futuro se ve siendo un profesional y que pueda tener su estudio contable para ayudar a su familia y también para poder abrirse camino.
Es una persona que pone todo de sí para poder cumplir con sus anhelos, y lucha por poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Justiniano is pursuing an accounting degree; he is in his third year. In the future, he plans to become a professional and will be able to have his accounting studies help his family and also open a path for him.

He is a person that puts all of himself to be able to achieve his dreams, and he fights to be someone in his life.

He asks for this loan to be able to pay tuition for his degree. In this way, he will be able to continue with his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his degree.

loans.name: Elsa Diner

texts.es:
La señora  Elsa de 39 años de edad es madre soltera se dedica a la venta de alfarería como ser adornos de forma de  gallos cantaros, Jarros,  etc. tiene una hija que depende de ella y  vive en casa propia que está ubicada en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras.
Doña Elsa se dedica desde hace 19 años a su negocio y también se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y  sus clientes  son turistas que pasan por la zona y comerciantes que les compran sus adornos de barro.
Doña Elsa su préstamo desea invertirlo en compra de blusas, vestidos, pantalones, faldas, etc. para invertir en un nuevo negocio para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y aumentar sus ventas y gracias a esta inversión poder mejora de su calidad de vida.
Su sueño es  mejorar más  su vivienda.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Noviembre del 2015.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elsa is 39 years old and is a single mother. She is dedicated to selling pottery for decoration, such as pitchers shaped like roosters, jars, etc. She has a daughter who depends on her, and she lives in her own house, which is located in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.

Elsa has been dedicated to this business for 19 years, and she also sells new clothing. Her clients are tourists who pass through the area and merchants who buy her clay decorations.

Her loan will be invested in buying blouses, dresses, pants, skirts, etc. to invest in a new business to improve her quality of life and increase her sales. Thanks to this investment, she will be able to improve her quality of life.

Her dream is to improve her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – November 2015.

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, pants, skirts, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Yadira inició con su negocio, en el cual produce plantas ornamentales, las cuales posteriormente son vendidas a los vecinos de la zona. Con un préstamo de quinientos dólares ($500),comprará materiales, entre estos, plástico y madera para mejorar las condiciones de su vivero y de esta forma incrementar los ingresos provenientes de esta actividad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yadira started her business in which she procuces ornamental plants that are being sold to locals of the area afterwards.

With a loan of fivehundred dollars ($500) she will buy materials, among which plastics and wood, to improve the state of her nursery and in that way to increase the earnings from this activity.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve the nursery.

loans.name: Kelly Yojana

texts.es: Kelly de 32 años vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos de 3 y 6 años en un humilde barrio del municipio de Malambo, ella es una creativa mujer que desde su juventud le encantaba realizar decoraciones y hacer manualidades, así que decidió tomar un curso de arte en material foamy para profesionalizar su hobby y poder generar recursos para su familia.  Ella elabora figuras, muñecos, portarretratos y recordatorios con un mix de materiales entre ellos papel cartón, pegamento, pinturas y foamy de distintos colores.  En la actualidad realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar materiales: pinturas de distintos tonos, papel cartón, foamy, pegamento y accesorios para entregar un pedido de recordatorios que le solicitaron.  Esta inversión le permitirá cumplir con sus compromisos y mejorar la imagen de su negocio.  A  futuro proyecta una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Kelly is 32 years old. She lives with her spouse and their two children, ages 3 and 6, in a humble neighborhood in the city of Malambo. She is a creative woman who has loved making decorations and crafts since she was a child. As such, she decided to take an art course in craft foam materials to make her hobby professional and generate income for her family.

She makes figurines, dolls, picture frames, and keepsakes with a mix of materials, including cardboard, glue, paint, and craft foam of different colors. She is currently seeking a Kiva loan, which is an opportunity to become involved in financial life through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. This loan would be used to buy materials, including paints of different colors, cardboard, craft foam, glue, and accessories to deliver a requested order of keepsakes. This investment will allow her to meet her commitments and improve the image of her business. In the future, she projects a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials, including paints of different shades, cardboard, craft foam, glue, and accessories.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows potatoes, bananas, and kale. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes inadequate working capital as her biggest business challenge. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Pappathi And Group

texts.en:
32-year-old Pappathi from Karur, in rural Tamil Nadu has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Pappathi's family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse. 

Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for Pappathi and her family. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. Joining hands with 5 others whose families all face similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Pappathi has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue. So, together, they seek a loan of Rs. 70000 to build a toilet at home. Your loan will help these 5 hardworking rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently, safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: to construct a toilet in her home

loans.name: Leela And Group

texts.en:
Leela lives with her family of five in a rural part of the Karur district in Tamil Nadu. She and her family do not have access to a toilet. They have to trek long distances at dawn to use the fields to relieve themselves. Her family members, especially daughters and other women, are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and insect or animal bites.

Leela has formed a self-help group with her friends. All 5 group members work hard to support their families, and save diligently. However, their finances are not adequate for them to access basic necessities like toilets in their homes. Taking matters into their own hands, Leela and her group want to build toilets for themselves in their own homes. They seek a loan of INR 70,000 to cover the cost of raw materials and labor for constructing these toilets. As they begin to enjoy the benefits of basic sanitation and their families improve in health, they will be able to save on medical expenses, and they will repay the loan amount on time. Your loan will provide all 5 families access to improved hygiene and a better way of life.

loans.use: To improve sanitation facilities by constructing a toilet in her home

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells auto spare parts. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more stock of auto spare parts. He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of auto spares

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 20 years old and she is single. She doesn't have children, but she lives with her parents and supports them. Isabel is a farmer and she sells flowers. She goes to many markets, fairs and stores. 

Isabel needs a loan to buy cattle for her farm. She has the experience; she learned with her mother when she was a child. She hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia está estudiando para poder ser una peluquera profesional, comenta que por medio de sus estudios quiere poder montar su propio negocio, y a través de él poder ayudar a su familia. Ella es una persona muy sacrificada que con esfuerzo está saliendo adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de sus estudios, de manera a poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Leticia is studying to become a professional hairdresser. She says that through her studies she wants to be able to set up her own business, and through this to be able to help her family. She is a very selfless person who with this effort is getting ahead.

She is requesting a loan to pay her school fees, in order to cover this expense. She is grateful for this opportunity to continue to grow.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es:
Zaida continua con sus estudios en psicología clínica, comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior ha podido cubrir parte de sus gastos de universidad, lo que le permitió poder seguir con sus estudios. Ella es una persona muy dedicada que gracias a su dedicación le va muy bien en sus estudios.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y cubrir también los gastos de transporte que tiene. Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo de estudiar.
texts.en:
Zaida is still studying Clinical Psychology. She says her previous loan allowed her to cover part of her college expenses so that she could continue taking classes. She is a very dedicated person, and her dedication is paying off in school.

She is requesting this new loan in order to pay her higher education costs as well as cover her transportation expenses. She is grateful for this new opportunity.

loans.use: to pay for college fees and cover transportation expenses.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a married woman with 2 children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, beauty products and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are locals. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, beauty products and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, beauty products and other items.

loans.name: Bertha Maria

texts.es: Doña Bertha es una mujer que ha logrado salir adelante gracias a su esfuerzo y a la ayuda de los préstamos ofrecidos por KIVA Y MiCrédito., ella vende gaseosa, agua y abarrotes. Poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante con su familia y suplir la demanda de sus clientes es por esta razón que solicita otro crédito para comprar mayor variedad de productos tales como: gaseosas, salsas, pastas y otros. De esta manera podrá obtener mayores ganancias y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Bertha has managed to get ahead thanks to her hard work and to the help of loans from Kiva and MiCrédito. She sells sodas, water, and groceries. Little by little she has been able to get ahead with her family and meet her customers' demand.

She is requesting a new loan in order to purchase a wider variety of products, such as sodas, sauces, pasta, and other items. This will allow her to keep working and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy products like sodas, sauces, pasta, and other items.

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
This is a well dedicated group of five members, who have work so hard to improve their standard of living. The group is called 'God is great'.
Rosemond is the group Representative, she is married with two children all in their elementary level of education.

Rosemond supports her husband for the provision and upkeep of her family,she sell fried eggs with toasted bread and beverages such tea and noodles for her customers. This business takes place both morning and evening.
There has been an increase in customers demand and due to this reason Rosemond with her counterpart seek a Kiva loan through ID-Ghana.
She will use her loan portion to buy more food items for much production to satisfy the buyers demand.

loans.use: to buy more food items for much production to satisfy the buyers demand.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo es una mujer de 24 años de edad, su estado civil soltero, no tiene hijos, con el apoyo de sus padres ha logrado terminar sus estudios. Ella es una persona muy dedicada en su hogar y responsable en sus obligaciones desde muy temprana edad ella ha trabajado y hace 3 años ha empezado con la confección de prendas de vestir  gracias al apoyo de su cuñada quien le enseño a manejar las máquinas de coser y elaborar las prendas de vestir.
El cliente sueña en llegar a tener su microempresa grande y dar empleo a más personas que necesitan,  siempre con el esfuerzo de su trabajo y el apoyo emocional de su familia.
El sector donde la cliente reside pertenece a Atuntaqui ciudad donde existen muchas microempresas que se dedica a la producción textilera y también a los exquisito platos típicos como es la fritada.
El crédito que solicito es para la compra de materiales para producir prendas de vestir e incrementar mercadería que serán vendidas en el mes de diciembre temporadas que serían muy  buenas económicamente.
Consuelo está muy agradecida con KIVA quien le otorgo el crédito para seguir fortaleciendo su microempresa y así poder seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Consuelo is a 24-year-old woman. She is single and has no children. With the support of her parents, she has succeeded in finishing her education. She is very dedicated to her home, and has been responsible in her obligations. She has worked from a very young age, and three years ago, she started making clothing thanks to the support of her sister-in-law, who taught her to operate sewing machines and make clothing.

She dreams of having a large small business and of offering jobs to people who need them. She always puts effort into her work and offers emotional support to her family.

The area where she lives is in the city of Atuntaqui, where there are many micro-enterprises that are dedicated to textile production and also to making traditional foods, such as fried foods.

The loan she requested is to buy material to make clothing and increase her merchandise, which will be sold in December--a season that is very good economically.

Consuelo is very thankful to Kiva, who offers the loan, to allow her to continue strengthening her micro-enterprise and, thus, continue going forward.

loans.use: to buy materials to produce clothing and increase her merchandise for the season that approaches.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.fr:
Jean de dieu est un homme dynamique et travailleur de 29 ans. Il est marié  et sa femme est aussi vendeuse comme lui et ils ont 2 enfants dont le premier est de 8 ans, scolarisé et le seconde est âgé d’un an.
Le dernier prêt de Jean de dieu a servi à acheter des ustensiles de cuisine pour la revente. Il est à son 2eme prêt au niveau de CEFOR. Jean de dieu s’est habitué à la vente d’ustensiles de cuisine grâce à son ancienne activité qu’il entreprend jusqu’à maintenant : Vente d’ustensiles de cuisine avec son ancien employeur.
Leur objectif est d’avoir leur maison dans l’avenir, et ainsi ils n’auront plus à payer de loyer, cela grâce à l’épargne.
texts.en:
Jean De Dieu is an energetic and hard-working 29-year-old man. He is married and his wife is a salesperson, as is he. They have two children; the first is eight years old and in school, and the second is one year old. 

Jean De Dieu's last loan was used to buy kitchen utensils to sell on. He is on his second loan with CEFOR. Jean De Dieu is accustomed to selling kitchen utensils, thanks to his previous activity that he has been undertaking up to present: selling kitchen utensils with his former employer. 

Their aim is to have their own house in the future using savings, and, as such, will no longer have to pay rent.

loans.use: to buy plates, glasses, spoons, cups, salad bowls and platters.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda is 21 years old and she is single, living with her parents, where she supports them by occupying one room.

Amanda is a farmer and sells vegetables in many places Also Amanda raises and sells cattle, so she needs a loan to buy more cattle. That way she will increase her money, so she hopes you can help her

loans.use: to buy more cattle .

loans.name: Emelina

texts.es:
LLa señora Emelina es una mujer muy emprendedora, cuenta con una pulpería la cual está ubicada en una comunidad de El Paraíso, su negocio es muy productivo gracias a su ubicación y tiene gran cantidad de clientes y gracias a eso ha podido ampliar más su negocio.
Doña Emelina necesita el préstamo para la compra de vasos, platos, pailas, baldes, etc. y poder invertir en su otro negocio que es la venta de productos plásticos para el hogar y poder tener más mercadería para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, espera que esta inversión le genere una mayor fuente de ingresos.
Doña Emelina sueña con poder ampliar su negocio y convertirlo en una mini mercadito para que la gente pueda descansar y puedan consumir de sus productos. 


Danli, Honduras -  Noviembre del 2015
texts.en:
Emelina is a very enterprising woman. She has a grocery store that is located in a community of El Paraíso. Her business is very productive thanks to its location and she has a large quantity of customers. Thanks to this, she has been able to expand her business more.

Emelina needs this loan to purchase glasses, dishes, pots, buckets, etc. and to be able to invest in her other business, which is the sale of plastic products for the home. This will allow her to have more merchandise to satisfy the demands of her customers. She hopes that this investment will generate a major source of income.

Emelina dreams of being able to expand her business and convert it into a mini market where people can relax and consume her products.

Danli, Honduras - November 2015

loans.use: to buy glasses, dishes, pots, buckets, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en: Esperanza is 41 years old, and she is married with 3 kids. She is the owner of the house where she lives with her family. Esperanza is a farmer: she sells carrots, lettuce, and other vegetables, and she goes to many fairs to offer her products. Esperanza needs a loan to buy land that will help her to increase her production of vegetables. She hopes you can help her because it is a good business for her, since she has a lot of experience and has been doing this since she was a child.

loans.use: to buy land that will help her to increase her production of vegetables.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela lives in the Mexican state of Puebla with her husband and two kids and works in catalog sales. Manuela is a hard working woman that knows that things that last a lifetime are worth the wait. However, 17 years has been a long time. Manuela and her husband acquired the land as soon as they got married but started the construction much after. They have been saving and investing year after year to finish their house and move in. The know that without a credit, it will take many years more to finish what has been a lifelong dream.

With this credit, Manuela and her family will now be able to finish the construction and move in. No other institution has granted them a housing credit before due to the informality of both their jobs and their low income. This represents to Manuela a lifetime opportunity that will finally help her dream come true. With this credit Manuela and her family will receive supervision visits that will ensure that the construction meets all the quality and safety standards. Manuela looks forward to the day when she can finally call this home.

loans.use: to finish building her house and after 17 years finally provide a home to her family

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casada, su esposo es agricultor y tienen dos hijos.

Gloria, se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura desde hace más de 15 años, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres, quienes toda su vida fueron agricultores, actualmente tiene cultivo de maíz y de frijol, para lo cual su esposo le ayuda a realizar gran parte de las labores agrícolas y además crían ganado de repasto y de esta forma obtienen ingresos para cubrir los gastos del hogar.

Gloria, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para fertilizar el cultivo de frijol.
El sueño de Gloria es continuar trabajando en la agricultura para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria is 34 years old and has a third-grade education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer.

For over fifteen years, Gloria has been farming also. She learned the trade from her parents, who worked farming their whole lives. She is currently growing corn and beans, and her husband helps her a lot with the work. They also raise livestock, and this way they obtain enough income to cover their household expenses.

Gloria needs this loan to buy farm supplies to fertilize her bean crops. Her goal is to keep working in order to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies to fertilize her bean crops.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 45 year old mother of two who works hard to help her husband provide good living conditions for the family. While her husband works abroad as a car mechanic, Sanaa makes a living from selling home products in the area where she lives, in Aley, Lebanon. She has been working in sales for over 15 years now and enjoys getting to know people and understanding their needs which allows her to adjust her supplies accordingly. In fact, she also works as an employee in a clothes shop near her house as a way to earn an extra revenue.

She is asking for a 2,313,613 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She will be using the loan to buy home products that her clients have been requesting, in order to sell them and increase her income. The loan will therefore allow her to keep her customers satisfied as well as provide for her son and daughter.

loans.use: to buy home products and sell them to her clients

loans.name: Sorlimor Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Chokor Tendabaa district of Accra province, Mary is a 37-year-old single parent of three children. In order to support her living conditions, she has been selling fruits and vegetables for 26 years. The fruits has been in much demand by customers. This causes her to gain less access to customer satisfaction than before, and she is able to earn income of only about 200ghs per day. She can save around 75ghs each day after her expenses.

Due to not having enough working capital, she has decided to apply for a loan in order to buy more friuts and vegetables for customers satisfaction. This will be the fifth loan cycle for her group with ID-Ghana. She hopes that this loan will help her fruits and vegetables to be delivered on time, and to be able to sell it for a better price.

loans.use: To buy more friuts and vegetables for customers satisfaction.

loans.name: Ladies Of Hill Cut Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is a 32-year-old business woman. She is a member of the solidarity group Ladies Of Hill Cut Group, which has five members. (See group picture; Fatmata is in the middle).

Fifteen years ago, Fatmata established her cosmetics business to support her children in their schooling. She pays school fees, buys learning material, and provides food for her children. She runs her business six days a week from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Ladies Of Hill Cut Group needs a total loan of 5,000,000 SLL. Fatmata is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL, which she will use to buy cartons of body cream, spray, facial powder, etc. to add to her business.

She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Fatmata is married with three children, ages 18, 4 and 2 years, and all are school-going children.

In the future, Fatmata plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.

Fatmata and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of body cream, spray, facial powder, etc.

loans.name: Francis Antonio

texts.es: Francis tiene 29 años de edad y se dedica a prestar sus servicios de jornalero en una finca cercana a su localidad, lo que le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Él vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 3 años de edad, al que siempre busca la manera de brindar lo mejor. Francis desea construir un cuarto en su vivienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto en su vivienda, lo cual le permitirá brindar mayor comodidad y seguridad a su familia. Con el crédito anterior Francis encemento el piso y mejoró el techo de su vivienda, por lo que se siente muy feliz.
texts.en:
Francis is 29 years old and works providing services as a laborer for a property near his town. This allows him to provide for his family. He lives with his life partner and their three-year-old son. He always finds a way to do what's best for his child.

Francis used his previous loan to cement the floors and improve the roof of his house, and he is very happy with the results. This time around, he wants to add a room to the home, so he is requesting a new loan from FUSAI to buy cement, gravel, sand, bricks, and iron. He will use these materials to build the new room, which will help him give his family more comfort and safety.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to build a new room.

loans.name: José Ramiro

texts.es:
José, de 61 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y gallinas, junto a ella tiene 5 cinco hijos de los cuales solo uno está estudiando. 

José, desde que tenía 10 años de edad le ayudaba a su padre a sembrar maíz y sorgo, pero también tenía que el ganado al potrero de su padre.- José, toda su vida ha estado ligado a la agricultura y a la ganadería y es de donde obtiene ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia; actualmente cosecha 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y de frijol y también tiene 5 vacas.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar ganado de repasto.

José, sueña con tener más ganado y de darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 61 years old. He studied until the second grade. He is in a relationship, and his partner makes a living breeding pigs and chickens. Together with her, he has five children, of which only one is in school.

Since José was 10 years old, he helped his father grow corn and sorghum, but also had livestock in his father's pasture. His whole life has been linked to agriculture and livestock, and it is where he obtains the income to meet the needs of his family. Currently, he harvests 14,000 square meters of corn and beans, and also has five cows.

José needs this loan to buy beef cattle. He dreams of having more cattle and providing the best for his family.

loans.use: to buy beef cattle.

loans.name: Ishwar

texts.en:
Ishwar is 28 years old and lives with his parents and 2 sisters. Ishwar recently joined the Government as a penitentiary officer. Because of the irregular working hours (shifts), he needs a vehicle. 

He approached Seva MFI for a loan of SRD 5000 to buy a secondhand passenger car that will help him travel to work. Together with his father, he also cultivates rice, and has taken several loans from Seva MFI which have been repaid well.

loans.use: to buy a secondhand passenger car.

loans.name: Jose Martin

texts.es:
Martín, de 48 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está casado, su esposa trabaja como empleada domestica y tienen dos hijos.

Martín, ha trabajado en la agricultura toda su vida, porque desde pequeño ayudaba a su padre y así fue como aprendió esta actividad, actualmente trabaja 14,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz y frijol, esto lo realiza con ayuda de sus dos hijos y también se dedica a criar ganado de repasto.

Martín, necesita el préstamo para comprar ganado de repasto.
El sueño de Martín, es mejorar su vivienda y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Martin is 48 years old and has a fifth-grade education. He is married, and his wife works as a housekeeper. They have two children.

Martin has worked farming all his life. Ever since he was little he helped his father and learned the trade. He currently farms 3.5 acres of corn and beans. He does this with help from his children, and also raises livestock.

Martin needs this loan to buy more livestock. His goals are to improve his housing and increase his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Kenny Maribel

texts.es: A sus 20 años de edad Kenny cuenta con una tienda de productos básicos en su vivienda, lo que le permite sacar adelante a su familia y sostener la economía de su familia. Ella vive junto a sus padres y sus dos hermano de 16 y 6 años de edad, por lo que se siente feliz de tenerlos como un apoyo. Kenny desea mejorar el piso de su vivienda y para ello solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y mano de obra para mejorar el piso de su vivienda lo antes posible y de esta manera continuar mejorando su calidad de vida, ya que anteriormente mejoró el techo de su vivienda, por lo que se siente muy agradecida.
texts.en:
At 20 years old, Kenny owns a store selling basic products out of her home, which helps her get her family ahead and support them economically. She lives with her parents and her two brothers who are 6 and 16 years old. She is happy to have their support. 
Kenny wants to improve the floor in her home, and for that she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, gravel and labor to improve the floor of her home as soon as possible. In this way she will continue improving her quality of life. Previously she improved the roof on the house, and is very grateful for that.

loans.use: to invest in cement, gravel, sand and labor to improve the floor in her house.

loans.name: Jenny Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Jenny Carolina  de  33  años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos   hijos que dependen de ambos, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, no tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 05 años a la venta de golosinas, frescos, agua,  ropa interior, etc.
Doña Jenny Carolina es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de más productos para sus negocios como plátanos, queso, tortillas, papas, yuca, etc. y también blusas, pantalones, camisas, para tener bien  surtido sus negocios  ya que la demanda es bastante fuerte para esta época de navidad,  con el apoyo del préstamo va mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida.
Doña Jenny su sueño es tener su propia casa que este nuevo año desea comprar bloques para ir construyendo.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Noviembre del 2015
texts.en:
Jenny Carolina is 33 years old and lives with her husband and their two children. They all live in a community in San Lorenzo, in Honduras' southern valley. For the past five years, she has been selling snacks, refreshments, water, underwear, etc.

Jenny Carolina is a hard worker, and driven to get ahead. She is requesting this loan to buy more products, such as plantains, cheese, tortillas, potatoes, cassava, etc. She will also buy blouses, pants, and shirts. She wants her businesses to be well-stocked because demand will be high during the holiday season. This loan will allow her to improve her business and, in turn, her quality of life.

Jenny doesn't own her home, so her dream is to build it herself. She plans to start buying blocks this year to start the the project.



San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2015

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Fernanda is 60 years old now.

Fernanda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Fernanda requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like rice, spices, etc.

Fernanda has been in this business for 5 years. In the future Fernanda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, spices, etc.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is 43 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by farming sugar cane in the Philippines. Jelly is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Jelly has been farming sugar cane for 13 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Michel is 45 years old and lives together with his wife and five school-aged children. He grows fish, pigs, and sheep and planted fruits and vegetables on rented lands.

Michel has recently rented a plot for planting several vegetables together with his children. He wants to put up a fence for this plot so that animals cannot go in and destroy his vegetables. For this he needs a loan of SRD 2,000.

Michel spends a lot on the studies of his five children, and he needs to save enough for that purpose.

loans.use: to put up a fence for his vegetable plot.

loans.name: Obligation Solidarity Group

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Esther, married with three children. Her children are school-going children. Esther belongs to a solidarity group of seven women who have come together to complement each other to achieve their individual dreams. Obligation Solidarity Group is the name of Esther’s group. (See group picture; Esther is in the middle.)

The group needs a total loan of 15,000,000 SLL. Esther will receive 1,200,000 SLL, which she needs in order to buy an additional bag of rice, one rubber of oil, one rubber of palm oil, etc. for her business.

Esther established her local foodstuffs business 14 years ago to ensure her family gets enough money for their basic needs. She uses profit from this business to provide a livelihood for her family and to support her children’s education.

Esther is a hardworking women. She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week, from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

In the future, Esther plans to support her children to acquire university education. She hopes that one day she will become an international businesswoman. She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to buy an additional bag of rice, one rubber of oil, one rubber of palm oil, etc.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo es una persona  honesta y  responsable es muy dedicado al estudio, desea sobresalir adelante profesionalmente a través de los logros obtenidos. 
Su meta es de tener su título de contador público y poder trabajar en una institución pública, enseñar en las Universidades así ayudar a los jóvenes para ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Hugo is an honest and responsable person. He is very committed to studying. He wishes to stand out professionally through the attained achievements.

His aim is to earn his degree in public accounting so that he can work in a public institution, teach in universities and thus help the young people to be somebody in life.

He is requesting this loan in order to afford the fees and in this way to continue with his studies the way he is doing.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Kimya Group

texts.fr: Jonnita est une femme d’affaires, membre du groupe de crédits «Kimya», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 30 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants dont 2 scolarisés et 2 sont petits. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés dans un  marché de la ville depuis 7 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en dix paires de souliers. Elle commença son business avec le capital reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Jonita is a businesswoman, a member of the "Kimya" loan group, and a client of the Hekima MFI. She is 30 years of age, married with four children, two of whom attend school and the other two are still small.

She has been selling used shoes in a town market for the past seven years and started her business with funds received from her husband. She will buy ten pairs of shoes. She wants to expand her activity, educate and feed her children.

Finally, she thanks Hekima for its support to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: resupply with ten pairs of shoes

loans.name: Bisnat

texts.en:
Bisnat is 51 years old and lives together with his wife and two sons. They earn their income by growing fruit in their backyard.

To improve the income of his family, Bisnat wants to start a car wash business together with his sons. For this they need SRD 2,500 to buy the necessary materials for their car wash.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials for a car wash.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson es un hombre de 27 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo de 3 años y una hija de 7 años, y su negocio es el servicio de llantería y cambio de lubricantes.
Él es independiente, emprendedor y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Huarina’ un pueblo legendario de grandes luchas dónde nació uno de los mártires libertadores y fundadores del país, de clima frio y seco con una temperatura máxima de 12 grados centígrados.
Wilson es de tez morena, baja estatura y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a la agricultura y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela y trabajan en agricultura, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de adobe que cuenta con energía eléctrica no tiene agua ni alcantarillado porque en el lugar no existe el servicio. Su negocio es el servicio de llantería y cambio de lubricantes, actividad que realiza en su domicilio cercano a la carretera que una la ciudad con el lago sagrado y por donde trajinan cientos de movilidades diariamente, “los imprevistos no se pueden controlar y el cambio de llantas en media carretera es normal…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque brinda el servicio las 24 horas. La ventaja de su negocio es que se encuentra cerca de la carretera, la desventaja es la falta de lubricantes y material de trabajo para socorrer inoportunidades. Su sueño es mejorar sus ingresos y aumentar herramientas para su negocio, el desea comprar lubricantes por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 9 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Wilson solicita un préstamo para comprar lubricantes para socorrer las movilidades de los turistas que viajan por estos lugares.
texts.en:
Wilson is a 27-year-old man. He is married and has a 3-year-old son and a 7-year-old daughter. His business is providing tire and oil change services. He is independent, entrepreneurial, and very hardworking. He carries out his business in the town of Huarina, a legendary town of great battles where one of the liberating martyrs who founded the country was born. The town has a cold, dry climate with a maximum temperature of 12ºC.

Wilson has dark skin, a short stature, and a robust physique. His native language is Aymará, which is what is spoken in the area, and he speaks Spanish because of the general culture and because of his business. He shares his life with his wife, who makes a living in agriculture, and with his children who study and work in agriculture. They live in a house, property of the family, which is made of adobe and has electricity. The house does not have water or plumbing because these services are not available in the area.

His business is providing tire and oil change services. He provides this service in his residence, close to the road that unites the city with the sacred lake, and along which hundreds of vehicle move each day. "Unexpected events cannot be controlled and changing tires in the middle of the road is normal..." he comments. His business is successful because he provides service 24 hours a day. The advantage of his business he that he is close to the road. The downside is that he lacks lubricants and working materials to help with inconveniences.

His dream is to improve his income and expand the tools for his business. He wants to buy lubricants on wholesale. This is his first sequence of loans with the institution in the 9 years that he has been in business. It is for these reasons that Wilson is requesting a loan to buy lubricants to help with transport for the tourists who travel around the area.

loans.use: to buy lubricants to help with transport for the tourists who travel around the area.

loans.name: Areej

texts.en:
Areej entered the perfume selling market in Chouf three years ago. She is now 25 years old and recently married a Lebanese army officer.

In 2012, when she was still 22 and living with her parents, Areej opened her perfume store in order to start preparing for her own future and to be financially independent. Her business has been working well since, especially because her prices are very competitive and even allow her to sell her products at wholesale to other shops.

Areej needs a 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds (LBP) loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. The loan will allow her to increase her perfume supplies before the holidays, a period during which she is expecting an increase in demand. This boost in her sales will improve her financials and allow her to start planning, along with her husband, for their family's future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her perfume selling business

loans.name: Maria Rosa Elia

texts.es: María de 41 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida, su hija de 22 años y una nieta de 1 año de edad. Ella es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora quien presta sus servicios en una institución pública ejerciendo la labor de oficios varios y gracias a esto puede cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia. María en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, cemento, grava y pago de mano de obra para encementar el patio de su vivienda y de esta manera ofrecerle un mejor entorno a su nieta.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old and lives alongside her life partner, her 22-year-old daughter, and her one-year-old granddaughter. She is a very responsible and hardworking person who works at a public institution doing various jobs. Thanks to this, she is able to cover her family's basic necessities.

In order to improve her quality of life, María is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sand, cement, and gravel, as well as to pay for labor to cement in the patio in her home. In this way she can offer her granddaughter a better environment.

loans.use: to invest in sand, cement, and gravel, as well as to pay for labor to cement in the patio in her home.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is a hardworking entrepreneur with three children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Andrea dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 47-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy nail polish, brushes, and other materials needed in her business.

Gloria has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, brushes, and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 51 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Helen is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Helen has been in this business for six years now and has borrowed from NWTF 13 times in the past to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es: Alexis, tiene la edad  de 61  años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y su hija, la cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes para café  y algunas plantas de almácigo para resiembra y otros productos para aplicarle al cultivo de café y así que tenga un buen desarrollo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo de su cosecha, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo del café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Alexis is 61 years old and married. He lives with his wife and their daughter, who is his main priority.

He wants to use this loan to buy fertilizer and other products for his coffee plants, as well as buy seedlings to replant, because he wants his crops to develop successfully. Part of the loan will also go toward paying for labor, since he will hire help to apply the products and assist with planting when the time comes. This will allow him to make sure all the work is done well.

His goal is to make the most of the good weather and soil in his area, as well as to put all of his years of experience growing coffee into good practice. He wants to be able to buy the best products so that his plants grow healthy and the harvest is good. His short-term goal is to increase production.

He plans to use the money he makes from his harvest to invest in his family's well-being, meet some of the family's goals, and also to reinvest in his crops.

This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR. Alexis has never been granted a loan by a state bank, but FUDECOSUR offers him easier payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, other products, and seedlings.

loans.name: Lluvia Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Lluvia está conformado por tres microempresarias emprendedoras, quienes trabajan día a día para sacar adelante sus negocios, el grupo es coordinado por doña Lorena de 42 años de edad, soltera y madre de dos hijos de 18 y 15 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas  desde hace quince años y solicita el financiamiento número 19 en la institución porque desea invertir en la compra de maíz, leña, frijoles y queso. La segunda socia Flor de 46 años quien se dedica a la venta de fritanga y la tercer socia es Jessenia de 20 años de edad quién se dedica a la venta de cosméticos.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "Lluvia" (rain) consists of three female micro-entrepreneurs who are working daily to bring their businesses forward.
The group is coordinated by 42-year-old Lorena, who is single and mother of two children aged 18 and 15.

She is selling tortillas for 15 years now and is requesting her 19th funding in the institution, because she wishes to invest in the purchase of corn, wood, beans and cheese.

The second member is 46-year-old Flor who is selling fried foods and the third member is 20-year-old Jessenia who is selling cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder, firewood, beans, garlic and salt.

loans.name: Twuzuzanye / Kageyo Group

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and is married with six children who are between seven and 21 years old. She is well-known in the business of potatoes which she has been doing for about seven years. Josephine is the president of this group, Twuzuzanye / Kageyo, and she is the one who raised up her hand.

Josephine's hours of selling potatoes are from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day and currently she has four employees to help her in the business. She is very happy that this is her 9th cycle to request a loan from Vision Finance Company because the previous loans were very helpful. Josephine is a good client to repay her loans. She wants to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase fertilizer to grow up her field and get a large quantity of potatoes to sell. With the profit from this loan, Josephine will be able to purchase enough food for the family, buy new clothes and shoes for the children, pay school fees for her children, buy medical insurance for her family and buy some animals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow up her field and get a large quantity of potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 53-year old married woman and has two grown children. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store selling goods ranging from eggs, seasonings, edible oil, assorted canned goods, biscuits and soft drinks. Aside from running a store, she also engages in a gasoline retailing business, serving locals in her town, Talibon.

At this moment she would like the opportunity to improve the inventory of her store, but she has insufficient funds to do so.

Emma decided to request a loan to purchase additional stocks like rice, toiletries, gasoline, liquor and soft drinks. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like rice, toiletries, gasoline, liquor and soft drinks.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe operates a sari- sari (variety store), selling commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, tooth paste, fabric conditioner and a variety of canned goods. Aside from these items, she also sells fresh fish to the local market in her town.

She is a 67-year old widow and has seven grown children. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol.

She would like to boost her fish vending business and has joined CEVI to access a loan. Guadalupe has requested a loan to purchase a variety of fish and additional stocks for the store. With the availability of those resources, she will be able to set aside half of the profit for future use and the other half for business expansion.

Guadalupe has successfully repaid her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further rebuild both of her sources of living.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fish and additional stocks for her store.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en:
Sixty-seven-year-old Bonifacia owns a small lot and grows cacao (cocoa) beans. She is married and has five grown children. She makes tableya (made of cocoa) bean that is roasted (like coffee) for at least 3 hours and grinded manually. She resides in the town of Barili together with his husband.

Bonifacia would like to increase the production of finish products, but the only problem is the shortage of capital to acquire the resources needed. With the presence of that, she could able to continue improve her livelihood to become more sustainable in the future.

She has requested a loan to invest on cacao( cocoa) seeds and food for the family.

loans.use: to invest in cacao (cocoa)  seeds and food for the family.

loans.name: Mevasoa

texts.fr:
Mevasoa est une jeune femme mariée de 26 ans. Elle est simple et travailleuse. Son mari vend des bois de cuisson et dirige un stand de "kafe sy mofo". Elle est mère d’un Le couple a un enfant de 2 ans et qui est en  maternelle dans une école privée. Elle loue le terrain sur lequel est construite une maison en bois depuis 2012, une maison en bois qui sert d'habitation et de lieu de vente à la fois. Ce qui la motive à réaliser et exécuter son objectif: acquérir un terrain et y construire sa propre maison en dur.
Mevasoa en est à son 3eme prêt à CEFOR. Elle est dans la vente de charbon depuis 2005. C’est sa principale source de revenu. Le prêt servira à acheter  60 sacs de charbon  pour la revente. Les charbons de bois sont beaucoup utilisés dans le pays donc le marché est sûr.
texts.en:
Mevasoa is a 26-year-old married woman. She is simple and hardworking. Her husband sells cooking timber and runs a "kafe sy mofo" (coffee and hotcake) booth She is the mother of a two-year-old, who is in a private kindergarten.

Since 2012 she rents the land on which a wooden house is built, serving both as a residence and a point of sale. She is motivated to perform and attain her goal: acquire land and build her own solid house.

Mevasoa is on her third loan with CEFOR. She has been selling charcoal since 2005, which is her main source of income. The loan will serve to buy 60 sacks of charcoal for resale. Charcoal is widely used throughout the country so the market is secure.

loans.use: buy 60 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin, de 35 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura, creció con sus padres que le enseñaron esta actividad, su familia está formada por su hijo y su esposa.

Edwin, se levanta temprano para ir a las parcelas donde trabaja durante la mañana junto a  su esposa  y en la tarde trabaja como albañil, mientras su esposa se dedica a cuidar el ganado y a hacer los oficios domésticos de la casa.

Edwin, necesita el préstamo para comprar una novilla para incrementar la producción de leche para que su esposa pueda vender leche, porque actualmente es solo para consumo y así generar más ingresos.

Edwin, sueña con comprar más ganado.
texts.en:
Edwin is 35 years old and makes his living in agriculture. He grew up with his parents who taught him this occupation. His family includes his son and his wife.

Edwin gets up early to go to his plot of land where he works throughout the morning together with his wife. In the afternoon he works in construction while his wife takes care of the cattle and the household.

Edwin needs a loan to buy a heifer to increase his milk production so that his wife can sell the milk. Currently the milk is only used for their consumption so in this way they will generate more income.

Edwin dreams of buying more cattle.

loans.use: to buy a heifer to increase his milk production so that his wife can sell milk.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es: José tiene 58 años de edad y se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una empresa cercana de su municipio, con lo cual logra llevar el sustento a su hogar. Él habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 34 años de edad. José desea reconstruir una pared de su vivienda, ya que anteriormente solicito un crédito para realizar esta mejora pero lo redirección para mejorar el techo de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena y grava para mejorar las paredes de su vivienda.
texts.en:
José is 58 years old and he works providing his services to a business that is close to his town, with which he is able to support his home. He lives in his own home with his life parter and their 34 year old daughter.
José wants to rebuild a wall in his home. He previously requested a loan for this same purpose but redirected those funds to improve the roof of his home. That is why he is requesting a new loan from FUSAI to buy: cement, sand and gravel to improve the walls of his home.

loans.use: to buy: cement, sand and gravel to improve the walls of his home

loans.name: Eutiquiano

texts.en:
A year ago, Eutiquiano began operating an internet shop. He provides access to the internet and other online services for a particular fee per hour. He resides in the town of Barili together with his child and his partner in life. Aside from operating an internet shop, he also raises and sells hogs, to cater to the needs of the entire household.

He is asking for a loan to purchase one computer unit and pig feed. He could now improve his livelihood and be able to continue to support the needs of his family. These will improve his income and help him accommodate additional customers. Slowly, his income will improve and allow him to expand his business.

For the future, Eutiquiano is doing his best to continue to improve his livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase one computer unit and pig feed.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita lives a simple life with her family in the town of Calape, Bohol. She is married with four children who are 10, 8, 5 and 2 months old. Her husband is a fisherman and she sells fish from his catch. They have been doing this livelihood for nine years. Now Nenita is asking for a loan, as she wants to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, fishing rope and fishing weights. She will also need the money to repair their fishing boat. Thus, Nenita wants to improve their livelihood for her children’s future. She wants them to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, fishing rope and fishing weights as well as pay for fishing boat repair.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is a 62-year-old married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Emerita has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fruit stock to sell.

Emerita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Emerita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruit stock to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 26-year-old woman with two children, who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business.

Juliet has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en: Nila has worked in a fish-selling business for the past years to support their children while her husband runs their farm. Presently, they have three children who are already grown up. With much effort, their earnings are enough only for their daily consumption and to pay bills. This is the reason why Nila decided to borrow money. She needs additional capital to operate their business continuously. From this money, she will buy more fish to sell and fertilizer for their plants. Nila is a 54-year-old woman whose only goal in life is to improve their business so they can have better lives in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish, and fertilizer for their plants.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 29 years old and has three children. Irene is a woman and has one child in school.

Irene is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Irene requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Irene has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Irene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 37 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Leah works very hard to provide for them.

Leah runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like coffee, eggs, canned goods, junk foods, and other groceries.

Leah has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Leah would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like coffee, eggs, canned goods, junk foods, and other groceries

loans.name: Liany

texts.en:
Liany is a woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Liany is 29 years old and has one child in school.

Liany has a fishing business in the Philippines. Liany requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

Liany has been in this business for two years. In the future, Liany would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Robina is 38 years old and has one child currently in school.

Robina has a food vending business in the Philippines. Robina requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as vegetables, meat, fish, spices, etc.

Robina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Robina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as vegetables, meat, fish, spices, etc.

loans.name: Thanh Yen 15 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuy, 33, is a Thai ethnic woman who is married and has two children: a 15-year-old boy and a 12-year-old girl. She lives with her husband and children in a Thai ethnic traditional house in a small village. Mrs. Thuy and her husband work very hard in agricuture to earn a living and to send the children to school. They grow rice and raise pigs, chickens, ducks, buffalo and cows.

This will be the fifth loan that Mrs. Thuy has taken out from the Anh Chi Em Program; she will use it to buy food for the pigs and chickens. Despite plenty of difficulties in farming and breeding such as diseases, she believes that her production will bring good income to her family because of her experience in agriculture and the continuous technical support of the Program's staff.

Mrs. Thuy dreams that her children will be successful in their careers and in life so that they will have a more abundant life. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy food for her pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Kathleen

texts.en:
Kathleen is 44 years old and married with two children who are still in school. Kathleen works very hard to provide for them.

Kathleen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, drinks, snack foods, shampoo and other personal care products.

Kathleen has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Kathleen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, drinks, snack foods, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Eriberto

texts.en:
Eriberto is a Mexican dairy farmer. He owns 23 cows and sells their milk as well as the cheese he produces from it. He also raises a few hogs, sheep and poultry.

He was looking for a solution to reduce his LP gas expenses in the cheese production process. Buying the unsustainable gas tanks every month was strongly reducing the small profit he was making from the sale of his products!

By investing in a biodigester, he will not only treat his animals' manure, eliminating flies, bad smells and greenhouse gases, but he will above all become his own supplier of renewable energy and organic fertilizer. As his Sistema Biobolsa starts transforming waste into resources, he will be able to integrate biogas into his cheese production process and replace the expensive LP gas.

Eriberto is looking forward to turning his farm into a model for a sustainable and climate-friendly cheese production unit! With the savings he will generate, he plans to buy new tools to produce cheese in a more efficient manner.

This loan represents 51% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 20 m3 Sistema Biobolsa waste-to-energy system.

loans.name: Jonelyn

texts.en:
Jonelyn is 21 years old, single, and has one child.

Jonelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jonelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Jonelyn has been in this business for one year now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jonelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Richard

texts.fr:
Richard est un jeune homme travailleur et débrouillard de 23 ans. Il est marié et sa femme est vendeuse. Le couple n'a pas  encore d’enfants. 
Richard est a son 3ème prêt à CEFOR. Il a créé l’activité de boucherie depuis 4 ans. Il a repris l’activité de son père, et a suivi une formation en charcuterie auparavant. Il a déjà monté un mini projet pour la création de l’activité de charcuterie. 
Le couple vis dans la maison de leur tante. L’objectif est la construction d’une maison ainsi que l’extension de l’ activité en un projet de plus grande ampleur.
texts.en: Richard is a hard-working and enterprising 23-year old man. He is married, and his wife works as a vendor. They do not have children yet. Richard is on his third loan with CEFOR. He opened his butcher shop four years ago. He took over this business from his father, after taking formal training in the trade. He already had to do some fundraising to launch his butcher shop. Richard and his wife live in an aunt's house. Richard's goal is to build a house and  take his business to the next level.

loans.use: to buy an electronic scale, beef cuts etc.

loans.name: Jesus Eugenia

texts.es: Con 33 años de edad, Jesús es una mujer trabajadora que hace todo lo posible para que a su hija no le falte nada y pueda tener una buena calidad de vida, ella reside en vivienda propia junto a su hija de 9 años de edad, quien es su apoyo y es la persona quien le da fuerza para seguir adelante día con día. Jesús ha logrado mantener la economía del hogar gracias a un pequeño negocio que posee de venta de platillos típicos. Además en busca de mejorar sus ingresos económicos vende joyería, este negocio lo maneja de forma ambulante. En busca de aumentar sus ingresos solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: anillos, relojes, pulseras, aretes, etc. para surtir su negocio y de esta forma poder aumentar sus ventas. Ella muy agradecida con el crédito anterior ya que gracias a ello pudo invertir para iniciar con el negocio de venta de joyería.
texts.en: At the age of 33, Jesús is a hardworking woman that does everything she can so her daughter has everything she needs. She lives in a house that she owns with her 9-year-old daughter, who's her support structure and the one who gives her the strength to get ahead day by day. Jesús has managed to cover the household financials thanks to her small business where she sells traditional meals. Also, in order to increase her income she sells jewelry door to door. In order to boost sales, she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in rings, watches, bracelets, earrings, etc, to stock her business. She is very thankful for her previous loan that she was able to invest in the start up for the jewelry business.

loans.use: to buy rings, watches, bracelets, earrings, etc, to stock her business and increase her sales.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 69-year-old widow with eight adult children. Lilia has been operating her retail store for many years and was able to sustain the business. She had to support herself, and paid for some home improvements for a comfortable living. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. She is now aiming to increase her sales, so she took a new loan to purchase additional home products to sell. She hopes to expand her store by making some renovations for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Ligia Janeth

texts.es: Ligia Janeth, tiene la edad  de 48 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y su hijo, el cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle al cultivo de café y así que tenga un buen desarrollo, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo de su cosecha, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo del café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
48-year-old Ligia Janeth is married and lives with her husband and one son, who is her main priority. With this loan, she intends to buy fertilizers and other products to apply to her coffee crop so it has a good development. She also would like to use it to pay for the labor that will apply the products and assist with the crop once it has developed. She wants to take advantage of the good weather and soil conditions in her region for coffee growing and also to put in practice her many years of experience with coffee plantations. 

Ligia Janeth wants to be able to buy the best products for her plantation, which will allow her to have a good production. She wants to use the income from the crop to improve her family's well-being and achieve some family goals, in addition to continue investing in her crops. This is the first loan that she receives from FUDECOSUR. She had not had any other loans from banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided this loan with better conditions and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to help with her coffee crops.

loans.name: Lany

texts.en:
Lany is 33 years old and married with five children, who are all are presently in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lany has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 55 years old and married with eight children. With two of her children in school, Veronica works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like condiments, eggs, snack foods, and other groceries.

Veronica has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Veronica would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like condiments, eggs, snack foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Onan

texts.en:
Onan dedicates himself to raising poultry and owns more than 1,000 animals. He decided to invest in a Sistema Biobiolsa biodigester in order to take advantage of the animals' manure and transform it into biogas and organic fertilizer. This will allow him to stop using the wood his wife used to spend hours collecting in the surrounding areas to cook, exposing herself and her family to the toxic smoke on a daily basis. Further, the biogas will replace the expensive and fossil fuel-based LP gas the family was buying in addition to the wood.

Onan is proud to transform what he used to consider as waste into productive resources that will improve his family's living conditions. He expects the yield of his plants to improve with the nutrient-rich organic fertilizer produced by the system, in order to turn his forage field into an organic farming model and eliminate chemical fertilizers.

This loan represents 65% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a downpayment from the client.

loans.use: to purchase an 8 cubic meter waste-to-energy system.

loans.name: Daria

texts.en:
Daria earns a living by engaging in tailoring services. She does dress making, dress adjustment and other related services. She resides in the town of Talibon. She is 62-year-old married woman and has five grown children. Her husband is a fisherman.

To cope with demands, she joined Kiva's field partner CEVI to be able to get financial services.

Daria has requested a loan to invest in materials like clothing and thread and pay for boat repair. These will help boost her livelihood and improve her husband's way of fishing.

Daria is looking forward to continuing to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to invest in materials like clothing and thread, and pay for boat repair.

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en: Jenefer is a sari-sari store owner who lives in the town of Tubigon, Bohol. She is married with two children. The oldest child is 12 years old while the youngest child is 10 years old. With her eagerness to help her husband, she successfully started her own business. Jenefer is a 31-year-old woman who dreams of a better means of living. Thus, she wanted to improve her business to help them in their daily needs. She is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as chips, candies, biscuits, toiletries, coffee, sugar, salt, spices, noodles, canned goods and drinks. In this way, she will be able to improve her earnings for her children’s future.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as chips, candies, biscuits, toiletries, coffee, sugar, salt, spices, noodles, canned goods and drinks

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is a hardworking married woman and has two school-aged children. She hails from the town of Talibon. She is a dealer of Avon products like lotion, body spray, kitchenwares and a footwear collection. Her husband earns a living by being a chef.

Holiday season is fast approaching, and she would like to avail herself of the promos and discounts on certain products, but she does not have enough funds to finance her business.

Andrea decided to request a loan to acquire additional capital to purchase supplies like clothing and ladies accessories. With these, she could maximize her resources, enabling her to maintain the flow of merchandise. Thus, she could start to save and invest in any business opportunities to improve the family's living condition. She is thankful to Kiva for the funds.

loans.use: to acquire additional capital to purchase supplies like clothing and ladies accessories

loans.name: Letty

texts.en: Letty is 40 years old, married with four children, and is from Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For the past six years she has been raising and selling pigs to make a living. She earns 6,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Letty joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañado, su pareja es ama de casa, tienen 3 hijos de los cuales solo uno asiste a la escuela.
