Gabriel, tiene 14 años de trabajar en la agricultura, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre y actualmente produce 7,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz y de frijol con la ayuda de su padre y el lugar donde siembra está a 500 metros de su casa y además trabaja como ayudante de albañilería, de esta forma genera ingresos para ayudar a su familia.

Gabriel, necesita el préstamo para colocar una tienda en su casa, para que su pareja la atienda y pueda ser otra fuente de ingresos.

El sueño de Gabriel, es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y que sus hijos puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
Gabriel is 26 years old and has a seventh-grade education. He has a partner, a housewife, and three children, only one of whom attends school.

Gabriel has been working in farming for 14 years. He learned the trade from his father and currently produces 7000 square metres of corn and beans. He works with his father on land 500 metres from his home. Gabriel also works as a building labourer, allowing him to earn a living to help his family.

Gabriel needs this loan in order to open a shop in his house. His partner will work at the shop in order to provide the family with another source of income.

Gabriel's dream is to provide his family with a higher quality of life and for his children to study.

loans.use: to open a shop selling staple goods in his house. His partner will work at the shop in order to provide the family with another source of income.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a 37-year-old married woman and has five school-aged children. She goes fishing for a living. Her husband is also a fisherman. She wakes up early at dawn to do her work and returns home to sell fish to neighbors and nearby residents.

She faces a problem that could prevent her from continuing to operate her day-to-day livelihood activity. Her fishing boat needs repair and she does not have enough funds to acquire the needed materials.

She has requested a loan to purchase materials for boat renovation like plywood and paint. These will help boost and improve her earnings. Thus, she could be able to provide her family with nutritious meals and continue to support their respective studies.

In the future, Amelia is aiming to have a healthy family and a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase materials for boat renovation like plywood and paint.

loans.name: Ma. Renefe

texts.en:
Ma. Renefe is 40 years old and has five children. Ma. Renefe is married and has four children who are in school.

Ma. Renefe is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Renefe requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Ma. Renefe has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Renefe would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Luis Andrés

texts.es: Luis es un padre de familia de 49 años que vela por el bienestar de su familia y en vista de no contar con un empleo estable decidió iniciar su propio negocio en el año 2006, él distribuye panes a diferentes tiendas de Soledad y su negocio exclusivamente es la distribución sin embargo cuenta con excelentes panaderías que le ofrecen  buenos precios.  Diariamente recorre en su bicicleta 25 tiendas a partir de las 10 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m., Luis considera que podría visitar muchas más tiendas si reparara una motocicleta de su propiedad es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para llevar a cabo su proyecto. Con esta inversión extenderá su ruta y con ello sus ingresos, los cuales son utilizados en el sostenimiento de su familia y los gastos de educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis is 49 years old and a father. He looks out for his family's well-being and, as he has no stable job, decided to start his own business in 2006. Luis delivers bread to various shops in Soledad. This distribution work is Luis' only professional activity. However, he has excellent bakeries who offer him good prices.

Every day, Luis goes round 25 stores on his motorbike. He starts at 10am and finishes at 5pm. Luis believes that he could visit many more stores if he repaired his motorcycle. He is therefore applying for a Kiva loan, an opportunity to enter the financial world through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order carry out his plan.

With this investment, Luis can extend his route and thus increase the income that he uses to support his family and pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 33 years old and has two children. Marites is married and has two children who are in school.

Marites is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marites has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Marvie

texts.en:
Marvie is 45 years old and has one child.

Marvie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marvie requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marvie has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marvie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 54 years old and has six children. Martha is married and has three children who are in school.

Martha is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Martha requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Martha has been in this business for 18 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Martha would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Merabella

texts.en:
Merabella is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Merabella is 40 years old now.

Merabella has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines. Merabella requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business.

Merabella has been in this business for four years. In the future, Merabella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is 59 years old and has two children. Merla is a married woman.

Merla is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Merla requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Merla has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Merla would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Katerine Judith

texts.es: Katherine es una muchacha creativa y de mente abierta, le gusta interactuar con las personas, es por esta razón que estudia mercadotecnia y trabaja como administradora en una casa pastoral. Para seguir sus estudios Katherine desea un financiamiento para comprar una computadora y una impresora que le faciliten el trabajo en su universidad ya que la carrera que estudia demanda muchos programas para realizar trabajos. De esta manera podrá culminar sus estudios satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
Katherine is a creative young woman, and she has an open mind. She likes to interact with others and is therefore studying marketing and working as a manager at a pastoral home.

In order to continue with her studies, Katherine wants to apply for a loan to buy a computer and printer, which will help with her university work. Katherine needs many programmes in order to do work for university.

With a computer and printer, Katherine will be able to complete her studies in a satisfactory manner.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a printer.

loans.name: Uamsho Group

texts.fr: Veuve depuis quelques années, Machozi s'est lancé dans le commerce de pagnes il y a maintenant 25 ans grâce à l'appui de son défunt époux. Elle a été secondée un peu plus tard par le crédit qu'elle reçoit de PAIDEK. Cette activité a contribué à la prise en charge de ses enfants: scolarisation, alimentation, soins médicaux et bien d'autres. Ayant un petit capital, elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer ses marchandises afin de maximiser ses revenus vu la grande charge familiale qui pèse sur elle. Sur photo, Machozi est en premiere position, elle porte un foulard bleu et des pagnes bleus.
texts.en:
Machozi has been a widowed for few years. She started selling pagnes 25 years ago with the help of of her late husband. Later on, she got the support of PAIDEK through their loan program. This activity helped her to provide for her children in terms of tuition, food, medical care and more. Having a small amount of capital, she is seeking this loan to bolster her stock of merchandise and maximize her income given the heavy family burden that she bears.

On the group photo, Machozi is first from the left and wearing a blue scarf.

loans.use: to bolster her stock of pagnes to sell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José es un hombre trabajador de 69 años de edad que se dedica a prestar sus servicios de seguridad, además él se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven, por lo que desde hace 40 años cuida de sus tierras, cultivando productos como granos básicos y legumbres. José vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 15 y 17 años de edad desde hace 5 años. Él desea mejorar el techo y paredes de su vivienda, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, lámina y pines para mejorar el piso y techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
José is a hardworking man who is 69 years old and works in security services. He also has worked in agriculture since he was very young, and for the past 40 years he has tended his land, growing products such as staple grains and legumes. 
For the past 5 years José has lived with his wife and her two children who are 15 and 17 years old. He hopes to improve the roof and walls of his home, and for this reason he requested a loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, aluminum and wooden beams to improve the floor and roof of his home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, aluminum and wooden beams to improve his home.

loans.name: 3 De Abril Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 39 años de edad, separada, tiene un hijo de 22 años, y su negocio es la venta de armazones para lentes.
Ella es leal, honesta y muy considerada. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, área caracterizada por acoger a la mayor parte de la población y por el comercio informal y manufactura en todas las áreas, de clima cálido, tropical y muy húmedo. 
Maria es de tez morena, cabello negro largo y baja estatura, (sentada al centro, viste blusa color melón y cartera con letras ‘mk’), su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla cuando se encuentra con familiares y habla español por negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que estudia y trabaja, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo, que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica  y alcantarillado. La necesidad por mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios mejoraron, crecieron y se expandieron es por eso que solicitan otro crédito. Su negocio es la venta de armazones para lentes, los armazones son piezas que sirven como soporte rígido para sostener los espejuelos, “existen diferentes formas de rostros y diferentes tipos de modelos de lentes tanto para personas adultas como para niños, esto depende del gusto como de sus necesidades...” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque cuenta con variedad de armazones y porque asesora correctamente a sus clientes. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja son las largas distancias que debe recorrer para encontrar a sus clientes. Su sueño es abrir un puesto fijo de venta para dejar de ambular, ella desea comprar armazones para lentes de temporada. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para comprar armazones para lentes por mayor para ofertar en las fiestas de navidad.
texts.en:
Maria is 39 years old and separated. She has a 22-year-old son. She works selling frames for glasses in the southern area of the city, which concentrates most of the population, informal trade, and manufacturing. The weather is tropical, warm, and very humid.

Maria is a loyal, honest, and very considerate person. She has dark skin and long black hair. She is sitting in the middle of the photo, wearing a peach-colored top. Her first language is Guaraní, which she speaks among family, but she uses Spanish for her business. She shares her life with her son, who both works and goes to school. They live in a room they rent, which is built out of brick and has electricity, water, and sewer.

In order to improve her business, she became the leader of her communal bank. All of the members' businesses have improved, grown, and expanded. For this reason, they are requesting a new loan.

"Faces come in different shapes, and you have to match them to the different styles of glasses. It also depends on what the customer needs and likes," says Maria. Her business is successful because she carries a wide variety of frames and because she gives her customers good guidance and advice. Her main advantage is that she has regular customers, and her main obstacle is the long distances she has to cover in order to reach them. Her dream is to open a store and not have to work as a street vendor.

Maria will use her part of this loan to buy wholesale frames for the holiday season. This is her second loan through Emprender, and she has been in business for five years.

loans.use: to buy wholesale frames for the holidays.

loans.name: Neri

texts.en: Neri is 51 years old, married, and has three children. She requested a loan to buy fishing materials. She was able to help her husband to sustain the needs of her family through fishing. She still manages to sell the fish they catch and buy food in return. She was able to provide for the financial needs and education of her children. She wants to have a better life, save for the future, and be able to help her family in need.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials.

location.town: Lower Sagadan, Baroy, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 41 years old and has three children. Linda is married woman.

Linda is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Linda requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Linda has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Linda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lorena is 32 years old and has one child in school.

Lorena has a seafood vending business in the Philippines. Lorena requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell.

Lorena has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lorena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 28 years old and has three children. Leah is married and has one child in school.

Leah is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Leah requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Leah has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leah would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is a woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Karen is 27 years old and has one child in school.

Karen has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Karen requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business.

Karen has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Karen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Muong Phang 43 Group

texts.en:
Phuong, 38, is a Thai ethnic woman. In the picture, she stands first from the right. Phuong is married and has an 18-year-old son. She lives with her husband and son in an old Thai ethnic traditional house in a small, remote village of a poor mountainous province where people mainly rely on small-scale agricultural production. Phuong did not have the chance to study or receive a good education, so she is illiterate. She doesn't want her son to be the same so she works very hard to send him to school so that he may study and have a good future.

Phuong and her husband work in farming and animal husbandry. They grow rice and breed pigs, fish, chicken and ducks. This is the third time that Phuong has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em program. She will use this loan to buy baby fish and fish feed.

Phuong's son will take the examination to enter university next year. If the fish grow fast and healthily, she will sell them for money to cover the cost of the exam. Phuong dreams that her son will be successful in his career and in his life.

loans.use: to buy baby fish and fish feed.

loans.name: Lotis Grace

texts.en:
Lotis Grace is 29 years old and has two children. Lotis Grace is a woman and has two children who are in school.

Lotis Grace is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lotis Grace requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lotis Grace has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lotis Grace would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 29 years old and married with 3 children.

He has had a dairy farming business for 6 years. He has requested a loan of KES 112,990 from VisionFund Kenya. He will be using the loan to purchase a motorcycle for his second business in order to make more income.

He will use the anticipated profit to repay his loan and pay schools fees for his children.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to live a long life full of happiness.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his second business in order to make more income.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 27-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is married with 3 children who are 9, 7, and 4 years old. Her husband is a construction worker while Stella buys and sells scrap materials. She has been doing this for 3 years to help her husband provide for their family.

Thus, Stella is asking for a loan of additional capital to buy more scrap. She requires a loan of 9,000 PHP. In the future, she wants to improve her business for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy scrap material.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is a married woman who lives in Clarin, Bohol. She is 41 years old and earns a living by selling dry goods. Her husband is helping her run this business. They successfully started this business four years ago.  Mary Grace is asking for a loan for additional capital to buy dry goods such as needles, thread, cloth, ribbons, belts and garters.  In this way, she will be able to improve her earnings for her children. She has three school-aged children who are 18, 15 and 13 years old. She wants them to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy dry goods such as needles, thread, cloth, ribbons, belts and garters.

loans.name: Evelinda

texts.en:
Sanelyn is 22 years old and is the youngest of seven children in the family. Her mother Evelinda supports the family through her business fattening pigs in the Philippines.

Sanelyn is studying for her Bachelor of Science in Business Administration and is currently in the second of this four-year course.

Sanelyn is borrowing PHP 6,500 to pay for tuition fees for the second semester of the school year 2015-16.

When she graduates, Sanelyn plans to be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Leizl

texts.en:
Leizl, 28, is married with two children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for her children. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Leizl has requested a loan of 27,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, drinks, snack foods, shampoo and other personal care products.

In the future, Leizl would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, milk, coffee, spices, drinks, snack foods, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en: Bonifacia lives a simple life in the town of Tubigon, Bohol with her family. She is a married woman and earns a living by doing “reflex.” (Reflex is a service that offers a massage with oil or lotion). She has been doing this livelihood for six years and earns about PHP 1,800 per month. With this, Bonifacia is asking a loan to buy lotion and oil, which she uses in doing the reflex. Thus, she wants to improve this livelihood in the future for their sustainability. Bonifacia is a 59-year-old woman and a mother of six children who are already grown up.

loans.use: to buy lotion and oil

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida has been working with her husband on their own farm to make a living. She raises crops in her garden like banana and other produce. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying agriculture chemicals.

To expand and improve her garden, Adelaida recently took a new loan to purchase new seedlings and organic fertilizer.

Adelaida dreams of having an additional lot in the future in order to secure a better source of income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase new seedlings and organic fertilizer to improve her garden.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nilda is 42 years old and has one child in school.

Nilda has a abaca-weaving business in the Philippines. Nilda requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business.

Nilda has been in this business for three years. In the future, Nilda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Pilarina

texts.en:
Pilarina is 45 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Pilarina works very hard to provide for them.

Pilarina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, noodles, personal care products, and other groceries.

Pilarina has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future, Pilarina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, noodles, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Rio

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rio works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal vending. Rio is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy bundles of firewood to sell for her business buying and selling firewood.

Rio has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy bundles of firewood to sell

loans.name: Joenila

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Joenila works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from frozen foods and through raising pigs.

Joenila has sustained her business activities with her seven previous loans from the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She is now borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos from NWTF to buy more seafood to sell to customers.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Reglen

texts.en:
Reglen is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Reglen is 25 years old and has two children who are in school.

Reglen has a business buying and selling liniment in the Philippines. Reglen requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more liniment to sell.

Reglen has been in this business for three years. In the future, Reglen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more liniment to sell

loans.name: Monique Euloxie

texts.fr:
Monique a 50 ans et , est mère de famille de 4 enfants. Étant divorcée, elle s’occupe seule de ses 4 enfants (22-20-18-16 ans)  dont deux sont à l’université, le troisième au lycée en classe de première et le dernier  dans une école privée.  Elle est propriétaire du local où elle habite. Elle a pour objectifs  de construire une maison qui sera mise en location, , de devenir  grossiste de marchandises générales et de tout faire pour la réussite de ses enfants dans leurs études.
Monique a ouvert l’unité de magasin général en 2012. Avant, elle travaillait comme démarcheur auprès d’un grand magasin, ayant constaté l’existence d’un marché sûr, et trouvé un point de vente, l’idée lui est venue d’ouvrir sa propre unité.  Ses expériences dans la vente des produits lui ont beaucoup aidé.  Elle est actuellement à son troisième prêt.
Le prêt servira à acheter des produits de première nécessité  pour la revente et servira aussi à péparer la formalisation des papiers  du magasin.
texts.en:
Monique is 50 years old. She has four children. She is divorced and provides for her children (22, 20, 18, and 16 years of age) on her own. Two of her children are university students; the third one has started high school, and the youngest is in a private school. She owns the house she lives in. Monique's goal is to build a house which will be rented out, to become a wholesaler of first necessity products and do everything to help her children finish their studies successfully.

Monique opened her general store in 2012. Previously she worked as a door-to-door sales representative for a large store. Once she identified a market and found a good location, it occurred to her to pen her own store. Her vending experience has really helped her. She is now on her third loan.
The loan will allow Monique to stock up on first necessity products for resale and also complete administrative formalities for her store.

loans.use: to buy first necessity goods (soaps, pasta etc) and prepare tax registration papers.

loans.name: Yuli Isabel

texts.es: Yuli de 45 años es una ama de casa que decidió emprender su propio negocio desde su hogar, una humilde vivienda ubicada en la zona metropolitana de Barranquilla que circunvecina con el municipio de Soledad, ella vive con su cónyuge y con sus dos hijos de 17 y 11 años de edad, ella combina sus roles de madre, esposa y microempresaria sin alterar el orden y la responsabilidad de cada uno. Su negocio inició con un escaso capital, decidió invertir en unas vitrinas y las surtió con productos de la empresa multinivel a la que se vinculó en el año 2006, allí mantiene una variada gama de productos capilares, lociones, desodorantes, cremas, talcos, colonias, entre otros disponibles para la venta. Sus principales clientes son vecinos, amigos, conocidos y referidos, a quienes les vende de contado e incluso con facilidad de pago. Yuli realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar ropa, calzado y surtido en productos del catálogo, que ofrecerá a sus clientes en la temporada de fin de año. Su meta a futuro es adecuar un local en su casa y apoyar a sus dos hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Yuli is 45 years old. She is a homemaker who decided to start her own business from her humble home, located in the metropolitan area of Barranquilla, which overlaps with the town of Soledad. She lives with her spouse and their two children, ages eleven and seventeen. She manages to balance her roles responsibly, both as a wife and mother and as a microentrepreneur.

She started her business with scarce capital. She decided to invest in some display cases and stocked them with products from the Multinivel company, which she joined in 2006. She carries a wide variety of hair products, lotions, deodorants, creams, powders, fragrances, and other items. Her main customers are her neighbors, friends, and acquaintances, as well as their referrals. She charges cash or credit and offers easy payment terms.

Yuli is requesting a Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will use to buy clothing, shoes, and catalog items for the holiday season. Her long-term goals for the future are to set up a larger retail space in her home and support her two children through school.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and catalog items.

loans.name: Harivololona Lucienne

texts.fr:
Harivololona est une femme attentionnée, active et travailleuse de 52 ans.  Elle est mariée et est mère de 10 enfants  dont 4 déjà mariés et indépendants. Un fils de 20 ans suit ses études à l'université, les cinq autres ( 18-15-12-8-6 ans) sont scolarisés dans des écoles privées . Elle a beaucoup contribué aux  dépenses du ménage , le mari  ayant comme activité la culture de légumes. Elle a pour objectif de construire une maison sur un terrain qu’elle a déjà acquis. Elle a comme objectif  la réussite de ses enfants dans leurs études.
Harivololona est dans l’élevage porcin depuis 2013. Avant, l’activité était la reproduction (vente de porcelets), actuellement , c’est l’engraissement porcin. L’activité secondaire (vente de fruits) est toujours poursuivie jusqu’à ce jour.
texts.en:
Harivololona is a caring, active and hard-working 52-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of ten children, including four who are already married and independent. A 20-year-old son is pursuing his studies at the university, and the other five (18-15-12-8-6 years old) are enrolled in private schools.

She has contributed much towards household expenses, as her husband is a crop farmer. She aims to build a house on land that she has already acquired. Her goal is to see her children succeed in their studies.

Harivololona has been involved in pig farming since 2013. The activity was originally limited to reproduction (selling piglets), and now the focus is pig fattening. Fruit sales is still pursued to this day as a secondary activity.

loans.use: buy three piglets and provender

loans.name: Maria Alba

texts.es: A sus 49 años de edad María cuenta con una pequeña venta de maíz por mayor, la cual realiza para sacar adelante a su familia, además presta sus servicios en una tienda general. Ella vive junto a su compañero de vida, ya que sus dos hijos ya tienen sus propios hogares. María desea invertir en maíz por mayoreo para obtener mejores ingresos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar maíz por mayor para vender en las tiendas, pupuserías y ventas de tortillas, con el crédito anterior ella construyo la fosa séptica de su vivienda.
texts.en:
At 49, Maria counts on a small business selling corn in bulk, which she does to bring up her family. She also offers her services in a general stores. She lives with her life partner, as her two children already have their own homes.

Maria wants to invest in corn in bulk to earn better income. She's seeking a loan from FUSAI to buy corn in bulk to sell in stores, pupusa shops and tortilla sales. With the earlier loan, she built her house's septic tank.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk to sell in stores, pupusa shops and tortilla sales.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha has faithfully repaid the previous loans granted to her. They have really helped sustain her business in the past and opened opportunities for her to start a small "Piso Net" shop and buy a coffee vending machine. She is grateful to God that she learned about KIVA and CCT, whose noble cause is to uplift the spiritual life and livelihood of small business people like her.

Besides her direct sales of personal products, Editha now has a small "Piso Net" business, which is basically a merge of PC and arcade rental services wherein customers can pay for the services by inserting coins into the machine. The rate is typically four minutes/peso, but the price can be raised or lowered to be more competitive and entice customers or to gain more income. PC parts are inside a wooden box similar to that of an arcade machine. Much like the arcade machine, it is activated by inserting coin(s) which trigger(s) the machine. Once the time is consumed, the machine cuts off the display and will resume when a coin is inserted. Editha also placed a coffee vending machine in her shop for additional income.

Editha is again seeking your assistance in the amount of PHP 50,000 to pay for some personal products, spare parts for her PC and stocks of coffee for her vending machine. Her businesses are picking up in sales, especially now that it is school time. Her earnings enable her to provide for her family.

Editha dreams that her business will continue to be successful so she can help her children buy their own house and lot. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for personal products, spare computer parts for her "Piso Net" shop, and stocks of coffee for her coffee vending machine.

loans.name: Dolores Veronica

texts.es: Dolores de 40 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 7 y 18 años de edad. Dolores es una persona muy trabajadora que buscando la manera de sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la venta de productos textiles y gracias a este negocio logra cubrir los gastos del hogar y llevar el pan de cada día a su familia. Y es por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ropa de cama, manteles, hamacas, cobijas, etc. para aumentar las ventas de su negocio y así también las ganancias. Y de esta manera poder mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en: 40-year-old Dolores lives with her husband and two sons, aged 7 and 18. She is a very hardworking woman who sells textiles as a means of supporting her family. Her business enables her to cover the household expenses and provide her family with their daily bread. This is why she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to buy bed linen, tablecloths, hammocks, quilts, etc. to boost her sales and her income. This will allow her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bed linen, tablecloths, hammocks, quilts, etc. to boost her sales.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 57 years old and has three children. Rosa is a married woman.

Rosa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosa has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 42 years old and has three children. Rowena is married and has three children who are in school.

Rowena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rowena has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emelda is 48 years old and has one child currently in school.

Emelda has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Emelda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

Emelda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Emelda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie, 41 years old, is married and has two children, both still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past ten years, Rosemarie has operated a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and gasoline and to pay for maintenance for her business. Rosemarie would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline and to pay for maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en: Roselyn, 36 years old, is married and has one child. Roselyn works very hard to provide for her family. For the past six years, Roselyn has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, drinks, snack foods, shampoo and other products to sell. In the future, Roselyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, drinks, snack foods, shampoo and other products to sell.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is a 38-year-old married woman with three children, who are all currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell to her store.

Ruby has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell to her store

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel, 52 years old, is married and has four children. Maribel works very hard to provide for them. For the past three years, Maribel has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, drinks, snack foods, shampoo and other products to sell. In the future, Maribel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, drinks, snack foods, shampoo and other products to sell.

loans.name: Doris Alicia

texts.es:
Doris, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, no siguió estudiando porque se caso muy joven, ahora su esposo trabaja como albañil y tienen 5 hijos de los cuales 2 ya se casaron y solo viven con su esposo y tres hijos que estudiaban.

Doris, desde hace 12 años de edad trabaja vendiendo ropa en bazares y tiendas, este negocio lo aprendió de su madre porque ella también se dedicaba al comercio; ahora ella tiene una pequeña tienda propia desde hace un año, en donde vende ropa de todo tipo, ella va a la capital a comprar dos veces por mes y viaja en bus para comprar por mayor. 

Doris, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa para satisfacer a sus clientes y tener más variedad. 

Doris, sueña con que sus hijos se preparen academicamente y puedan tener un bazar en el centro para mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
Doris, 37, studied until high school but didn't continue because she married very young. Now, her husband works as a bricklayer and they have five children, two of whom are already married. She only lives with her husband and three children who are in school.

Twelve year ago, Doris started work selling clothing in markets and stores. She learned this business from her mother, who also worked in retail. Now, she has had her own small store for one year where she sells all types of clothing.

She travels to the capital by bus two times a month to buy in bulk. Doris needs the loan to buy clothing to satisfy her customers and have more variety. She dreams of her children being academically prepared and being able to have a store downtown to improve her economic situation.

loans.use: to buy clothing to satisfy her customers and have more variety.

loans.name: María Pimitiva

texts.es: María es una creativa mujer de 34 años de edad que reside en un barrio del municipio de Soledad, allí vive en compañía de su cónyuge y sus dos hijos de 12 y 7 años.  Ella realizó cursos de lencería, elaboración de sandalias y artesanías, formación que le permitió iniciar su microempresa desde la comodidad del hogar en donde elabora una variada gama de productos.  María cuenta con tres años de experiencia en esta labor y para responder a las solicitudes de sus clientes quienes le encargaron adornos de navidad,  realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar telas, goma, icopor, cuero y cuerina, también para comprar una vitrina donde exhibir sus creaciones.  Esta inversión le permitirá generar excelentes ganancias para el bienestar de sus hijos y ayudar a pagar los gastos educativos del próximo año.
texts.en:
Maria is a creative 34-year-old woman who lives in a neighborhood in the city of Soledad. She lives there with her partner and two children who are 12 and seven years old.

She took courses in lingerie, shoes and handicraft production which allowed her to start her small business from the comfort of her home, where she makes a wide range of products. Maria has three years of experience in this work.

To meet demand from her customers, who commissioned Christmas ornaments, she requested a loan, a Kiva credit, and an opportunity to be linked to financial life through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy fabrics, rubber, polystyrene and leather and to buy a display case to exhibit her creations. This investment will allow her to earn excellent income for the wellbeing of her children and help pay school fees next year.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, rubber, polystyrene and leather.

loans.name: Lalaoarisoa Odette

texts.fr:
Odette vous remercie beaucoup pour le crédit. Ceci lui a permis de renforcer son fonds de roulement, elle a acheté avec, des légumes supplémentaires et puis elle a pu réaménager son lieu de vente, et étendre la culture des légumes de son mari. Les produits obtenus de la culture sont encore insuffisant pour satisfaire les besoins des clients. 
Le couple saisit toutes les opportunités pour créer des activités génératrices de revenus, elle a également loué un étang pour pratiquer la pisciculture, en outre, elle s'efforce d'étendre l'élevage des volailles.
Elle fait beaucoup d’efforts dans son activité afin de terminer la construction de sa maison qui est en cours de finition, une raison qui la pousse à renouveler la demande de crédit.
texts.en:
Odette thanks you very much for the [previous] loan which enabled her to strengthen her working capital. She used it to buy additional vegetables, renovate her point of sales, and expand her husband's crop-farming activity. The resulting crops are still insufficient to meet the customer's needs.

The couple takes every opportunity to create income-generating activities: she leased a pond to practice fish farming, and also is striving to expand poultry farming.

She works hard at her business activities so she can complete the construction of her house. It is nearing completion, which is why she is requesting a renewal of the credit loan.

loans.use: buy 400 kilos of potatoes, one bag of carrots, three crates of tomatoes, 100 kilos of onions, 50 kilos of garlic, 50 kilos of beans, 50 kilos of cucumbers, and 35 masonry blocks

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es: Doña Florencia, tiene 65 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo, con quien tiene 7 hijos y reside en un sector de Cofradía Cortes. Anteriormente vendía tortillas pero en busca de obtener mejores ingresos decidió vender ropa como ser: blusas, Camisas, short, pantalones, y ropa de niños. Ella vende su mercadería de forma ambulante y por pedidos. Solicita un préstamo por 3,500 lempiras para comprar un lote de ropa de blusas, ropa de niños y pantalones para vender en esta época de navidad, con el fin de incrementar sus ventas e ingresos. Doña Florencia tiene como sueño tener un propio local para establecer su negocio.
texts.en: 65-tear-old Florencia lives in a district of Cofradía Cortes with her husband, with whom she has 7 children. She previously sold tortillas but, as she wanted a higher income, she decided to sell clothing such as blouses, shirts, shorts, trousers and children's clothing. She sells her goods from door to door and takes orders. She is applying for a loan of 3,500 lempiras to buy a batch of clothing - blouses, children's clothing and trousers - to sell during the Christmas period so that she can boost her sales and income. Florencia's dream is to have her own premises in which to set up her business.

loans.use: to buy blouses, trousers and children's clothing.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es un hombre trabajador de 57 años de edad, que vive con su esposa y su hijo de 12 años de edad. Él se dedica a la venta de medicinas naturales y vitaminas desde hace 18 años, lo que le permite contar con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos. Mercedes desea invertir en productos para su venta de medicamentos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: vitaminas, medicina natural, entre otros productos para su venta de medicamentos. Con el crédito anterior él logró encementar el piso de su vivienda.
texts.en: Mercedes is a hardworking man aged 57 who lives with his wife and his 12-year-old son. He has been engaging in selling natural medicines and vitamins for 18 years, and so he can count on a significant number of customers requesting his products. Mercedes wants to invest in more products for his medicine sale, and for this reason he is asking a loan to FUSAI to invest it in vitamins and natural medicines for his activity. He has used his previous loan to pave the floor of his house.

loans.use: buy vitamins and natural medicines.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells soda, sugar, flour, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are locals.

Eunice describes inadequate working capital as her biggest business challenge. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of soda, flour, sugar, and other items.

This is Eunice's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soda, flour, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie, 39 years old, is married and has three children, all presently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past two years, Rosemarie has operated a business buying and selling crabs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more crabs, shrimp and other materials for her business. Rosemarie would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more crabs, shrimp and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 64 years old, and she is widowed with 7 children. Tessie works very hard to provide for them.

Tessie runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, drinks, snack foods, and shampoo, as well as other products.

Tessie has been in this business for 7 years. In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, drinks, snack foods, and shampoo, as well as other products.

loans.name: Doris Evelyn

texts.es:
Doris, de 36 años de edad, está casada, tiene tres hijos que estudian en la escuela de la comunidad y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, vive con su mamá y económicamente dependen de ella.

Doris, se dedica a la comercialización de productos lácteos como crema, cuajada, requesón y queso en la comunidad, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 10 años, ella vende el producto casa por casa.

Doris, necesita el préstamo para comprar queso porque es un producto no perecedero y además es el que le genera más ganancia.

Doris, sueña con tener una distribuidora de productos lácteos, para que sus hijos puedan estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Doris, 36, is married and has three children who are in school in her community. Her husband works in agriculture. She lives with her mother and depends on her economically.

Doris makes a living selling dairy products like cream, curd, cottage cheese and cheese in the community. She's had the business for 10 years and sells products door-to-door.

Doris needs the loan to buy cheese because it is a non-perishable product and also because it earns her more income. She dreams of being a distributor for dairy products so her children can study a career at university.

loans.use: to buy cheese because it is a non-perishable product.

loans.name: Maria Areli

texts.es: María, de 47 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, vive con su hijo en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Ella lleva dos años de tener su propio negocio como su única fuente de ingresos.  El negocio lo tiene instalado en un local del mercado donde vende ropa como ser camisetas, pantalones, Jean, ropa íntima. Además vende zapatos, maquillaje y lociones.  Ella solicita la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras para invertir en la compra de más ropa como ser camisetas, jean, blusas, camisas y calzado, para surtir su negocio y poder incrementar sus ventas en esta temporada de fin de año. Su meta es crecer como comerciante, ampliar su negocio y ayudar a su familia a seguir progresando.
texts.en:
María is a 47-year-old single mother. She has one son and lives with him in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. She has had her own business for two years, which is her only source of income. The business is located in premises in the market where she sells clothes such as t-shirts, trousers, jeans and underwear. She aso sells shoes, make-up and lotions.

She is asking for a loan of 15,000 Lempiras to invest in buying more clothes, such as t-shirts, jeans, blouses, shirts and footwear to stock her business and be able to increase her sales in the end of year season.

Her goal is to grow as a shopkeeper, expand her business and help her family to keep progressing.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as t-shirts, jeans, blouses, shirts and footwear to stock her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.fr:
Victoria a 37 ans, elle est mariée. Son mari travaille comme chauffeur. Le couple a deux fils qui sont âgés de 13 et 8 ans et ils sont tous scolarisés. 
Elle vend des tissus de qualité depuis 17 ans . Elle dispose d’un point de vente au marché. Le développement de l’activité dépend de la quantité et de la qualité des tissus.  Compte tenu de ses expériences, elle connaît bien le marché. Cette activité, exercée depuis 1998, lui a permis  de subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Chaque jour, elle part de son domicile très tôt et ne revient qu’à la fin de la journée  en raison de l’activité. Le couple prévoit de construire une maison et de déployer ses efforts pour la réussite des enfants dans leurs études.
texts.en:
Victoria, age 37, is married to a driver and the couple have 2 sons ages 8 and 13 who both go to school.

Victoria has been selling quality fabrics for 17 years. She has a stall at the market. The expansion of her activity depends on the quality and quantity of the merchandise that she holds. Given her experience, she knows the market well. She has been practicing this activity since 1998, and it has allowed her to help support her family. Every day, she leaves her home very early to return late in the day.

The couple plan to build a house and to ensure that their children pursue their studies successfully.

loans.use: to buy various types of fabrics such as solid and print muslin, alpage, cotton, and duchess.

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos, su gente es alegre y le gusta disfrutar de todas sus festividades organizando concierto y bailes populares en el mes de julio. 
En este Cantón vive y tiene el negocio la señora Zoila una mujer luchadora ella viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos, sus padres no le pudieron dar el estudio; es madre soltera vive con sus dos hijos quienes le ayudan con los gastos, ella se encarga de cuidar a sus nietos.
La señora Zoila se dedica al reciclaje de todo tipo de plástico a esta actividad le dedica un promedio de 6 horas diarias recorriendo todo el Cantón, pero la ventaja que tiene es que varios de los locales de electrodomésticos le llaman para que se lleve el cartón y hojas sin cobrarle; también recoge chatarra y una vez que junta gran cantidad de este material llama a la empresa de reciclaje y ellos vienen directamente a su domicilio a llevarse todo. De esta forma Doña Zoila ha sabido sacar a su familia adelante.
Este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de activos para el hogar y negocio de esta forma espera que sus ingresos mejoren ya que necesita seguir trabajando por ella y sus nietos.
La señora Zoila agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
The people of San Miguel de los Bancos are cheerful and enjoy all their celebrations organising concerts and traditional dances in July.

This is where Zoila lives and runs her business. A determined woman, she comes from a relatively poor family and her parents were not able to pay for her to have an education. She is a single mother and lives with her two children, who help her with the household expenses. She looks after her grandchildren.
without charging her for it.
Zoila recycles plastic of all types and works for an average of 6 hours a day, during which she travels all around the canton. She has an advantage in that several household appliance dealers call on her to take away the cardboard and paper without charging her for it. She also collects scrap and, when she has a large quantity of it, she calls the recycling company and they come to her home to take it all away. This has enabled Zoila to support her family.

She will use the loan to buy products for her home and her business. She hopes that this will enable her boost her income as she needs to continue working for her own sake and for her grandchildren.

Zoila is grateful to Kiva for the help and support they have provided.

loans.use: to buy household appliances which she badly needs in her home and which will improve her grandchildren's lifestyle.

loans.name: Brenda Lisseth

texts.es:
Brenda, de 21 años de edad, está casada, aun no tienen hijos, ella es enfermera de profesión, pero aún no ha encontrada empleo y su esposo trabaja reparando carreteras.

Brenda, se dedica a la crianza de ganado, los cuales lleva al potrero en la mañana y por la tarde regresa para llevarlas al corrales, en total son 5 vacas; desde su niñez ella criaban ganado para  tener ingresos y tiene dos años de tener su propio ganado he incluso ha aprendido a vacunar y a darles el cuido necesario para que su ganado crezca en poco tiempo.

Brenda, necesita el préstamo para comprar dos toretes, los cuales en un año ya se podrán enyugar para hacer una yunta para vender y con el dinero invertir en más ganado.

Brenda, sueña con encontrar un trabajo acorde a su profesión para mejorar sus ingresos y tener un trabajo estable.
texts.en:
Brenda, 21, is married with no children. She's a nurse by trade, but still hasn't found work, and her husband works repairing roads. Brenda earns a living raising cattle, which she takes out to pasture in the morning and returns in the afternoon to take them to corrals. In total, there are five cows.

Since she was a child, she's raised cows to have income and has had her own cattle for two years. She's learned to vaccinate them and give them the care necessary so they grow quickly. Brenda needs the loan to buy two bulls, which she can yoke in one year to make a team she can sell and invest the income in more cattle.

Brenda dreams of finding work in line with her profession to improve her income and have a stable job.

loans.use: to buy two bulls.

loans.name: Sokorm

texts.en:
Sokorm is from Banteay Chmar, a village in northwestern Cambodia. She is 21 years old. She lives in a wooden one-floor house with her relatives. Her family owns 2 hectares of rice fields.

In 2014 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for the empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in their village.

Sokorm makes scarves that are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her own expenses and to help her mother pay for the fertilizer for their field.

Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and for preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand-woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation and related fees.

loans.name: Deicy Fernanda

texts.es:
El Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos   está ubicado al noroccidente de la Provincia de Pichincha en el mismo tenemos el Recinto Unión Bolivarense un lugar  tranquilo de clima cálido húmedo su gente es muy unida y trabajadora. 
En este Recinto vive con su hijito de 4 años la señora Deicy, una mujer luchadora que día a día busca salir adelante por ella y por su pequeño hijo, ella se dedica a la producción de leche tienen varios años de experiencia en esta actividad a la misma le dedican un promedio de 8 horas diarias ya que también se dedican a la producción de cerdos y cacao vive en casa de sus Padres pero es independiente son una familia muy unida.
La señora Deicy solicita este crédito para comprar una vaca lechera y aumentar la producción de leche de esta manera mejorará sus ingresos económicos y podrá dar a su hijo un mejor futuro quien es su  razón de seguir adelante.
La señora Deicy  agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad que le están brindando para salir adelante y poder tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
The San Miguel de los Bancos Canton is located to the northwest of the Pichincha Province. In this province, we have the Unión Bolivarense Precinct, a tranquil place with a warm and humid climate. Its people are very united and hard-working.

In this Precinct Deicy lives with her little 4-year-old son. She is a determined woman who day to day looks to get ahead for herself and for her small son. She makes a living from milk production. They have many years of experience in this activity, the same to which they dedicate an average of 8 hours a day since they also make a living from pig and cocoa production. She lives in the home of her parents, but she is independent. They are a very close family.

Deicy is requesting this loan to purchase a milk cow and increase the milk production. Thus, she will improve her economic income and be able to provide a better future to her son, who is her reason for carrying on.

Deicy is thankful to Kiva for the support and the opportunity that they are providing to her to get ahead and to be able to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and to be able to increase the production, and thus be able to provide a better future to her son, who is her reason to get ahead.

loans.name: Jasser Efren

texts.es: Su pasión por el campo es lo que llevo a Jasser a estudiar Ingeniería Agropecuaria, su mama es su principal apoyo y desea culminar su carrera y ser un profesional de éxito. Jasser solicita un crédito para comprar una computadora y entregar de manera rápida y con calidad los trabajos asignados en su universidad.  Dentro de sus planes futuros esta establecer su propia empresa y ser alguien reconocido en el mercado.
texts.en:
His passion for the countryside is what prompted Jasser to study Agricultural Engineering. His mother is his main supporter and his wish is to finish his degree and be a successful professional. Jasser is asking for a loan so he can buy a computer and submit his university assignments quickly and with quality.

His future plans are to establish his own business and be well-known in the market.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Yanira Arely

texts.es: Yanira de 42 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida, su hija de 15 años y sus hijos de 5 y 7 años de edad. Ella es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora quien se dedica a la venta de medicinas naturales en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su comunidad. Este negocio le permite obtener los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos del hogar y ofrecerle todo lo necesario a su familia. Yanira en busca de aumentar sus ganancias solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: vitaminas, suplementos alimenticios, energizantes, etc. para poder aumentar las ventas en su negocio.
texts.en: Yanira is 42 years old and she lives with her life partner, her 15-year-old daughter and her sons aged 5 and 7. She is a very responsible and hardworking person who engages in selling natural medicines in the market located close to her community. This activity allows her to earn the money she needs to pay for her household expenses and to provide her families with everything they need. Yanira is trying to increase her income, and for this reason she is requesting a loan to FUSAI to invest it in buying vitamins, food supplements, energy drinks, in order to increase her sales volume.

loans.use: buy vitamins, food supplements and energy drinks.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest of Cambodia. She is 44 years old. She lives in a wooden pile house with her mother. Her one child is 26 years old and works in Thailand.

In 2002, Sophea was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training and offering them sustainable work in the village.

Sophea makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for daily expenses. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to both buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand-woven scarves!

loans.use: to both buy silk and pay for loom preparation fees.

loans.name: Aparicio Balmore

texts.es: Con 28 años de edad, Aparicio es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador quien se gana la vida gracias a un negocio que tiene con sus molinos de nixtamal, el negocio lo tiene instalado en su vivienda y ya que cuenta con varios años de prestar este servicio todas las personas de su comunidad lo prefieren. Esto le permite poder obtner los ingresos necesarios para cubrir los gastos del hogar. Aparicio en busca de poder mejorar su calidad de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de un molino para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Además se encuentra muy agradecido con el crédito anterior ya que gracias a ello pudo invertir en su negocio en la compra de un molino más, lo que le permitió aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
At the age of 28, Aparicio is a very responsible and hard-working man who earns a living through his business of nixtamal mills (nixtamal is an ingredient to make tortillas). The business is located in his home and he already has several years of providing this service to all the people in his community.

This allows him to obtain the income necessary to cover his home expenses. Aparicio is asking for a loan through FUSAI in search of improving his quality of life, so he can invest in buying a mill to give better service to his customers. He is also very grateful for his previous loan, so that he could invest in buying one more mill for his business which helped him increase his earnings.

loans.use: to invest in buying a mill so he can give better service to his clients.

loans.name: Tomasa Del Carmen

texts.es: Tomasa es una mujer trabajadora de 38 años de edad que vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos de 20, 13 y 3 años de edad a los que siempre busca la manera de brindar lo mejor. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos básicos en su vivienda, en la que ha instalado una pequeña tienda, además vende productos de belleza por catálogo, lo que le permite obtener mejores servicios. Tomasa desea invertir en su tienda y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lácteos, granos básicos, golosinas, bebidas frías, entre otros productos para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a hard-working, 38-year-old woman who lives with her husband and their 3 children, aged 20, 13 and 3. She is always looking for ways to better support them. She earns a living through selling staple goods in her home where she has installed a small shop, as well as selling beauty products by catalogue which means she gets better services.

Tomasa wants to invest in her shop and so she has asked for a loan through FUSAI to invest in products to stock her shop, including: dairy products, staple grains, sweets, cold drinks and other products.

loans.use: to invest in stock for her shop, including: dairy products, staple grains, sweets, cold drinks and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like two bags of rice, five bags of charcoal, etc.

loans.name: El Sol Group

texts.es:
Gabriela es una joven mujer de 21 años, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 2 meses y otros de 2 años, y su negocio es la venta de productos por catálogo.
Ella es alegre, optimista y muy feliz. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por acoger a la mayor parte de la población y por la producción manufacturera.
Gabriela es de tez morena, cabello castaño obscuro lo usa largo y físico delgado (al centro, viste camiseta rosa, minifalda de jean), su lengua materna es el Guaraní que sólo habla en reuniones familiares y habla español por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que aún no están en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto propiedad de la familia construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. la necesidad por mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar la banca de personas, los negocios de los socios mejoraron, pudieron comprar materia prima y realizar el pago de sus insumos, su negocio es la venta de artículos de catálogo como; productos de plásticos (envases, botellones, tapers y otros) y cosméticos (como; lápiz labial, pintura de uñas y perfumes), “empecé un micro emprendimiento, con muchas ganas de trabajar y tener mi propio negocio y sobre todo poder vender que es lo que me gusta sin descuidar mis pequeños niños…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque brinda oportunidades de pago y planes cómodos para que sus clientes sigan comprando. La ventaja de su negocio es que la mayoría de las ventas son a pedido, la desventaja es la falta de capital para comprar mercadería y venderla a crédito. Su sueño es darles estudio y bienestar a sus 2 hijos, ella desea comprar mercadería de catálogo por mayor para vender a crédito y otras formas de pago. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Gabriela solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería de catálogo para vender a crédito y brindar otras formas de pago.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a young 21-year-old woman. She is single with two kids, one who is two years old and one who is two months old. Her business is selling products from a catalog. She is cheerful, optimistic and very happy. She sells her products as a street vendor in the southern area of the city, which is known for housing the main part of the population and for its manufacturing production.

Gabriela is of dark complexion with dark-brown hair that she wears long, and a thin physique (she's in the middle of the photo wearing a pink shirt and a jean miniskirt). Her native language is Guaraní, which she only speaks in family gatherings. She uses Spanish at work. She shares her life with her children who are not yet of school age. They live in a room owned by the family, constructed of brick, and have potable water, electricity and plumbing.

The need to improve her business led her to head up a communal bank. The businesses of the members improved. They were able to buy raw materials and pay for their inventory. Her business is the sale of items through catalogs such as plastic products (containers, bottles, tupperware, etc.) and cosmetics (such as lipsticks, nail polish and perfumes). "I began a micro enterprise, with a great desire to work and have my own business, and above all to be able to sell, which is what I like, without neglecting my small children," she says. Her business is successful because it offers convenient payment plans so that her customers continue to buy. The advantage of her business is that the majority of her sales are from orders. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy merchandise and sell it on credit.

Her dream is to provide schooling and well being to her 2 children. She wants to buy catalog merchandise wholesale to sell on credit and through other forms of payment. This is the 3rd sequence of loans with the institution in the 2 years that she has worked in this business. For these reasons Gabriela seeks a loan to buy catalog merchandise to sell on credit and to offer other forms of payment.

loans.use: to buy catalog merchandise to sell on credit and to provide other forms of payment.

loans.name: Rosa Marleni

texts.es: Rosa cuenta con 42 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su hijo de 13 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una panadería, además ha instalado una tienda en su vivienda, lo que le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Rosa desea invertir en su tienda, para ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cereales, granos básicos, lácteos, embutidos, golosinas bebidas, entre otros productos. Con el crédito anterior Rosa construyo el baño y reparo la pila de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa is 42 years old and lives in a house on her property with her 13-year-old son. She is a hard-working woman who earns a living through providing her services to a bakery. She has also installed a shop in her home, which allows her to move her family forward.

Rosa wants to invest in her shop, so she can offer a greater variety of products to her customers, which is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI so she can invest in: cereals, staple grains, dairy products, cold meats, sweets, drinks and other items. With her previous loan, Rosa built a bathroom and repaired the sink in her home.

loans.use: to invest in: cereals, staple grains, dairy products, cold meats, sweets, drinks and other products.

loans.name: Miriam Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito Jocay se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Miriam tiene 50  años de edad, está separada y de esa relación  tiene 3 hijos todos ya mayores  de edad e independientes. 
Miriam es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y ganarse sus propios ingresos para no depender de nadie, para esto ella se dedica al comercio,  vende sabanas, edredones, almohadas, cortinas, entre otras cosas, su forma de ventas es puerta a puerta, ella sale casi todos los días  a vender y cobrar sus productos ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, ella  también vende  en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando desean algún producto de los que ella vende, lleva más de 10 años con esta actividad la cual comenzó con los créditos y que hoy le permiten ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, edredones, cortinas, entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva más de 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así empezó su negocio razón por lo cual está muy agradecida con la institución. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The Jocay Credit Group meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches which are visited in all seasons of the year y for being a city with unmatched beauty and many tourist attractions.

Miriam, 50, lives in this city, she is separated and from her previous relationship has 3 kids, all of whom are grown and independent.
Miriam is a woman who likes to rely on herself and earn her own income so as to not depend on anyone, for this reason she works in business, selling bed sheets, comforters, pillows, curtains, among other things, her method of sales is door to door, she goes out every day to sell and collect on debts, since she sells her products on credit and collects each week, she also sells in her house where her customers go when they want any of the products she sells, she's worked in this field for more than 10 years, she started with loans that today allow her to make a living.

This loan is to buy bed sheets, comforters, curtains, among other things she sells. She's been in the Credit Group for more than 10 years and likes it because it's how she started her business, the reason for which she is very thankful for the institution. Her dreams are to continue onwards.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets, comforters, curtains, etc.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Growing businesses both in the U.S. and abroad is something Daniel is very familiar with. With over 23 years of experience as a small business owner, he decided it was time to reopen his business after suffering through an illness.

Daniel has built a successful career fabricating barbecue pits, which are tailored to his customers in Corpus Christi, Texas.

“For me, this started off as a hobby that I did for my friends and family,” said Daniel. “I have been so fortunate to be able to turn my metal art hobby into a business opportunity.”

Business has picked up for Daniel, and he is in need of working capital to purchase more welding equipment. With his loan, he will not only be able to build healthy revenue for his business, but his customers will be able to receive their requests in a timely manner.

“I have a job that I enjoy going to every day,” said Daniel. “The most rewarding part is being able to support my family.”

loans.use: to purchase welding equipment.

loans.name: Bruno

texts.fr:
Bruno est un père consciencieux et responsable de 45ans. Il est marié  et sa femme dirige une petite gargote. Le couple a 4 enfants. Le premier, âgé de 23ans s’est déjà marié, et les autres encore à leur charge âgées respectivement de 21, 18 et 10ans suivent encore leurs études (universitaire, lycéen, et en primaire).
Bruno est dans la vente de sandales et de chaussures de fabrication chinoise. Il en est à son 4eme prêt avec CEFOR. Il a commencé cette activité en 2000. Il envisage de développer et étendre son affaire afin de pouvoir améliorer son revenu car sa priorité est de pouvoir continuer à financer les études de ses enfants. 
Ils ne paient pas de loyer mais vivent dans une maison d’héritage. Bruno est généreux et évolutif. Il a pour objectif, la construction de maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Bruno is a dedicated and responsible 45-year old family man. He is married, and his wife runs a small diner. They have four children. The eldest, 23 years old, is already married, but the others are still dependent on their parents. The three younger children are 21, 18 and 10 years of age and attend university, high school, and primary school, respectively. 

Bruno sells sandals and shoes produced in China. He is on his fourth loan with CEFOR. He launched this activity in 2000. He plans to keep expanding his business in order to improve his revenues, since his priority is to be able to finance his children's education. His family does not pay rent since they live in a house they inherited. Bruno is generous and adaptable. His goal is to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy pumps and sandals.

loans.name: Taujuanna

texts.en:
Taujuanna started Xquisite Staff in Montgomery, Alabama, three years ago when she realized a great need for more highly trained bartenders in her community. With ten years of experience in event planning and marketing jobs, she began to pull together a small group of excellent service industry staff. Since then, business has been great, and Xquisite Staff has begun to operate across the nation.

However, Xquisite Staff does much more than staffing. They also provide services such as event planning, program designs, invitations, strategic planning, management and experiential marketing.

“We are determined to work hard to deliver five-star services to represent your brand,” Taujuanna said. “‘The only time success comes before work is in the dictionary.’"
